IvlR8ANUXcxVbQ_4-1EQvw.text: Favorite restaurant, hands down. This place serves Italian food. They also serve sushi. They also serve ramen. Everything you try will be good. IMO the chicken Marsala is a can't miss item. It's like no other that you've ever had.   This is usually a very busy place. You will sit close to your neighboring table. Suck it up and enjoy. You'll see dishes you'll be envious of, you can meet a local, or you can just sit quietly and stare into your spicy goyza hotpot.   Don't worry about the line. It moves quickly. If you pass this up, you are missing out on a True Phoenix gem.

m6NqPU-nlpfZ06Oq1ZY8lg.text: I used to come here a lot when I first moved out to Phoenix. I realized every time I came they screwed up my order. I didn't care at first because I thought it was the only decent Japanese restaurant in the valley. But all things are replaceable.

wW-U9W-He0d_jvT_PhaH1Q.text: This place is awesome. It reminds me of a cozy kisaten in Japan. You can get pretty authentic Japanese food from sushi to pasta. Takana Ramen is the best I had in the valley. Every meal comes with fresh baked dinner rolls, salad with yuzu dressing (yum) and miso soup. Miso soup is almost like Moms. Great variety of menu items with reasonable price. You might not see Japanese chef there but the owner who has been in the business for like over 30 years is personally supervising everyday. Make sure to order strawberry shortcake... It is all so good :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of the best!! Must try!
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mano tofu was &#34;okay&#34;
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Takana Ramen

e3-NxncSiahY2z2BEs9MDQ.text: The food here is okay. I would come back if I was in the area and in the mood for Asian food, but it's not a place I'm looking forward to going to again. I ordered the seafood yakisoba. While I liked that there was a variety of seafood - squid, scallop, shrimp - the sauce wasn't very flavorful and a little on the oily side. My friend ordered the orange zest tofu with brown rice. I tried some and it tasted a little too sweet, but the tofu was cooked nicely (wasn't tough like some places make it).  As for the atmosphere of the restaurant, it's small and the noise level isn't too loud so you can easily hold a conversation with whoever you're eating with. But I don't think they have a great ventilation system because you can smell the smoke/cooking smells from the kitchen.

sRuuhrqwPTk06Bo1gL2g9w.text: Kids like the Ramen, I like the fact that I can get sushi, ramen, and pasta all at the same place.  Quick, and great service.

_Vy66-i95dzzEGpYH07bsw.text: I LOVE LOVE LOOOOOOOVE this restaurant! Me and my boyfriend decided to try something new for our anniversary so we found this place and have been frequenting here ever since. The service is always great the staff is friendly and the Sushi is the best in town!!! I'm not to into the noodle dishes personally but everything else is delicious! Definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves good food!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Unajyu
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Unajyu (grilled freshwater eel over rice)
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Katsu Curry rice plate

69hMYVkTDZX1RJn511eSgg.text: I ordered the Tan Tan noodles with vegetables. Not as spicy as the menu made it seem. The broth wasn't amazing & one of the guy waiters was rude & went out for like 3 smoke breaks the woke time we were there. The Koren BBQ was soooooo good! Kinda odd they sell italian and asian food. Id go back for the k bbq noodles.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tan tan men &amp; grapefruit beer

ZExyLR-UkogUQKA56l9-ew.text: The service for takeout have been excellent. If a waiter/waitress happens to be standing there, both times, they just said okay, looked at the takeout person and walked off. Very abrupt.   Two things I actually liked. The double shrimp crunchy roll. Standard roll I can get anywhere. This strawberry cheesecake that was more like a mousse filling than cheesecake.  Items I've tried and didn't care for: Orange Roughy with Orange Sauce, the fish was delicious, but the pile of rice I can only eat with the some of the orange sauce on it. The side salad that came with it was wilted and boring. Tan Tan-Me, this was okay. I felt like I was eating a spicy spaghetti soup. Not exactly what I was looking for. Korean Spicy Beef Asian Noodles, the beef was okay...no spice to it...the noodles where okay. The meal just looked thrown together and not appealing to the eye.  I don't think I'll be back...maybe for the dessert counter. I saw some other treats I wouldn't mind grabbing to go.

lanfEeUG4QJM-X4ZNw9HiQ.text: It's odd but both the Italian and the Japanese food is fantastic! They know noodles! If you r in the mood for Italian the salmon with spinach noodles is excellent! The beef Udon is delicious! The takana veggies are spicy and yummy! Also excellent is the dragon roll! They have a fun non-alcoholic drink menu good for the whole family!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The dragon roll is delicious!
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The shrimp shumai is good but that mustard gives it an unexpected kick so be ready!
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef Udon is excellent the noodles especially are delicious!

6LHu90o7oWgkiotZYuulug.text: I have been looking for Ramen Soup dish for a while, my wife found this place. So I told her let's check it out I would love to try it. Our first time there and believe me we will be back for some more. My little girls loved it , my wife was amazed and so was I with the flavor and the service. Very attentive and wonderful waitress took her time to explain to us the dishes they have. Well, I really recommend it we came out satisfied from Cherryblossom Noodle.. Love It !!

EwIZBaJjXhh336Og4M88lQ.text: I was craving sushi on a Saturday, so my girlfriend popped open Yelp to see what was in her neighborhood. We ordered a rainbow roll, Vegas roll and yakisoba noodle with tofu. Everything was terrific and totaled about $30.   Service was fast, despite being busy, and we were very curious about Milky Pepsi, though neither of us was brave enough to order it.

7YUgjU7gZ4CNa7NaULd95Q.text: Groovy concept, flawless service, nice variety, really cool drinks.  Get the plum soda. It's a small glass of some plum wine that'll knock your socks off, with a splash of club soda, and an "ume", some sort of small Eastern plum at the bottom. There are tons of sake based beverages, beer mixed with grapefruit juice or calpico (google it, n00bs), and some cool non-alcoholic beverages.  Then, there's the sushi. More than reasonable pricing for the location and decor. I was feeling awfully Arizonan that day, so I ordered the "baja norte" just to be brave and try a fun, albeit bastardization of sushi. Spicy yellowtail was actually spicy! Yay! It was just a *little* too salty, however. It was still a steal, and there are still a couple dozen other options if you're pretentious about experimental rolls like yours truly.  Apparently there's a ton of stuff here I need to try, and fortunately I can do just that without breaking the bank! Take a little detour from the light rail area and give Cherry Blossom a chance.

WofNBzckpQ35_rz04DMx1A.text: I really enjoyed this place! Our waitress was very friendly and attentive. My husband and I tried the miso ramen with salmon and the seared ahi tuna appetizer. My husband loved his seared ahi. He recommends squeezing lemon on the ahi tuna. The miso ramen was really flavorful. It was a little salty but not to the point where I couldn't enjoy it. I was a little disappointed that they only put two slices of salmon in the ramen but there were plenty of veggies to make up for it. It was very filling.  They even give you bread to start out with. Overall, it was a very pleasant experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Miso ramen with salmon! Very tasty. Ask for chili paste if you want to make it spicy

za-c4ah8JNDS7h3JczQWIA.text: Staff was awesome and worked quickly to help me. Food is amazing of course. Definitely coming back

3o0SzXhkZ6rtrQTw8ksdkg.text: This place is different bc they have Asian and Italian food. We all got different things but the Asian steak/beef salad and Italian dish (don't remember the name) were the best.   Seaweed on the sushi was a little too chewy for me but the spicy tuna seemed fresh.  I would stay away from the Pad Thai ( stick to the Japanese and Italian dishes).  Blueberry banana bread is pretty good too

KY9nJ-DFxTBWUBtSk91Itg.text: The ramen here is amazing.  I've had a few and they're all great. Hakata with an egg is great.  The gyoza is a must have.

VVgEIjUOjLhcrQXu7r4V2A.text: Ordered food to go.Soba noodles $8 base Charged $3 for chicken. .2 tiny pieces. Also charged  $1 for spinach ..literally 2 tiny flecks of spinach. And rice bowl w pork...also $8:00..pork was breaded And tough. Definitely no one in charge.Need quality control in their process.

s5sKsEQ9KFh1ymey3bA2Bg.text: Delicious place that had incrediblyyy delicious authentic Japanese pasta sauces (their concept of Italian food or sauces include flavors and textures that were foreign to me and super craveable.  A little out of the way in terms of location but yummmy!!

trvhX0DStrtkkqCQrTe11w.text: Co-worker introduced me to this little gem today for lunch. To sum the service and food into one word would be AMAZING! A little bit of everything-fresh sushi, udon and soba soups, Italian pastas, Asian noodle and ramen dishes made to order. I had the Pad Thai and my co-worker had the chicken katsu. Needless to say we will be back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Pad Thai and Katsu Chicken

ytR_Ju3FJTdQo2lyihDOmw.text: I've been coming to Cherryblossum for 3 years and it is always so consistently yummy! I love their ramen and udon dishes! Here in Phoenix because of school but so glad local AZ friends told me of this hidden gem! My go to dish is the Udon Suki. It has the best soup broth ever and the noodles are the perfect texture! The appetizers are awesome too! I always get the shrimp shumai and the summer rolls! The gyoza is awesome too! I always bring family and friends that visit Phoenix here and all of them have loved it!   Always a great time here!

EM6TB8AqwEIUtbhdiycoSA.text: If heaven has Ramen, then I hope it's from this place. Absolutely love their Cha-Shu Ramen. I've been coming to this place for quite some time and they never disappoint. Best place in town if you're looking for some Ramen or something else great to eat.

svZdcIzkti6MAriDETSc0g.text: The service was amazing! The people are friendly, very knowledgeable, and the food was fabulous! I had the tempura bowl for lunch. ot's rice with a little bit of teriyaki dressing, and has a combination of vegetables and shrimp that is fried. It was fabulous, and the breading is not very heavy at all!

MI_EYldpgUpYY_ilf3Xkww.text: Excellent spot. Unique Eurasian menu and ambiance. Highly recommend this restaurant in Central Phoenix.  Great Happy Hour too!

FOq7C7T0vQaLSX-6gCFAHQ.text: i love the sushi here- they even make me a salmon with avo no cucumber and not spicy.  everything i have had here was yummy.  wish it was a bigger place!

Bqqba6v5UzN7U0FIaibWOA.text: Come with time... it takes a while if you are here for the lunch time crowd.  the food is okay.  a little pricey for what you get.

sjJ6OzJbRpfoPNsBkYiyrg.text: I've been here probably 15 times. I usually order the beef udon dish. It's excellent! Their chicken parmesan is also so flavorful and impressive. The environment is quaint. Gives me a "hole in the wall" feel. This is my favorite noodle spot. Having been to Okinawa, Japan has made me kind of a noodle snob. However, Cherryblossom meets my craving :) YUM!

Rt2Vc2nq3tSBItJnwSIaUA.text: I love the Udon lunch special with the California rolls! Affordable and delicious! Will definitely recommend to my friends.. Also, I ordered the banana bread with blueberries and it's perfect! Not to sweet and just the right texture.. Moist and yummy!

xDh6aJLVUnLhZlL1mpIecQ.text: Food is about average, service is too bad. The waiter never told me they charge for hot tea when I ask for one, and it's the first time ever I heard a waiter ask me to get a menu myself from the basket by the door.

14d_D6l2NhEKOXn44Op4hQ.text: A great place for ramen.  The broth is very good.  The noodles are cooked perfectly.  I give it four stars only because I have yet to try other dishes.  As far as ramen goes five stars.

7o8zpIMcqeX5Xb1lKDt23g.text: Spicy Korean Beef was tasty. I had a work lunch at this place and the group liked the food. Service was ok and it got pretty busy around 12:30. I'd go back if I'm in the area again.

QQHHnIEuz2K4eB7ahgiq-g.text: One of my favorite restaurants in town. Love their sushi especially during happy hour. They're ramen is really good and I can say that proudly being a resident from Japan a while back ago. They also have Italian food which seems weird but I assure you it's really good. Those Mexican cooks can do it all lol!

BvDaDs3VEQEUKbhcUANbHw.text: Had a great lunch  bento box was very good our  service was also good would definitely recommend it

-hSBcYmCZZYlkHqoi5fazQ.text: This place is kind of a hidden gem.  You would not really expect a place like this.  The decor and menu is half Japanese, half Italian but it's mainly Japanese.  It's very clean, cozy, and charming feel to it with classical music played in the background.  I would say it's a perfect place for a 1st date.  1st time I came here was for the Ramen, which was pretty good.  2nd time, I had the yakisoba noodles, which was pretty good.  Otherwise, you can order the safe, bento boxes.  The menu is kind of long so you get a nice variety.  Interestingly they started serving Pho to which I have not tried.  I'm a little leery about trying the Italian portion since it's a Japanese place but maybe one day.  It's definitely a great lunch spot! I would come back for sure.

P2Eig9oToN5qFPPImDUg7g.text: Oh Cherry blossom cafe, how excited I was for trying you out.  But maybe I had too high expectations, but I really found it average, nothing special.  First off, the location is cute, and we were given quick and good service from the start.  We came here for lunch, and I ordered the pad thai noodles while my wife ordered miso soup lunch special which came with a California roll.  Good value for lunch and the pad thai was good, but I wasn't wowed by it.  Miso soup was good, hard to mess that up.  I would have liked to try more, but I was a little put off by the menu.  Well, you can order pad thai, Ramon, and chicken parm?  Hard to specialize in a wide variety of food.  Again, I think food was average, but it wasn't bad.  I just would rather go to a more authentic restaurant for my favorite noodle dishes next time.  Not a bad place by any means so try it out for yourself.

YJav9vmRRuRtqvim_nfMnA.text: This place was AWESOME!!!  My wife and I have been driving by this location for a couple years and finally decided to go in, I had a yearning for Ramen.  It did not disappoint.  We got there just before happy hour, which is always a bonus, but would still go outside of happy hour.  The menu is quite extensive, the bonus is they have Italian noodle dishes as well.  We have been told that this is authentic to Japan so I was impressed to see this in the valley, having been to many "Japanese" restaurants.  We decided to try many different dishes, and were equally impressed with all.  I had the TanTan-Men, a spicy Ramen with pork, delicious.  We shared some tuna sashimi, which was fresh and tasty (looked like real pink, no added color).  We also shared the Seafood Delight roll, which has tuna, 'krab' and is topped with a scallop, fantastic.  The last thing we ordered were the Spicy Korean Ribs, this was my least favorite, but still good.  Of course the Kirin (on draft) was flowing as well as the house Saki.  Overall the CherryBlossom Noodle Cafe impressed us to say the least.  We will be back to try more.  Thank you CherryBlossom, keep up the Great Work.

VHYYGMU_nGElDVozabto1Q.text: Great place, great blend of food, great prices, beautiful decorations and great staff. I've never been to an Italian/Japanese fusion restaurant and they definitely got the blend right. Our meals came with bread, salad and soup and was definitely worth the price. My only complaints are having to stand to wait, a slightly crowded feel and not the best parking. Otherwise I love it and would be back anytime.

6Tu_Frk7oY_3CT1lERNlCA.text: I am visiting PHX for the first time in many years and I assumed there would be no decent Asian places since they are very few Asians here in general, luckily I was wrong.  The menu is vast and oddly includes some Italian entrees (despite owner being from Japan), and we get bread/toast prior to getting our Japanese entrees.  I got the cold beef noodles cooked medium rare, they were soft, not too chewy, and the cold noodles were slightly on the firm side, just how I like them.  The noodles were served on top of some spinach which was kind of odd in a Japanese dish though.  The spicy tuna rolls were just 3/5, ok rice quality, fish was very average, overall not that exciting.  For PHX this is great asian food, I would come back here again if I come back to PHX.  However, it still doesn't compare to NYC or LA ramen places though.

58TGso5b5faN3GeIZFA2HA.text: This place is top notch!   I have tired almost every one of thier asian noodle dishes but have not got a chance to try thier pasta dishes (though they look delish!) I find myself crazing thier soup about once a week!   The employees are Cherry Blossom are super friendly and helpful. I get togo food from here every once and awhile and it is ALWAYS correct and hot when I come to pick it up.   My Tip: Get the Udon! SO YUMMY!!!! Beef, Chicken & Shrimp... they are all good!   Can't wait to go back!

nlgW4_E9i7-oztMykFsaHQ.text: I have been here numerous times and each time I have had fantastic service and yummy food! I generally opt to go for lunch because I can order a roll as well as their tempura bowl at a reasonable cost since it falls during their Happy Hour. I usually end up spending around $17 which for a meal of sushi isn't too bad compared to some chic trendy places that can charge $15 for a roll and then another $15 for an entree. I tend to like to eat a little of everything so whoever goes with me is always more then willing to order a roll for themselves and we share half and half. It definitely fulfills my craving for some sushi! I have always liked the location, it is a bit smaller but I really do enjoy the homey and inviting feel of the set up. I would absolutely recommend this place to a friend and people who I have taken there have enjoyed it themselves and frequent it with me.

Xp1XWf7_VcBUM2RqUHS7QQ.text: We have been coming to this place for years and it never disappoints. I just wish we could come more often! I've had some of the sushi and the miso with salmon ramen, which I definitely recommend! My daughter says this is her favorite restaurant. She loves the cha-shu ramen and a pork dish that I can't remember the name of, guess we will have to go back to find out!!!

BZxgbU6pR--9XzHSOFT8iA.text: Loooooove this place! I've been looking for a good place with awesome ramen, & the ramen here is prolly the best one I found. The base is good, the toppings aren't overwhelming, the price is affordable.. it's just plain awesomeness. They also have a variety of sushi & other plate dishes like Katsu for ur liking.   Definitely a 4 star for me - esp bc of their great service & parking!   PS. If you're reading this & got good recommendations for Ramen places in Phoenix, don't hesitate to message me!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy Hour Menu!
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cha-Shu Ramen

mUYsWXoSvMWCDyNw0IQImw.text: This place has very good and well-priced food. The only compliant I have is the workers here aren't the nicest. A friend and I went during happy hour and it was a very cute place! Inside is very nice and clean. I ordered the tempra shrimp udon and it was very good. The udons were soft and chewy and the soup broth was very good; not to salty which I like. The miso that comes with it was a little too salty for me. They have very delicious bread as well! Overall for 2 people, it was less than 20 dollars which was awesome! Really liked this place, will come again!

W_30SxvYcNz1IUCVx7r0ow.text: Yum noodles! We started with the gyoza and then my husband had the Korean spicy beef and I had the yakisoba. The food was so good we decided that we will go back often so we can try everything on the menu. Clearly, we recommend trying this charming cafe.

HcBbNllV-XGPDztXijwBDg.text: Ordered the tan tan men, the spicy tuna roll and spider roll. The tan tan men was disappointing. It felt nearly the same as a shin black from any Asian market. The cha-su we added on was tasty and the poached egg was perfect, but the broth was disappointing. The spicy tuna roll was average at best and the spider roll was good. Overall came away hoping for a better ramen and better sushi.

k-WqFcqRDX7Gk4Hvc_lX4w.text: Wonderful experience with great food and excellent service. Will definitely be back. Looking forward to our next visit.

lZ4qRBDpVuAvo79LAv1hIA.text: I really wanted to like this place due to the love for Asian food n all things noodle .. Ordered the chicken pad thai for lunch n it was just missing smthg. The chicken, tofu n spice level were on point but it was very dry, the noodles were a bit under done n it was sorely missing that sweet/sour/tart tamarind flavor that best defines pad thai. The staff was friendly so they get 3 stars n another chance!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken/Tofu Pad Thai

m359pQjA1aJ4_A-gB6IwzA.text: Love this place. Their happy hour menu is awesome. Can't beat their price and portion. It is worth visiting them. Great nigiri, rolls, ramen, and my favorite, Champon. You will not be disappointed. Try Champon.

YsWkc8zP_HEGYtdYElF5VA.text: Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink): 1 star:  Never again. 2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back. 3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad. 4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return. 5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.  I hate to burst people's bubbles, but the competition has caught up to Cherryblossom.  This used to be my go-to spot for ramen and udon in the Valley, and they have other serviceable dishes as well.  But if I'm going to be fair and compare it to the best there is here in the Valley and around the country, then the food here is pretty average.  One thing that's intrigued me is the Italian menu, which I have yet to order from.  But I suspect, given the rising quality of Italian in the Valley, that this would underwhelm me as well.  So I've had the ramen, soba, and udon here.  The hakata ramen and miso ramen here are fine, but the ramen is better at Tampopo and Dozo, and lightyears better at places around the country.  The udon is probably the best Japanese noodle dish they have here - the broth is clean and light with good thick noodles.  The zaru soba was also very average, most likely given that they use commercial soba noodles that are available to all of us.  I may just give a 1/2 star bump for their dessert.  Being Japanese, the desserts here are light and elegant and well-crafted.  Never overly-sweet.  So yes, a 3.5 star review for what really is a Phoenix institution but again, do not come expecting to have your mind blown.  Oh, and parking can suck here when it is busy.

38spE_nd8CBbMMFXZcOXrw.text: You know when your tastebuds just want something, something in particular, and there's just nothing else that will that satisfy them....Well, I was having big ol' RAMEN craving last night and not just any ramen, Clever Koi ramen. So I let my fingers do the walking and called them up for a takeout order and they were CLOSED...holiday. Insert sad face here.    So I turned to Yelp for another option and stumbled across Cherry Blossom.  My mind was really saying NO, just get something known and dependable but my tastebuds were saying YASSSSS.    Based on reviews I got the TanTan-Men and just in case I ordered a side of the panfried Gyoza. I ended up eating all of both. The TanTan-Men had heat, not unbearable but just the right amount...my only complaint was while it had heat, it did not have a lot of other flavor.  I added a little hoisin sauce and some salt and perfecto.  It wasn't overly salty to being with. The portion is very big.   This is definitely not as  "foodie" of a noodle bowl as the Clever Koi, but it did solve my craving, and they weren't closed for the holiday so I tried something new. If you are searching for a more authentic less foodie bowl of noodles this is your spot. The Gyoza were excellent as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gyoza / Takeout Edition
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. TanTan-Men / Takeout Edition
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Takeout was prompt and friendly

ilaUsQ-90HdofCIsXP01MA.text: It sort of hurts me to give this place 3 stars because it's been such a go-to spot for me and my friends for over 10 years. The food and lunch specials are still great and worth the price, but the service has really gone down over the last few times I've gone. So maybe it's more like 3.5 stars?  Like I mentioned, the food here is always good. You start off with a basket of rolls (but FYI!! they'll charge you a few dollars if you ask for more rolls). Way back when, it used to come with banana bread and a cinnamon toast. They have a daily lunch bento box for about $11, and it usually comes with more than enough food for one. I have not gotten any Italian dishes because I've tend to stick to the Asian ones - udon, ramen, rice bowls, etc, but my friend said they are good too.   Now, the service...is just no. Our last server didn't even smile once! She seemed miserable to be there, and we felt forgotten several times during our meal. For example, I had to personally ask for a to-go box and ask for our check because we had been sitting there for awhile now. Unfortunately, this isn't an isolated incident where service was just usually slow. Such a shame really!

imlhrWo1W5Vf7w9vWHW3AQ.text: Out of all the delicious restaurants in Phoenix, this restraunt is by far one of my favorites. Not only is it a mix of Italian and Asian food, but the food is always outstanding. I've been to this location a couple times and I've never had a bad meal. I usually always get Asian noodles and have failed to get Italian noodles, so I have yet to order something off of the Italian menu. Regardless, the food is never bad.       The atmosphere matches the service in my opinion; warm and welcoming. Everyone here is looking forward to greet you with a smile and some delicious food. As for the atmosphere, the decorations match the Italian/Asian theme of the cuisine of choice. The overall feeling of the restraunt is just warm and happy, especially around the holidays. Overall, 5/5, would highly recommend.

foHY-SohDlOfCoXMyMFpHQ.text: Apparently the combination of Italian and Asian food is common but was so odd to me. Either way-- reviews for this place were solid so we checked it out on a work trip. After a long day, all we wanted was some warm, comfort food that was filling. This did the trick! The spicy tuna to start was very yummy and then I got the vegetable pho- I am no expert but I loved it. Warm, flavorful, and filling. This place is also next to Snoh-- so what's not to love? Cute ambiance as well!

Onocbi7tHR7dM8j-l42V7w.text: favorites. Negihama roll (very small) Kake udon w extra green onion vegetable tempura Gyoza grilled salmon w ginger sauce rice and salad.  favorite server is yuka. shes been serving for many many years and wont disappoint.

8XW1lMv5ycFh0IiMZUsWTQ.text: Service was decent, the food was ok. I ordered Hakata ramen and got the Cha-Su. I had also ordered hard boiled egg in the ramen and was not there. The server brought it on the side but the inside was cold. The beer was the best part of the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Asahi beer was absolutely delicious. Was so cold it had just a tad bit of ice on top.

X8SJV_9HuYXfPLTaRJnSEw.text: With this cool weather, I had a hankering for a bowl of hot ramen so to Cherryblossom I went.  I decided to take advantage of the Happy Hour and got the Salmon Nigiri which came with 3 pieces and ordered the Hakata Ramen with an extra egg.   The Salmon Nigiri was actually really good, soft and fresh tasting. The rice was a bit on the wet side so didn't keep it's form well under the Salmon. However, the flavor was there and tasted best with a touch of wasabi and a light dipping in soy sauce.  The Hakata Ramen was pretty basic, I can tell they use powdered broth for their ramen as my tongue got a little bit funny feeling from the MSG. It comes with stick straight ramen, green onion, char-shu, wood-ear mushroom (ki- kurage) and my side order of egg- poached. The broth is Hakata style, made with pork bones and appears creamy, fatty and white in color. Though it is Hakata style, the flavors aren't complex as other ramen I've had and as I've stated was apparent they use a soup base mix/powder. The noodles were okay- though not always a fan of stick straight noodles, but the portion was just right. The char-shu was on the thicker side, but seasoned well. The egg, I wish was soft boiled instead of poached and lacked seasoning/flavor. Another thing that bugged me was that the ramen wasn't hot, it was warm ... perhaps sitting out in the pass a little too long?  Over all I would come here for more Nigiri and pass on the ramen, the ramen is doable for the price point but nothing to get overly excited about. Thus far, their pasta and sushi seems the most promising here.  The service is also pretty good as everything is friendly and quick!

OPweBs6VPUmYNcCAX0oQ4A.text: Omg this place is amazing... The restaurant may not look like much on the outside, but inside it's lovely. Great customer service, nice ambiance.The prices are very affordable to. When you first walk-in you wouldn't think that.

ma8Sv1XVGLAI9wuTeMO_Hw.text: Ok, recommended by a co worker, but sincerely I was not impressed. Tried the seafood roll, maybe next time I'll try a ramen soup, those look good on the next door table. They serve pasta and bread at this location, so I don't know how authentic Japanese this is :/

PKTRP6KI4-q9WAcaxrMKeA.text: Amazingly strange combination of Italian food, sushi, and more! I have a fish allergy so cannot eat sushi, but my husband loves sushi. This place has excellent food for both! My husband loves the sushi and I love everything else on the menu. The staff is super friendly and kind. I love the cozy feel of the place, but it is usually pretty busy! They have a great happy hour too.

MROHHIhZxM040DGlqXwT3w.text: This spot is and has been a favorite for me and my mom for years. I have recommended this restaurant to so many friends. The kitchen food is great, sushi is great, dessert is amazing.... Only problem ever is the staff. The veterans make up for the weaker staff because they are so friendly, but newer servers need to step it up. It's a small restaurant and it gets busy, but I have had multiple poor experiences.. never because of the food.. but because of an awkward unexperienced server.

FphrAHiW8iPwGV14FkLsJw.text: I always order Katsudon since I loved those growing up. Theirs isn't bad, depending on the cook I believe -- I've had it when it's flavorful and had it when it's bland. I'd still keep ordering it though if I do have a craving.   I tried their ramen. The tantan-men is spicy. A little bit too spicy for my taste. I tried the Hakata ramen and it wasn't bad. It just didn't blow me away either.   I'd still stop by if I do have a craving for Katsudon.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hakata ramen to go
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Katsudon

ZAb-yjYKo7I1Z4y2sbM1VA.text: Went on a recommendation from a friend. The place was moderately busy. The food was 3.5 stars the service was a 3 only because she was nice and even offered to change my dish at no charge but was not very good at multitasking. Our table placement did not help either. It's like where the kids sit at Thanksgiving away from the adults. Overall I don't think i'd make the 30 minute drive again. Give it a try you may have a better experience than us.

4fMOzeRP9Qnnv9BOmAurPA.text: The chicken Marsala with spinach noodles is wonderful.  Always say yes when they ask if you want bread. You will want every bit of the sauce. All of the sushi is good. If anyone at the table has any dietary restrictions they will work with you. Everything is made fresh and to order.  Best to go at slower times of the day so you don't have to wait for a table.

fORb3ZRdJA6AldiMStVJjA.text: We go to Noodle Cafe anytime we can. Recently had lunch and the Crispy Calamari Salad continues to be amazing both in price and quantity.

YfrfuNAEfttbVX9k0vUYcA.text: The ramen is my favorite thing to get here , they make surprisingly good Italian food also. The sushi is ok , not great but the size and variety of the menu you can't have it all be amazing. If u have room get desert.

DoM6R_Ou1cpt3rdHRTOUmg.text: This place a variety of options to choose from which is great! My boyfriend got this tootsie roll and some ramen with meat. I got inari, a veggie roll and udon noodles with vegetables. I felt what I got tasted pretty bland but if i went again and got something else I would like it. Also they have vegetarian and vegan options! Which is a big plus for me

OQBZhIea2BjJ6mjnZh9jPg.text: This place is amazing, you MUST try it  Best Sushi and everything is super delicious!

y9uznyeHvjYneZy31KiHmA.text: Where has this place been all my life? Seriously. Eclectic menu. Everything done well here. Asian-Italian menu definitely sets them apart. Neighborhood place. Couples friendly but not exclusive. Families & singles there too. Simple. Loved the orchids--FYI: my fav flower. Tonight I was Lady without her Tramp, slurping up my angel hair, spinach pasta and savoring every bite of perfectly sauted shrimp, cheese and decadent cream sauce. Everything fresh, even though I slid in door at 5 min to closing, I was treated like royalty. I'll be back to try Asian next visit--and shaved ice for dessert at Snoh next door.

A1NMu9XOdq6pn23bQ06vLg.text: Based on the great Yelp reviews, my boyfriend and I decided to try Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe, and we felt happy with our decision.  Because other reviewers raved about the shrimp dumplings, the Korean spicy beef, and the cha she ramen, we decided to share them. Everything was yummy. My boyfriend REALLY liked the spicy beef, while I preferred the shrimp dumplings.  The service and atmosphere were really nice, too.  We will return to try other menu offerings soon!

zjqUmWp-3VtHiqSOB68kCA.text: The best pasta I have ever had was when I visited Japan. I wont say that this place match food in Japan (fresh ingredient isnt easy to come by in the middle of the desert) but if u want to try the taste of authentic japanese/italian mixed noodles give this place a try. Also i recommend trying something else rather than ramen. Not that the ramen isnt good but there is other ramen place out there. This place have other noodle dishes u cant get in typical "japanese" restaurant in az, be adventurous and u might fine something yummy u have never tasted before.

ZSyCefpmyYa1MUGRy_gHLA.text: Had my first-ever bowl of ramen here and boy was I missing out! I got their shoyu ramen which was delicious! The decor at this place is very ecclectic and adds to the homely vibe. I would reccomend this place to anyone who asks.

Hn2svoNQE5pLx-RUK8WXiA.text: I find myself at CherryBlossom a lot nowadays, and that's why I needed to update my review. I've discovered my new favorite menu items, and they must be eaten! So, you should try:  Spicy Gyoza Pot Cha-shu Ramen TanTan-Men Ramen Udon Suki  The gyoza pot is my favorite menu item (and it's on happy hour).  It's simple and delicious. I am completely satisfied with a Kirin and the gyoza pot for dinner. The Cha-shu is a damn good bowl of ramen, and the TanTan is even better if you're up for something spicy. My newest discovery, and the reason I needed to write this, is the Udon Suki. It consists of udon noodles, tofu, green onions, sliced beef, and a poached egg floating in a savory broth. CherryBlossom's Udon Suki is awesome, filling, and awesome.  I have come to the realization that the service is hit or miss at this place, but in my opinion, the food makes up for any shortcomings. Go try some of the dishes I just mentioned and let me know what you think!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Udon Suki

HtUOobxgy6iUkwu3mvZXTA.text: This place was SO good! It was super busy so we sat at the bar and got to see all the food come out. We couldn't decide what to order because everything looked amazing. We ended up splitting the ramen and pork katsu. I don't know what they did to the rice but it was delicious. Can't wait to come back and try new thing.

O4ZIr-C78bbTeEnNspmMsQ.text: Food is five stars all day but the service was crap. Our server (tall white dude with kinda long hair) is the worst server ive ever encountered. No smile, sounds like napoleon dynamite when he talks, also kinda looks like him with straight hair.  Im a server and i do not recommend this guy. Had him as a server twice and its been the same ol shit

WBmbS1049NN9ci6tvU87OA.text: I've been here a few times now, getting the Cha siu pork ramen. It's good, however, I wanted to try something different last night. I ended up ordering the chap chae appetizer which are these potato noodles and vegetables and that dish was delicious!! I loved it. And for my meal, I ended up ordering the katsu don, which is like a pork fritter served with an egg and onions on top of a bowl of rice. I generally love katsu don and this was one of the best I've had. I love how the juices flow to the bottom, and your last bite is this very flavorful rice. So I love this more than the ramen, and is a dish I'd recommend!

Wbxcr9WN1tcAWyB1IWnpHQ.text: Food was good, not great...service was REALLY not great.  We had to ask for our appetizer that came out 3 mins before our food.

jFIhRIqFEnL1hS-MQfPsoQ.text: Came here to celebrate our daughter's 30th B-Day and brought both family, friends and the grand kid. She ask to go here and then next door afterwards for some Snoh. Sounds good to me.  Inside is simple and cozy with a casual rustic Japanese theme in the background. The menu here is rather large and offers both Japanese and other Asian specialties as well as a separate section with famous Italian pasta dishes. Interesting!  Started with some appetizers. Potstickers, Vegetable Tempura, and a couple rolls of Sushi. Pretty good so far. Next ordered the main courses. Some of the group went Korean style while others did Japanese.  Ordered some Yakiniku Beef extra spicy, Ten-don Shrimp Tempura with special sauce on Rice, Chicken Katsu, Korean Spicy Beef with Egg Noodles and my favorite the Nabeyaki Udon Seafood Iron Pot which was my selection.  Everything was tasty and we had a lot of fun. Service was friendly and very helpful. Even made the 2007 New Times for Best use of a Noodle.  Gets REALLY BUSY FAST and a little cramped when full. We arrived at 5pm on a Saturday and it was perfect. By the time we were done eating it was packed.   Feed your NOODLE and ENJOY!

odp2Wm-Yx9AnyHcE-w2XGQ.text: Excellent ramen and sushi! Place is small and can get a long wait so get there early. Highly recommend the spicy ramen and miso ramen.

XuKMG68-eW0pIGPZ3s0Tvg.text: The restaurant features a menu as eclectic as its directionless, yet somehow a bit charming, decor (picture a British phone booth facing a red-brickwalled hallway and Japanese elements mixed in throughout); it's a blend of Italian and Asian pasta dishes, from which I've only ventured through the Asian portion of the menu.    The Asian noodles here can be outstanding and the selection is one of the best in central Phoenix, but there's not much more reason to come here.  My favorite is the beef udon suki, with chewy, thick noodles and lots of beef and flavor. The ramen dishes are passable, although not the best in the Valley (noodles are a little too thin and a bit overcooked, broth is a bit lacking in flavor, although still robust and meaty enough to be pleasant).  Skip the tantan-men, which is billed as a spicy soup and tastes like little more than that:  spice in soup.  As for rice dishes, the katsu is decent, but avoid most of the appetizers:  shrimp shumai were mushy and flavorless, the Korean spicy rib lacked the spice, richness, and tenderness you'd want from a dish with that title, and the gyoza are less than noteworthy.  The lunch special is another great reason to come here:  for under $10, you can get a filling combination, like your choice of noodle soup with inari or a California roll.  Although the sushi isn't a reason to visit Cherryblossom and the California roll isn't something I'd jump at ordering even at my favorite sushi joint, it's a great deal.  And when you're really there for the noodles anyway, how can you beat that?

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Udon suki.

0E8AD24Mio5TJDvuybGfQQ.text: The food here is fantastic. The service here is terrible. Somehow, every time we go we get the same waiter who sounds just like Napoleon Dynamite and sounds pained every time you ask him something. He's been just generally unpleasant every single time we've gone over the past 4 years, he's never been kind or friendly and has given us smart ass answers a few times when asking about ingredients. Went in the other day and he was REALLY short with us; when the food came I asked him for some soy sauce to which he said "OKAY.", then walked off in the wrong direction and never brought it, didn't refill our drinks once, come by at all or bring the check.  Onto the food! It has never disappointed. Their udon dishes are savory and delicious, and the broth is out of this world. Their rolls are fresh and their pasta is also very tasty. There's an odd combination of food here but they make it work so well.   So, I guess the tl;dr is to eat at Cherryblossom at night and not during lunch time.

O-kKhuW24p9IYnldSOwOkQ.text: A ad on a the Middle East radio forum reminded me about this hidden little place.  I stopped in for lunch and the options were quite unique. I had a miso base ramen with salmon in it. What a great combo for 6.95 The miso was light and the noodles were firm the salmon was poached in the broth and full of salmon flavor.   The meal came with bread and a few sweet things not a match but good non the less.  Good food wide variety give it a try.

pWjMcSkLxBYukzdhWoM2_g.text: What happened to this place. I have not been here like a year, and everything went down the hill. No more banana bread  First, Bad Service. We stood up for 5 minutes in front of main door while inside was not crowded. Waiter did not bring us a bread. i had to ask twice. Order was slow. I saw our food waited in the counter at least 10 minutes. I was ready to go and pick it up.  Sushi quality was bad. Yakisoba noodle was burned.  Well, I used to go this place alot, but I will never go back again. What happened to Japanese culture - Being fast , efficent and respectful ?  I will never come back, there are lots of nice places in nort phoenix. just go check it out like Tokyo lobby, yen sushi. It will worth a drive, and   SAYANORA Cherry Blossom

t_GetYUDOs8VbBdR7hPNQA.text: They have really fresh sushi.  It's a great little place for lunch.  Very nice staff.

2Vpm1iXvD-sKonP0NmT0KQ.text: This was one of the few times Yelp has led us wrong. Came here because it was close by & had 4 stars.   I will say the service was perfectly fine. Our server was very friendly & even though it was busy, we were greeted at the door & sat quickly.   Unfortunately, it was downhill from the point we got our food. We ordered an assortment of rolls & a dish of pad Thai. The sushi choices almost all include cream cheese &/or tempura, which made it difficult to choose a variety without everything tasting similar.  The sushi all tasted fishy. I don't think it was unfresh, but it certainly didn't taste fresh either. It was somewhere in between the two...if that is possible. The presentation wasn't bad either, but the overall experience was tainted by the poor tasting sushi.

luzZ3cdUmWpi_MnOlzj4Vw.text: I'm relatively new to the phoenix area and my girlfriend was craving some ramen so we looked up this place and it sounded like sonewhere we wanted to try. At first glance its a tiny hole in the wall restaurant but after entering its actually a little bigger than it looked from the outside. seating is still relatively limited and we showed up right at lunchtime so we had to sit in a back corner but I stil diidnt feel cramped. the interior is kept clean and smells like a combination of good food and floral arrangements.  The food itself was really good. I wasnt disappointed with anything we ordered. I had a chasu-pork rice bowl that was delicious.It was a little on the small side as far as portions go but  it came with a small bowl of miso soup that was pretty tasty as far as miso goes. I also ordered a california crunchy roll which was great and for a good price $4 and change. my girlfriend ordered a bowl of tan tan men- bbq pork ramen that was a really generous portion in a larger bowl. The food was also served with some complimentary bread rolls and we had some sweet pink lemonade to wash it all down. All in all the food was great and we ended up paying only $26 which for a pretty good lunch. The service was great once we got to the table we were taken care of the entire time and the waiter was really nice.  I definitely recommend this place ad will be coming back.

1DsWOZ3BBN-ZGu-GDi7Tbw.text: I have one thing to say: Iron Pot.  This soup is AWESOME! It has everything in it and is absolutely delicious. I think it's like 9 bucks and is impossible to finish. What a deal!  Other than the Iron Pot, they also have some interesting sushi rolls. It's nice to find a place that has creative rolls rather than the usual.  Highly recommended. ALSO - you may want to make a reservation on Friday or Saturday night, this place can get packed quickly.

Jz17i8ofFbiMsdnjnaVkGQ.text: Been to this restaurant a couple times and finally decided to write a review..  I've tried their pad Thai, ramen, rolls, Korean noddles, green tea cake..  Among all of them I like the green tea cake the most cause its different and its not too sweet..  The staffs are very attentive but other then that the food is nothing to rave about..  Just average..

6nAF0_j8A8GZkzAD-Xm8QA.text: My favorite  noodle-arium.  I'm long, long overdue to write something on Cherry Blossom, (and could have sworn I had at some point) perhaps my single favorite restaurant in the area.  In dozens of visits, determinedly working my way up and down the noodles from pan-Asian to Italian, I have never been disappointed with a meal at Cherry Blossom, with the exception of a single mackerel dish which I found not as tasty as other dishes and which also left me hungry - something never done before or since at CBNC.      Last meal was Yakiniku, a "Korean style thin sliced beef dish with vegetables served on an iron skillet."  Moderately spicy hot, delicious, and $11.  It's billed as a rice dish - if only the brown rice had come out before the end of the meal.  Friend Norm ordered an appetizer with his meal - which he reported was really good - if only it had come out before end of the meal - They were apologetic and didn't charge for the late arrival, but still . . . it's the kind of thing that happens frequently enough to keep me from giving that 5th star that the food itself has generally consistently deserved over the several years I've been enthusiastically dining there.  Other great dishes: the thin sliced NY Steak with shitake mushroom sauce - tongue-burning sodium overload but the meat is a thing of beauty. Perhaps next time I'll try it with the sesame mustard sauce instead.  Don't think you like eel? Try theirs' - After a long ago year in China with a lot of rubbery eel and sea cukes that we referred to as "bicycle handgrips", I never thought I'd have a taste for eel (and I'm still not too confident about the sea cukes), but this is wonderfully prepared and absolutely delicious. Mark the Ika Yakisoba with calamari and vegetables on your list to try as well as the Korean Spicy beef and all the Asian noodle dishes. My housemate loves the Mixed Tempura dinner, though I find it a tad bland compared to my favorites.  Want something a little lighter but still filling, delicious, and out of the ordinary, try the Unagi salad with grilled freshwater eel and ginger dressing and most definitely the shrimp salad, a generous quantity of mixed greens with mango chutney  dressing on a large plate completely ringed by broiled (or fried?) shrimp with a mayonnaise dressing - It's a salad you'll want to remember to order again.   Skip to the Italian side of the noodle kingdom for a dozen (+1) delicious dishes ranging from the satisfying Marsala Chicken with Spinach Pasta in a rich, but not nauseatingly so, white cream sauce, to the Cajun Shrimp with Smoked Mozzarella, to a simple and also delicious Spaghetti Bolognese.  I can equally vouch for the Little Neck Clam in white wine  or marinara, among many other excellent offerings.    It's a small restaurant, frequently with waiting line for seating on weekend evenings, but the wait has rarely been long - and it's well worth it.  Go when you have time to relax and perhaps be a little patient.  Your drink glass may be dry for a while before anyone notices, or has time to, and the service, always courteous, can otherwise be a little erratic, but the food is so worth it!.  Most entrees range from $9-12 and there's few among the extensive offerings above $14.   Note that weekday lunchtime can be packed and hectic, and though the staff is literally running, it can take a while to get one's check and change.  Vaya con paciencia.

RZLlKcAE4Mio3VLNE2ELlg.text: This is by far the *best* noodle place in town! Their BBQ pork ramen is absolutely delicious, comes in a giant bowl, and the noodles are perfectly cooked. Try the Milky Green Tea-- it's my favorite drink on the menu. The owner is very pleasant, and if you can catch bits and pieces of what she's saying in Japanese- also pretty hilarious :)

dU56x7ppUHmNSVEIFBzNzA.text: Even though we make most of our meals at home, this place is a regular stop for me and my wife. We like to introduce friends now and then. There is an amazing amount of variety on their menu, and it's always good. We now have our favorite dishes and get one favorite and something new each time we go. We eat here at least twice a month.  Cherry Blossom has become one of our comfort-food places. Comparing to other specialty places in phoenix, their costs are good. They have good saki, miso, and other favorites.

COuDjdejkuDYgg4JxVlDEA.text: Wow, what an entrance! I felt like I fell through the rabbit hole. First, this place is in a kinda run down corner strip. Then, the front is super unassuming and all the (regular cheapy off-white) blinds are pulled down. If it wasn't for the small 'open' sign, you'd never know. The Japanese chain eatery next door was completely empty, so I thought Cherry Blossom would be the same. Opened the door and BOOM! How inviting! And effing crowded!!  I'm not from Phoenix, and I've been on a mission to find my new go-to Japanese restaurant. Thank you Android GPS for being my white rabbit and leading me here! Authentic and fusion Japanese. Plus Italian pastas. Plus plus house made desserts. Sake, plum wine, curious cocktails. Yes, of course I will eat you and drink you.  My belly ballooned with the Tekkadon (get it with sushi rice!) and chicken katsu. Plum wine with club soda was a great water substitute. I threw in the towel before I could get some cake, but I'll be visiting real soon.   Service was top notch. Prices are stupid reasonable.

jo2c3rnU99EmLsLs0gR7lw.text: I absolutely adore this place! The food there is just exceptional!   My favorites are the beef (and chicken) cold noodle and tuna bowl. I have to say this place serves the most tasty cold noodles that I haven't had in years! The tuna bowl is also my favorite. I recommend the sushi rice when order this dish. The tuna is fresh and the rice is very flavorful.   The sushi and Udon there are also very good. I strongly recommend this place as it has the best Japanese food in town.

VyVJ2zcB8NqybaaCGnR-AA.text: Went here for lunch today with three other people from work. It was packed but we were able to get a table in the back. They have some great lunch specials and I ordered the Shrimp tempura Udon soup with a California roll. The soup was good however it could have had a little more flavor. I ended up having to put in some soy sauce to liven it up a little bit. The California roll was right on and I enjoyed it. I also ordered a side if Gyoza (potstickers) and they were very tasty as well. I really like how the wrapping was thinner than most places. The bread that they give you when you sit down is very good.  They are hot and fresh yeasty rolls and it was hard to have just one. They also have a great selection of desserts as well as baked goods. I did bring home a slice of chocolate cake for hubby so I don't know how it is yet but it sure looks good! Service was very good and our waitress was very friendly and attentive. I would recommend this place and will definitely come back again.

mUuy3DWu_foyQs73MPE0Ag.text: I went to Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe for lunch at the recommendation of a coworker. The prices were reasonable, the portions were generous, and the service was pretty quick.

ECCk5y-1pRy3GkZ6MzM_vQ.text: The food was good. However, the service was really bad. The waiter had cleaned the table but there were about 5 other waiters/waitresses who would be able to assist me to sit me down. It wasn't busy. So I don't understand why it took so long. It took 10 mins to get my menus. And while I looked around for someone to ask for drinks no one walked towards the table they would just walk by. I also waited for the bill to be brought to me but I ended up having to walk up to the counter to pay because I waited so long.

ieLf1VtB2tikBwpuF25sgA.text: Been here a few times. It's a strange mix of foods (sushi, ramen, and Italian?!) with the ambiance more like a French cafe, but it somehow works. Their pad thai is tasty and I love the udon. The portions are quite large and they don't skimp on protein. Staff is all very friendly and it doesn't break the bank. I want to come back and try the ramen, the table across from me demolished theirs so it must be good.

OZnxjZl8aO3SveAvExYHjg.text: I had the pad thai and the California roll. Both were pretty good but not mind blowing. They do have a very robust menu so I would go back to try more of their offerings.

VLpeT8sa6MImAaO9SP25Pg.text: I don't crave many things, but when I do, it's Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe! Amazing happy hour (if you can make it in time), amazing soup/ramen, and amazing sushi! You can't go wrong here! Everything on the menu is fresh and delicious! Can't wait to come back for more!

tNiOqPCFacXnwDtbkYNDkg.text: I've been wanting to try Cherry Blossom's ramen for a while.  Since I can't get my Wagamama fix here in AZ, Cherry Blossom will have to do.  Their ramen hit the spot and would be great on a cold day at home sick, if it were anywhere near my house.  I agree with the other reviews, they should really expand their ramen menu.  There are no other ramen options in the valley (that I know of anyway) and they should capitalize on that!  I also tried a bite of my friend's salmon salad and that was delicious.   It's a cute little place, tucked away in a strip mall- If not for yelp, I never would have found it.  This will definitely go on the rotation.  Don't let looks deceive you, this place is a great find.

SzepEKi7d3E3ejoX8MJyAQ.text: Oh CherryBlossom, you remind me of an abusive relationship.    The first meal I had with you completely exceeded my expectations.  The unexpected bread basket with the nutty banana bread, the savory ramen broth that actually had depth, quick service...  After a couple visits I've accumulated quite a list of offenses: I've waited 45+ minutes because the hostess wrote my name down incorrectly and then skipped over it because she didn't know how to pronounce it, the bomb banana bread was replaced with dehydrated slices of "bread", the ramen noodles were undercooked and sticking together, the sushi rolls did not hold together, and the service was nonexistent.    Yet I found myself going back, over and over again hoping to relive that very first visit.  But enough is enough.    I'm not going to be the Rihanna to CherryBlossom's Chris Brown abuse no mo.

z3bPUfuP5sh8ryY7ZDcdfg.text: Ordered out here today and was very pleased with the food. I got the Iron Pot (Nabeykai Udon) and it was tasty although I would have liked more vegetables. It had TONS of seafood.   The pot stickers were yummy. Perfect flavor and perfectly cooked.   How'd I not know about this place?! I can't wait to try it again!

L9xOIy2nkKYUgksOz_jZHA.text: Food wasn't bad although a little bit expensive. But the wait was so long. Waited 40 minutes to get a bowl of ramen.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

U8YvLFyAEHW_RB8J09XGKA.text: When I saw they had mabo sara udon I had to try it. The inside of Cherry Blossom's is nice and clean. It has this comfy feeling to it compared to a more modern style.  First up ordered some gyoza.  Those where a great way to start a meal.  They were so good I would have walked away happy if I ordered another round and just had that for lunch. There are some places are ok under Phoenix that just butcher gyoza/potstickers and I'm usually disappoint.  So it was such a relief to finally have some that were well made.  Onto the mabo sara udon.  I'm kind of tilorn by it.  On one had it was good.  It was a lot spicer then I would have expected.  I only say that because the mabo tofu I have at Chinese places doesn't pack a lot of heat.  That part wasn't the bad.  I think for me there was something missing.  For example it wad like a hot fudge Sunday without the nuts.  It's still good but something was missing.  I would order it again in the future though.  Overall pretty happy with the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mabo sara udon Spicy minced pork over udon noodles.  Not to be confused with spaghetti sauce

tPqnh1ce4BCf3PAvbIVFwg.text: A friend came into town and wanted to find great ramen in Phoenix. I think we found it! I always get the shoyu ramen. It has great flavor and the broth is amazing. Tastes fresh! Their happy hour specials are awesome as well. This is a little hole in the wall off of camelback and they have Italian noodles as well, hence the noodle cafe.  Service has been decent and there is a cozy ambiance about the place. They also serve yummy looking desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shoyu ramen and bread!!

dQnxC96zLkeJRzJd8ex-vQ.text: Top notch eatery for noodles and ramen. I have never tried the sushi here so cannot comment on that. The ramen however is some of the best I have had here in the Phoenix area.  The hakata ramen that I ordered was served very hot, just the way I like it, and so tasty. The broth with the noodles was delicious. The complimentary bread basked was so good, we asked for more and were quickly taken care of. The gyoza were very good, a little different from other places and the sauce served with them was just so-so. One of our party had the tan-men dish which was spicy and they loved it. Told the waitress that if no one was watching he would have licked the plate. Speaking of the waitress, the service was extremely good, even though it was a very busy night. She took time to explain dishes and even remembered my daughter who had been there the previous week. The desserts are outstanding. Tiramasu was so light and flavorful. The strawberry cake was my favorite.  Overall a great dining experience.

3vox5BIVBZ-YflRAxalcRA.text: Very small and quaint. Every time I come here it usually is packed but I've never waited a long time. I wasn't sure what kind of restaurant this was since it has different styles of Asian noodles and even Italian pasta (say whuuuuuut?!). The waitress was Japanese and in the middle of service asked us to move because there was a group who speaks Japanese that didn't want to sit next to another table of Japanese speakers. Hmmm... gangsta . I kid you not! I'm like wait.. what makes her think I don't speak Japanese??!! (But Great guess) . The ramen is legit amazing but this time I got the udon noodles to try something different. Definitely very good even though I didn't know what exactly was in it (squid?) lol. Other peeps at my table got Korean beef noodles and beef yakisoba and I tried both, which were excellent. If you get the shrimp dumplings BEWARE of the hot mustard if you're a wimp, which I am not so I loved it but had to go easy after an initial generous dipping and learning the hard way. Had sushi for appetizer and was good not great. (I feel like this review is in reverse chronological order)  Oh yeah don't forget dessert, which tempts you through the glass case. I definitely recommend this place and worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Udon with assorted seafood items
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Birthday Boy  (me)
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Korean beef noodle

57swjVs7C2fdMvhERBngNA.text: Went last night with friends to get a bowl of ramen and a pad thai... we waited over 1 hr to be called for our table when the hostess said 20 mins. Once we were seated, two dishes arrived after 45 mins. The food was good, but the experience was horrible. I don't know if it was a bad day for them, but definitely not a good first impression. Not worth trying again.

MlQYcpoENPD8gZTi-qrRkA.text: The short and sweet of it ... we enjoyed this yelp find thoroughly. It has an Italian old world style, meets Shanghai, but first let's shake on it Korea while we dine in Japan, feel to it.  The menu is as interesting as the atmosphere. We were warmly welcomed and seated. Upon arrival we received a warm basket of dinner rolls and butter? It wasn't until I opened the menu and found an entire page of Italian dishes (as well as some Korean, Chinese and Japanese entrees) that I understood why. Cool!  The server was very attentive and our food came out in no time. We ordered the Iron Hotpot Beef Udon which was rich in flavor and loaded with beef, also plenty of chewy, thick noodles as well. Very good!  The shrimp tempura was light and crispy and the Baja roll was made with yellow tail and Jalapeno ( my favorite go to roll at any establishment ) fully enjoyed. The sashimi was okay not bad just not the best we've had ... skipping this next time.  We also ordered the spicy beef Korean noodles which was devoured before a photo could be snapped! Safe to say he and I loved this dish!  All in all, a 4 star " above average casual dining" review for Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We snacked on some rolls and hamachi. Baja Norte was excellent hamachi was mid grade
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Never judge a Shui mai by its shui or its mai ... this one is delicious!!
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef udon ... no skimping on the beef here

QRIYJit7L7fZWKTsnGkb1w.text: Love their soba and spaghetti so delicious! I went for my bday and loved it. My favorite noodle spot :)

fNvO1r-O8_JOdmLQ9uVBJg.text: Not bad. When living in the states, especially west Texas, ramen, more specifically real ramen, isn't easy to come by. Come to think of it, ramen in the states isn't easy to come by period. Perhaps it's because ramen has seemingly been lost in translation? For some reason, the dish that's ate in china, Korea, and especially Japan, has been super dumbed down and turned into a quick, cheap, microwaved dish ate by college kids on a budget. This of course causes westerners like me to be baffled at restaurants that ONLY serve ramen. Even when I was in Hawaii, I couldn't understand why someone would take a $0.99 thing and make a restaurant out of it? Anyways... ramen is a thing, and an art. So finding legit ramen is hard to come by.   This place hit the spot. It's decor, staff, even customers, aren't what one would expect from a traditional ramen spot. It reminded me more of a Cracker Barrel than a ramen shop. But the ramen itself is legit. And True to its name, they have all things noodles. They serve Udon, Soba, ramen, even Pad Thai! Noodles for days Mayne!   The menu rounds itself out by offering a variety of other items from sushi rolls to katsudon. Also a variety of drinks. From your normal lemonades to something I had to try just because it was there. Ok, so y'all know what Thai tea is: the "milk tea" drink. Unusual sounding but we all know it works. Well have you ever heard of "Milk Pepsi"? I haven't. So I ask the very polite and helpful waitress, what exactly this is. She happily explained to me, well it's milk, and Pepsi. Go figure, it was legit. Now I'm never gonna drink Pepsi again without milk. Which won't be often anyways, because I don't drink Pepsi. But again, if I do, it had better have milk in it.   So if you're in Phoenix, for whatever reason, this place is a must go. The price is very fair too.   Das it Mayne.

HANFWIQ71xbyAWTeiIsKPA.text: The food was ok, the service was crappy (a lil slow). I wish they had a better cocktail selection. Will go back and give it another shot. The parking though can use some improvement, rarely anywhere to park.

sn2JybiZAe2axcpzX689pQ.text: We came looking for ramen and found it!  I ordered the shoyu ramen - good call!  Lots of goodies in the bowl.  Broth was nice and flavorful and plenty of properly cooked noodles.  Not a huge fan of having bamboo shoots in the ramen, but those are easily skipped if you don't like them.  The egg was more cooked than I prefer, which pleased my daughter, who prefers her egg to be cooked hard, rather than soft.  Good place to get your ramen on!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shout ramen

MsHb06Qb9cnozkS5tu9sWA.text: The name is a little misleading. We thought it is a ramen place, which it does have a few noodle dishes.  It is more like an Asian fusion place, a mixture of Asian food.  Even thought it wasn't what we expected we ordered the ramen soups they offer since that was what we were in the mood for. Not bad at all. Overall we were happy with our choice.

-PaWUHDlsvvDbfC6kOTRcA.text: I've been here a few times and keep forgetting to review, so here I am. Coming from Las Vegas where there's plenty of good Asian food, I think Cherryblossom comes close to being a decent one for AZ standards.   My favorite thing to get here is the chicken curry with rice. I didn't like it the first time, but I gave it a second chance and found it actually really good. The prices here are very affordable, and the customer service has always been good, from my experience. Cherryblossom is located in a small, busy plaza, so parking could be tough. There is street parking though so that's an option.  This place is also a Japanese + Italian fusion, I've never actually tried any of the Italian dishes. If I'm ever craving Japanese food, this is my go-to in Central Phoenix.

5Lv7ZQUTKRmCCFMvx1WGOg.text: Wow! This was my first time visiting but when I tell you it totally reminded me of Okinawa...the taste was authentic and it brought back so many memories in each bite!!!

BKqRcvezFL_bWGxmJ5p5hg.text: Usually this place is on point. But this time, the lady standing at the hostess stand was extremely RUDE!! I stood there for a few minutes and she didn't even greet me or look up. After a few minutes I asked if someone would seat me. She didn't even look up. Didn't greet me. Didn't even apologize for her clear lack of hospitality. She then orders someone else to seat me and says nothing to me. Then, when we get to the table, it's FREEZING!!!!

-vkMf90UgNUVrzZVhD1b7A.text: First time at this restaurant and I was happily satisfied. I came with my siblings and we all ordered a different ramen. I had the one with grilled chicken, my brother had the one with naruto in it, and my sister had the one with salmon. I tried theirs and it was great. Mine was also very delicious. We also had the fried calamari and California roll. Yummmm to both. We stopped by during Happy Hour so we were able to see the Happy Hour menu. Very nice prices and wide variety of food and drinks on the HH menu. Additionally, the service was phenomenal. The waiter was so polite and there was a woman who stopped by from time to time to help as well. The atmosphere was also very cute and cozy. You could tell that many people who came by were regulars and now I understand why. Great place with great service and food!

nQ17k82Ni71B_o0MF0BzKw.text: I've been here twice in less than 3 days in one week! Hmmmmm... Lol! Its fabulous, the ramen broth is as close as it'll be to satisfy my ramen craving and you know that saying "If you see local Japanese and Italians eating in the restaurant, you know your in a good spot!"   My co-worker knows I've been on a hunt for some good ramen in Phoenix. I like the one in Tempe - Tompopo but, the broth isn't too perfection. Anyways, she introduced me to this new findings for lunch and was really happy they have inari (rice cone sushi), I was excited to taste and that was it... I'm amazed to how they prepared it, I haven't found any asian restaurants or markets that make inari the way we eat it back home in Hawaii, on spot!   I had there Hakata ramen which was really good, so good I'm taking pictures and sending it to my husband bragging what I'm eating at this very moment. Lol!  The broth had most of the flavored taste that makes up the warmth of deliciousness and I love that they have the yamasa Shoyu which is the next Shoyu (soy sauce) to Aloha Shoyu. The chasiu is just right not dry but, nice and moist! Too me it is perfection to compare what I've been finding in Arizona. This is as close as we can get to what I am familiar with of back home. And what's the connection of Hawai'i and Japan. Japanese culture is the 3rd largest group in Hawaii over Filipino and whites! So we have alot of real authentic Japanese sushi, ramen, homemade tofu, steaks and so forth..   This is my comfort food that'll make me feel a tad bit closer to home.   On the second visit I brought in my ohana because I wanted to see their reaction. My son had the tan tan spicy ramen, husband had the Cha siu ramen, and as much as I wanted ramen I also wanted to try their pasta, so I had the smoked salmon, fresh spinach and spinach pasta with cream sauce. Well, their reaction was priceless my son's nose started drenching and his throat was coughing and he had a smile like "dis da one", they enjoyed the inari as well and was taken with excitement of its taste (eyes wide opened).   The other great bonus is that I have a Hawaiian pidgin accent (broken english), people up here either can't understand what I say, knows I ain't spanish, and I'm not from here. But, if you from Hawaii then you you know the accent and will pick up on it real fast. Which our waitress immediately picked up on me and we all connected! I was sooo happy!!! So she told me next time I come in I gotta try there Shoyu ramen it's almost the exact as zippys saimin! Hell yaaahhh, I will!  The dessert that we shared was this sweet potato pie spice (Okinawan style) it was not heavy, super delicious, and very lite! You can taste the Okinawan potato's... Yummy!!!   And we usually do not get dessert.. .  We found happiness here with our Ramen. Thank u to the wonderful owners for making authentic dishes here in Arizona!  And one more added exciting note: on Friday night there was a long line our wait time was at least 30 min and from what my understanding from other families/ group parties it's like this every Friday night! So you know gotta be ONO right! Go check um out!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rice cone sushi = Inari! Yummy
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. CHA - SIU Ramen.... You see dat chasiu! Das da real thing! Nice, moist and buggah is good

9sxsLntSfklMuE_gDs40_w.text: This place was amazing! I was introduced to this place by our best friends and I can't thank them enough! I also hate that I live so far!   At first it seems confusing to mix Italian with Asian but get over that quick because each dish has such unique spices and flavor you won't even care!   We ordered the Yakiniku (Hot Iron Plate), Udon Suki, Napolitan (Italian pasta with Asian twist) and Korean Spicy Beef.   Each dish was absolutely amazing and I wish I took photos but we demolished all of it so quickly. If I had any tips I would recommend going with a group and eating family style so you can try a little bit of everything!

obSMLqHJ2bUoNuFwszfvXA.text: I ordered takeout and the girl who helped me was amazing. As a business owner it makes all the difference when someone new has an awesome interaction like that. I haven't even eaten my order yet but it was worth 5 stars. I'm sure it's legit because there's a line out to the parking lot! Well done cherry blossom. Give her a raise!

GzOsgXN7HX49E1Uyv6BkuQ.text: I've been eyeballing this place for a while and so happy I finally went. It's a small cozy place with great service. My sever was super friendly and attentive. I sat by the kitchen and it was great watching the cooks work. The good was great and had Ramen and sushi and both did not disappoint. I now need to go back for their noddles and Happy Hour. It's a must try place.

ottHvDowJbNI4RxSV43Elw.text: We have been going there for years, and they have generally been pretty good. I love going there and having a nice meal with my wife, enjoying some great sushi / sake, and their salmon plate is insanely good! Having sampled almost their entire menu, I will say that like any restaurant, some things on their menu are better than others, but I have not ever had anything that was not tasty, and my wife and I have never been ill from the sushi. I know this sounds like a weird review, but considering it's a sushi place, that is a valid statement that should carry some weight, considering we have eaten 100's of their sushi rolls over the years. I will not mention the details of the 1 or 2 times we had bad service ONLY because we have been there literally 100's of times, and I think both times the service was not great, they were severely understaffed. We still like to go there, and they have always been happy to see us!

h9VGls6qiPioDfQpAasUgw.text: This place is one our  favorite places to eat. Great prices excellent food. I have enjoy everything I have tried so far (half the menu). The curry is delicious, soups are tasty, even the pasta is good as well. I suggest trying something each time you come.  The only thing is to keep be mindful if you are waiting to get a seat don't disappear. They will move on to the next person if they can't find you.

zSfObtgE8wjJ2Xk6Z6ApDg.text: Maybe 3.5 stars would be a better representation of my lunchtime visit to Cherry Blossom. I came in for lunch after discussing a friends recent trip to Tokyo I was just dying for some Ramen. The restaurant was surprisingly slow for noon on a Friday but it quickly filled up by the end of my visit. I ordered the Cha-shu ramen with a boiled egg. The pork was good but not great, and was missing that rich fatty texture that I love so much. The noodles were fine, nothing to write home about. And the boiled egg was just a plain hard boiled egg. I was expecting the Ajitsuke Tamago but that may have just been my mistake. Either way it didn't add anything to the dish. I must say though the broth was killer. I know Ramen is highly dependent on the broth but I feel like it shouldn't be the only great part of the meal. Service was good, you definitely don't come here for a show but they do the job efficiently and with a smile.

Vf9g7kybnigoR9BLgPq4cg.text: I was recommended here by people who come regularly. I went for a lunch meeting and really enjoyed the orange chicken.  It's a bit cramped inside, but well worth it for good food and great prices

5SOKMDQBnAmrXoB3YErsBA.text: Very nice wait staff, ordered the bbq pork ramen, it was flavorful and very filling, my husband ordered the tempura shrimp rice bowl. The shrimp were nice and fresh and very tasty. We had the strawberry shortcake and it was very very delicious and not overly sweet.
