U-LYId7foX82mKQIVIif1Q.text: The food and service is great! I had the beef Udon and I loved it the portions are pretty big, I couldn't finish all of my food. Their drinks are on the pricey side. $4 for 10 Oz of  thai tea. And no free refills. Overall I will be back to enjoy more food. Maybe I'll have the balls to try the spicy noodles

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I had to seat myself but the Thai tea is delicious and service is pretty fast so far.

aucZGa8_DHNvYQMb8jWwdA.text: My boyfriend and I were in the mood for ramen after watching this random show on netflix (Samurai Gourmet). This place was recommended by a coworker. The restaurant itself is smaller but very clean. It does not come off as the traditional asian restaurant. The menu is a mix of Japanese and Italian. We tried the shoyu and takana ramen. Both were extremely delicious. The shoyu was a bit salty but not unexpected. We also tried a seaweed salad and tootsie roll. The seaweed salad was very good but had a garnish on it that did not blend well with the other flavors- it was very harsh and bitter. My boyfriend thought it could have been something in the radish family. The tootsie roll was also very good. The flavors were light and refreshing and blended well together. The eel sauce was drizzled nicely and not overused. The service was very fast and our waiter was great! We will definitely be coming back here.

-Ni6TvFxZFZ6IhkK8H8k3g.text: This place got great reviews so figured we would try it .. We got seated with a short wait  We looked at the menu for a while waiting for the server to come by and get our drink order witch was about 10 minutes. She went to the table next to us 3 times and the 4th time she acknowledged our table and said she would be right back to get our order,  she came back took the check from the other table and walked away without even asking for our drinks or anything..We decided to leave.  Horrible service!  To bad since the reviews are pretty good.

mvkU5Xk5OfoZYJFHUeDkBw.text: I just wanted to write this review to counteract the reviews criticizing the service here.  My boyfriend and I went for the first time last night.  Being a Saturday night, there were a lot of people, but we only waited about 25 minutes for a table.  Our waitress was very personable and we had a wonderful experience.  She was certainly quick and efficient, but did not sacrifice personalized service to be so.    The food was also very good.  We started with the fried calamari, which I thought could have used a little more flavor, but the wasabi mayo was a nice addition.  Our Tootsie Roll was also tasty.  The main courses were the highlight by far.  I got the seafood Iron pot (fabulous if you are a seafood lover like me!) and my boyfriend ordered one of the italian dishes which he also raved about.    We will be back- maybe to try lunch or happy hour!

lZ78opdrp8T51SQYnWe6xA.text: The Food is Awsome. I always carry out. but this week I brought my family to dine in..   we walked in and there was a girl with glasses taking orders, I went up to her to ask if she can sign us up... she rudely answered "I am training right now and I will take longer than normal to get to you so wait in the front".  I tried to ignore her comments and told my family to wait a few minutes. she then finally came up to us and asked us what we needed, I said 4 adults and 1 baby high chair please. she then replied " let me ask the other customers if they are ok for me to sit a baby next to them.. I again got frustrated with her but staid quiet, I noticed she went in the kitchen area and never went with the customers, then she decided to take us far into a hidden room where a high chair wound not fit..   we ended up leaving the place.   I recommend the food, I am sure the owners are great because  when I go in for pick up its all good, it was the first for me and I will not be dining here again...

BI7aewSG-jsq9XMPXTwiHg.text: Really great place that does Italian and many other Asian cuisines. I've been here a few times and always like to try something new because they have a huge extensive menu ranging from Italian pastas like penne with marinara to udon noodle soup. I really like the quaint ambiance with wooden tables and brick walls that gives the whole restaurant a rustic feel.  My friend got the vongole with white wine sauce and she loved it, while I got unajyu which is fresh water eel with unagi sauce over rice. Unagi and rice is up there as one of my favorite foods and they did it really well by giving the eel a great char.   Been coming here for years and they consistently deliver good food, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place to family or friends!

-hKYqYZjlc4aGOJvHb3F2g.text: I consider this place as one of my top ten restaurants, Ive been going for the longest time and always suggest it when I want to have some great Japanese cuisine. I don't eat meat any more but when I did my favorite was the Katsudon and man, was it delicious! It was a perfect blend of flavors and their desserts are superb! Won't go wrong going here~

Bjza1JBsa-nAUzFY1C2kdQ.text: I just went there for the first time.  I had the seafood noodle pot - Outstanding!!!  I will have to come back here for lunch and try some of the their lunch specials or the other items on the menu.    Great place!

Bcl9yMbv0NYtKHWjFkJYFw.text: I love this place! The owner (who is Japanese) is a very sweet woman who clearly cares a lot for her business. I've been here multiple times. It's small and a little cramped but I definitely recommend trying to get a seat at the bar if you can! You get to watch the chefs cook and also see what's coming out of the kitchen to help make your mind up on what to order.  The Japanese side of the menu is very good. I've never tried the Italian side. I've had a variety of items from it and I've never been dissatisfied.  The one downside to this place is service. It can feel a little slow to get your food and I'm not sure what training the wait staff receive prior to starting. One night I ordered zaru soba with tempura but all that came were the noodles. When I asked about my tempura the waiter tried to insist that the sauce was tempura, which... who doesn't know what tempura is?! In the end I never got my tempura because of some more trouble with this waiter but I chalk it up to him learning the ropes (it was his first time on the job) since I've never had issues before.   The owner personally came to our table to apologize and offered me a free dessert. I didn't want anything but she still gave me a slice of banana bread, which was extremely kind of her (and it was very good, too).

4YNJRCoi1cRby8A8Z6XMHQ.text: Have dined here  many times however getting sick of the bad service long wait for food I walked out last time after an hour wait for my meal and this time  credit card machine went down and had to run and get cash to pay...

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Decent food bad service

M8tYksUAC5L3GXvY8wGImg.text: We have eaten there for years the food is good. We always order spicy tuna, substituting with salmon.  Today we were told by a manager that they cannot change or substitute any thing in the menu. We asked if this is a new policy? We're told it has always been this way. We know this is not True. So the food is good the service and customer service is lacking. We had ordered about 40 dollars worth of food and decided to leave.  We will not return to this restaurant.

rDYYDsaBWK53EnUDvl53TQ.text: First time in, I loved the sukiyaki noodle dish I had.  Second time, same week, was one of the worse restaurant experiences in a long time.  Food took forever to come out.  One pasta dish took and hour.  After eating three sushi rolls and waiting for two more, I began not feeling well.  By the time I got home, I was violently vomiting.  I believe their sushi is pre-made and kept too long instead of being made to order.  If that's not the case, then they are not keeping fresh fish. Additionally, they do not keep proper stock to make their signature cocktails.

9rcGtWOGo8ae_svQuQZESw.text: It was pretty great for an area not known for great noodles. Just as a note, this place is not great for young kids. No children's menu and when we asked for waters for everyone they didn't bring anything for our son, we had to specifically ask for them to bring a water out

_cPxYuDIqHePETjsugO9cQ.text: Well if you want Italian and Asian at the same time this place is for you. However instead of being the best of both worlds you end up with the Okest of both worlds. Smack dab in the middle of the road for Asian fare and Italian fare.  The decor looks like an Italian married an Asian and for the wedding gifts they were given knock off italian art work. Plus the oddest dinning room I have ever been in. We were on the odd half room side and I felt like I was in a coat closest.   The Spicy Korean beef I had was a little spicy but that is about all I can say about it. It left you mouth going ehh.   My taste buds were craving a buttered roll based on other reviews becauae who does not love yeast covered in salty butter? Well I did taste some semblance of a yeast roll but it was closer to the kinda that somone always brings to Thanksgiving and they sit untouched. With a side of butter.   I would skip the fusion and go for a real live Asian or Italian restaurant and skip this hybrid that should have been whacked by the family.

E8PPmLzAbt-Z6aSRiAqW-g.text: this is a definite place to come back to there pad Thai is one of the best I ever had maybe because it had a sweet flavor and got add so chili it's over the top our sever was grate to new the menu very well and could explain was things and prices are good will be back soon

mFepw2NNFYeLK8pIgAz17w.text: I know some of you love this place, but I just don't understand I guess.  The food: I had the Cha-chu. Bland, under seasoned, and deeply in need of some spice heat. The pork was over cooked in my opinion, lacked some of that wet savory I come to expect in my pork products.   We shared the Miso Seasoned Eggplant. Really greasy, and the miso didn't do anything to mitigate the amount of grease we had in ours. The green pepper was way over cooked and turned to rubber.  I had the goyza as my date was a vegetarian. This is where they went from one start to two stars. These were damn good, but not enough to salvage the meal.  The Service: We ordered takeout on a Saturday night. Maybe this was a mistake on our part. When they took our order, they told us "15 minutes." After 45 minutes we had our food in our hands after standing around like a couple of assholes with our thumbs up our butts for 30 additional minutes. I hate waiting because you cannot manage your product flow out of the kitchen. If its going to be 45 minutes, tell me that and I will gladly show up on time. However, having me stand around like that isn't going to work for me.  All and all, I know this place is the light burning bright for many of you, but like I said, I just don't see this place's potential. I'll stick to Rice Paper down on 7th St.

xV_IrOdLi6UQ_Zghlng-RA.text: Local and cute setting in central Phoenix.  Love the Hakata soup, basically Ramen noodles, but inexpensive for a bowl of warm yumminess!  It can be pretty loud at times, if full, but that's ok, I've been in much worse.  It's very Japanese with a twist for those who are unfamiliar with Japanese foods, you can always order an Italian dish instead.  Sushi is good, and reasonable in price as well.  The cooks are insight and friendly with those sitting at the bar.  You know it's pretty authentic when you see more Japanese/Asian sitting and eating their bowl of soup, many choices to choose from too!

ySNXy_wdtbv-HdmjwIQYgQ.text: I literally wake up in the middle of the night ravenous and craving ramen at least twice a week, so I have been on the hunt for a really good ramen place for a while now.  I know, I know.. this is Phoenix, so how good of a bowl of ramen can I really expect here?  We have some pretty good restaurants, but definitely not the best Asian food.  However, I was pleasantly surprised to how good the broth was.  I got the Cha-Shu ramen and the broth was not too salty annd to me, had great flavor.  The noodle texture was alright- nothing too spectacular.  But since the broth was really good, I would give it a 4/5.

Y4KCScWe2bOVGK-hvB3R6Q.text: Whenever I crave Japanese style food that isn't sushi, this restaurant has satiated me each and every time.  From their katsu curry or tempura to their soba, ramen, udon, I have enjoyed each meal and what they've had to offer.  I will suggest though that if you do order the katsu curry, that you ask for the katsu to be served on the side so it doesn't lose the crispy quality of the panko that is otherwise buried in the curry sauce.    I don't know anyone who has tried their Italian fare, but my friends and I have found their Asian food selections to be delicious.  Their prices are pretty reasonable and I find their portions to be decent as well.  I have yet to personally try their sushi, but I have heard that it's also quite good.    I haven't had any issues with the service, but I also wouldn't say that they go above and beyond either - it is adequate.  The atmosphere is a little odd since it was, from what I heard, converted from a bakery to a restaurant, but it is clean and comfortable.  I do think it would be nice if they honed in on the Asian cuisine though, being named Cherry Blossom Cafe otherwise seems slightly misleading. (But now I'm just being nit-picky.)  Overall, I have had rather positive experiences at this establishment and look forward to my next visit!

_IJFdK16nH0db_YoDakA5Q.text: I have been to Cherryblossom countless times for lunch over the past few years. I have to say the location kinda sucks, but that's because of all the traffic. Are they ever going to finish construction on Camelback?!   Any way, I decided to get a to go lunch order today. Since it was actually chilly out, I ordered the cha-shu ramen noodles with a couple of their yummy bread rolls & also picked up a slice of their amazing blueberry bread. The rolls were yummy as usual & I ate half of the cha-shu, so good & a big enough portion for me to have it again for lunch tomorrow.   Service can be slow there sometimes, it's best to go at 11am or after 1pm, to beat the lunch crowd. Other tasty items I have enjoyed here are: cali crunchy roll, double shrimp crunchy roll, grilled chicken salad (w/ginger dressing instead), calamari, edamame & I have tried a couple different pasta dishes which were surprisingly good!

TLVFzmf1-eP8g90YJ3TQ7Q.text: I am tempted to write a bad review so less people go there and the place is only for me. I love everything about it. The sushi, the noodles, the appetizers, the deserts...

UzE2xbbiVv1Na_W4kclLkw.text: Took forever to seat a party of Two.  I ordered the seafood nabe. Scallops, calamari, sea kelp, noodles, mushrooms, egg. Warm / Hot stuff served in an iron pot (nabe).  It was decent. Not too sweet.  .... I really wish I could get takoyaki (battered baked octopus bits) here like I used to back in 2007 though. They don't have Takoyaki anymore which is soooo sad.

I3hNAm5Q1vl8h5u8ZLJpCQ.text: I'm giving them a mixed review. First time I had lunch here I dined in and tried the Thai Beef Salad. Tasted really good, if not quite authentic tasting. 4 stars.   Tried them again for take out one night. Ordered Pad Thai with chicken and it missed the mark.  They asked if I wanted it hot, I said I like spicy but not too hot. So he suggested medium. I think what I got tasted very mild. Really no heat at all and although it had a generous amount of vegetables and chicken, the flavor was missing. I think I could make better Pad Thai at home.

sYRDhtO50QNwaZFn5OvYoA.text: My wife and I lived in Japan for 4 years.... the one thing I haven't been able to find in and around Phoenix ...until today is really well done sticky rice. I had almost given up hope :)  The meal was all around very good. The ramen my wife had was tasty but I would say the ramen at Monta in Las Vegas is better. The broth is much more flavorful.  All in all... this is a nice place to have here in the Valley... give it a try.

u1Jw-DxoSjNVwAnqx55Z2g.text: It was good.....meat was a little tough, but the seafood seemed fresh.  Bread was basic bread, nothing special.  The waiter kept screwing up our bill, "hey this isn't right."  "your right let me correct it".  "Uh it still not correct".  It took them 4 tries to finally get it right.  There were two of us and we ordered 2 plates and 1 drink!

F9JaRb-U0xKTtDfgImZ35Q.text: I think that the food here is wonderful. The atmosphere is unique with a constant buzzing near the front room, lots of action. Maybe the menu is too ambitious and the log jam gets long, however this gives it character and many people like that. Noli is a fine waiter and the service there is as good as possible and usually warm.

EBB4IPIk_FiINKN9Ue7fXA.text: wonderful atmosphere, reasonable prices and an extensive menu of various cuisines and noodles.

clFWkrC-jubYvNbg4IVfsg.text: I've been here several times and have always enjoyed my experiences. The staff is really friendly and helpful. I like the grilled salmon with ginger sauce which comes with miso soup, salad, and rice. I think the range of items is really the neat part about Cherry Blossom. It seems impossible to come here and not find something you like. Although I haven't really tried any of their Italian dishes, I've heard they are pretty good also. Definitely worth a try if you are in the area!

iyjVLx0nP0EtQ-ZezYSOgQ.text: Absolutely delicious ramen. The hakata and the chashu are my favorites. It can get busy but don't let a wait discourage you. Completely worth it.

B_nxM2913FtDx6xBU9kVmA.text: Delicious ramen. On my birthday this is always where I wanna go. I can think of no higher compliment to pay a dining establishment actually lol love this place.

77WOGk6tr_ei12xqU5bs_Q.text: This place is pretty cool. Great atmosphere and good food. Their service is hit or miss, sometimes it's good other times they kinda forget about you. I go back because I really like their food.

6r1Gglv7qE70G6hwrV2A_w.text: I had been meaning to visit this place for awhile and the only regret I have is that it took me so long to swing by and have a taste.  They have a decent and well priced lunch menu as well as a large assortment of Italian pasta and Japanese type entrees.  After debating the tonkatsu lunch versus the ramen and roll combo, I ordered a bowl of ramen and california roll for $8.45.  I was very seriously surprised by the ramen broth which was excellent and also by the fact that the noodles were perfectly al dente.  My friend got the champon, which is traditionally found in Chinese restaurants  Definitely can't wait to go back and try more menu items.

sjYrsP74rm4RmP4TMyI8Bg.text: I haven't been here but my friend says it amazing by any chance does anyone know I they serve bubble tea or calpico?

7NcpsGtseN5FWczT4hMFrg.text: The worst experience I've ever had. I should have known better when they told us 15 minute wait turned to 40. Then finally seated by the door a crowd of people also waiting for to be seated standin behind us. We waited 15 then for our server to make his first appearance...we left. Ridiculous.

OGGqlWj3ICm4NoHUT6dv4Q.text: I am so glad that friends of mine took me to this restaurant, because I would have never stopped in had I just seen it from the street. The location in a strip mall with a nondescript front definitely does not do justice what awaits you inside. The place is quaint and the decor a strange mixture of Asian and Western European influences. Of note is that the friends who look me were actually Japanese - always  good sign when choosing Asian restaurants. My absolute favorite dish is the hot udon soup with either chicken or veggies but I have tried several other dishes and have enjoyed them. One of the cool things in this restaurant is the curious mixture of Asian and Italian cuisine. Unfortunately, the one time my boyfriend tried out an Italian dish the noodles tasted a bit stale. That was the only time though that I have not thoroughly enjoyed myself there.

xtKq-U8IkY5C4QblZx7x2g.text: When you are in the mood for a piping hot bowl of something savory and brothy, this is the place to go. Their soba and udon bowls are very nourishing and the soup isn't too salty. It's a great casual eats place and the menu has an "Italian" side if you have friends who are in a non-Asian food mood. Also, they bring a bread basket that has anything from warm rolls to banana bread. The price is reasonable for the amount of food. You know it must be good if you see three generations of a Japanese family at one table.

uLIGcGGOzphpgHKeXEYp8Q.text: I love CherryBlossom as much for their eclectic nature as for their delicious food. Pan-Asian influences in their main menu, sushi that is not mind-blowing, but still fresh and tasty...and homebaked goods! The service is friendly and quick, the digs are comfortable, and the prices can't be beat.

E7Bh7OHsVLoFYxBzoBHuiA.text: Good, solid place. I'm a big fan of the ramen... It's a big bowl of happiness. Never had a problem with the service (only place I've ever been to where the server apologized for interrupting me when she was checking in) as everyone has been very nice.

j3LljyJiOuiEkWQyqWcldA.text: I think enough has been said about Cherry Blossom so I'm going use this review to pledge my love for Zaru Soba. When I was 18 I spent nearly a month in Japan in the Sister City exchange program. It was during the summer and my host mother would always make cold noodles with dipping sauce, a very popular dish during the humid summer months. I nearly fell out of my chair when I first tried the Zaru Soba at Cherry Blossom, I was instantly transported back to my incredible time in Japan.  Cold buckwheat noodles, a light soy-based dipping sauce and a little fried panko fish on the side, the perfect dish for when it's hot as sin outside. A little banana bread to start doesn't hurt either! Say what you will about the service, I often only go at lunchtime when there aren't that many people but I have found the service to be unintrusive and very polite.  Now if only I could find a place in Phoenix that serves Japanese pancakes....

bY4hlW4btzXwv8F3oKySNw.text: Cherry Blossom Noodle Cafe has the authenticity of Japan's finest "Mom & Pop" eateries.  This effect is achieved by trasporting diners to a quaint interior with friendly service and delicious food the moment the enter from the low scale strip mall exterior.  The Ramen with Pork Cutlett (chashu ramen) is superb as are many of their other Asian dishes and even their italian fare is done with care and skill.  Sometimes the servers aren't the best in terms of knowledge and attentiveness, but the quality of food, affordable price and friendly atmosphere make up for it.

pUbgWISyOHd61qpSra0QoQ.text: Previous reviews make a lot of good points, but I disagree that the food is bland. Try the house specialties, the soups and the spring rolls. I had not been in for a few years and was pleasantly surprised on my visit last night as to how busy it was. This is good value and quality for an area of central Phoenix where good restaurants are scarce. And don't dis the desserts -- they're terrific.

g8E4MOeTZMIaVT_N84tVvQ.text: Their noodle dishes are great and sushi is very good, not the best in town, though. Service can be really slow. If you come, plan on some extra time. Even though slow, the food is worth the wait usually.

YzFmX7jCECUH_2HV1ki5ig.text: This place has the best vegetarian sushi roll in town as well as overall good food. Service alters from unbelievably excellent to non-existent.

mXWUjeBLrOGz8deu9HiRoQ.text: We ate at this place last night.  We went here solely based upon the reviews on yelp (We seem to do that a lot; thanks to you semi-anonymous first name and last initial reviewers!!)  I had a little trouble deciding what to order.  Based on the suggestion of the server, I ordered the tempura vegetable soup with udon.  It was really good.  It didn't have a ton of flavor but the server warned me of that when I ordered.  She stated that this was a simple dish.  Everybody in our party seemed to like their food although nobody danced on the table and raved about it.  Although, come to think of it, if given the chance I am pretty sure my daughter would dance on the table and rave about just about anything.  She's got a lot of energy!  It was a pleasant dining experience.  I don't think that I would go out of my way for this place but when in the area, I may stop back in.

GV9-qP64vetLJPeC2sIScw.text: i really like this place! from the bread baskets that they bring you full of fresh baked bread products (the banana bread is SO GOOD!), to the sushi, this place has some amazing food! they are always really accomodating to groups as well.  i will warn you - you should stick to the asian foods. On a hot summer afternoon, the Hiyashi Chuka (cold noodle salad with grilled chicken, egg, and cucumber+lettuce) is the PERFECT meal. my sister always always ALWAYS orders the shanghai duck salad, which is absolutely delicious - they don't skimp on the duck at all. if you're in the mood for sushi, i'd recommend the sushi combo, with the Alaskan - a little on the pricey side, but it's fresh and well made.   yay for Cherryblossom! and as I apparently read the Entertainment coupon book for fun, there is usually some kind of coupon deal for CB in it.

gLDkMO5_IAdo01f3nWIrUA.text: slow service. The banana blueberry bead was so so. Rolls were so so.  Sushi wasn't bad, not awesome. Service was total poops.

H1f00tqAg4EyU-9oNcwnxA.text: I've been to Cherry Blossom twice during a one week period and I am looking forward to going back again to try new things from the menu.  The atmosphere is awesome, the staff is friendly, the happy hour specials are excellent, and most importantly, the food is tasty.  I've been on a search for good sushi since Celsius has closed down but this place gives me some hope.  I recommend the crunchy eel roll.

xCXxIJjozjz8shmI84r2cQ.text: Amazing chicken parm. I was told by my Brother i need to try it. I was hesitant at first because its a Japanese rest. It is fantastic. I have ordered it 2-3 times a week for past month. I am as picky as they get with Italian food. Good Italian food. Was born and raised in NYC and found this to be some of the best chicken parm in AZ. Portion is filling especially for $12.

uVgGuK9UbQr2tTaZqnnFew.text: i am SO glad we decided to try this place on a sunday night!  they were a bit busy and there was about a 15 minute wait-but it was well worth it. the service was amazing, the sushi was awesome, and my yakisoba with tofu was so yummy. portion size is great-plenty of leftovers. will be returning there very shortly!

UistASiey8TY_66BTdqQSA.text: The place is a typical Japanese style cafe, that caters to young women in Tokyo who want to get some away time from Men. I like how it's divided and the brick facing giving more privacy to catch those "stolen moments" of my away time that I am so fond of.  The food is surprisingly good yet cheap and with great variety. Many Western dishes are available as well as sushi, udon, and cold summer noodles. They should drop the "Noodles" part from their name as their are only about 4 noodle dishes on the menu.  The place puts out a bread basket of fresh baked breads and banana bread before your food arrives.  Kirin, Asahi, Sapporo and Sapporo on tap is available for beer drinkers as well as the usual cheap wines.  Great for lunch and nice for during the week dinners.  Owned and operated by actual Japanese people, a rarity in Phoenix. I can't believe I have been going there so much recently I guess it's become my favorite joint, that is not part of some large-corporate-ho-hum-loud-place.

ovSflgFfh_mdA-kFG7tW-w.text: Cherry Blossom has the best happy hour items! So tasty and fresh!!!! I am in love!

0lNx-_l642BrS5aTaqMyGw.text: Best noodles outside Japan.  Very authentic Japanese style restaurant.  Try the champon noodles...

jm7q_FkF0H0ROWewhG-hyg.text: I've eaten here a number of times.  The food has always been delicious.  The staff is friendly.  This is a great date spot or night out with the girls.

aWxw7Dt5KyJJmVwLjWrk7w.text: This is rather unique....korean champon and Japnese Ramen soup....Thai beef salad.  Food is fantastic here.  Often, slow service because it is very busy during lunch but worth while to visit....:)

5NRJU6O2lc4YpDzq6Epr9A.text: Mmmmm....Korean Spicy Beef at it's finest! Their appetizer breads are fantastic as well.

fS_aIms61_rSgjpnhQpOZg.text: Cherry Blossom is simply the best. I would describe it as asian comfort food, and it's amazing.  Mom and pop environment, really great food, very reasonably priced-- you can't beat it.   I know offering both japanese and italian food sounds a bit odd, but just try it (I would recommend sticking to the asian side).

WVUUB_-Z6BjFrrrfjtbn0A.text: This is a place that requires much better management and service. I would say this place may fit you if you are fine to wait for an hour for a plate of noodle and don't expect good services.  We waited for about 20 min for two small appetizers, and another 40 min for 2 plates of noodles and 1 ramen. We asked one of the waiters to check if our orders were forgotten after waiting for an hour, and what he told us (with a rude attitude) is that they have two big groups and those people have been waited for 2 hrs so we either have to keep waiting or just pay for the appetizers and go away. (After waiting for 1 hr, this is what we got?! They should have let us know that there will be such long wait when we stepped in!)  We decided to keep waiting since my friend was worried that other restaurants are closed by the time we get there (It was almost 9pm.). Turned out that was a big mistake. One of the clam noodle plates was not well-cooked. (The angel hair noodle was still half raw.) The other one was even worse. Some clams were still icy. Not just cold, they were icy! Eventually two plates had to be sent back. I won't recommend this restaurant to anyone.

6As0a6Xye_bQaAR7XY5vzg.text: I had the Yakisoba and my girlfriend got some salmon special. Mine was so-so but her fish looked like it had been cooked on a greasy hot plate and apparently tasted bad also. What she ordered came in a box with a bunch of other pretty terrible things I cant recall since it has been a year. The salad was ok for a side salad and the sushi was about as good as store bought. The service was nice and helpful and the place is a little divey to me but could be described as quaint by some. I see some other recommendations but I doubt I go back with so many higher caliber dining places with all around great food so close by. The pricing was right around the price I would spend for much better even then. To each his own I suppose but I know two people that weren't pleasantly surprised.

iWKyIMkFxatHsU8asEbDwg.text: This place depicts fusion at a different level, this cozy place is great tasting and service is great. This is a perfect date place or lunch time place. I really liked the lunch boxes they serve, it included sushi, chicken katsu, bread, rice, and much more...

2uynM95u_yHSQZ5xIGzUFw.text: I have only ordered take-out from here a couple times, but thoroughly enjoyed everything I have ordered.  The wait staff is very nice... one of the times I was there waiting for my food a very impatient and rude patron was being very mean to the hostess and she took it in stride with a smile on her face.  When someone can do that I give them props:)

M_MxHqtOZvRJTq470_SQ7A.text: You are immediately hit with the warm smells and hissing steam from the feverishly flying pans in the kitchen.  The chatter coming from the tables of couples and families and friends softly whispers against the brick walls.  The Matisse art work on the walls and bistro tchotchkies say French, while the menu says Italian, no, Japanese, no, Indian.  The fabric napkins are folded oragami houses for your fork and knife.  A basket of home made rolls, banana bread, and cinnamon crisps makes a landing on every table.  The service is friendly and familiar.  The enormous portions of food, no matter from which corner of the world it hails, are fantastic.

1NRVuHqg8dP-kMGOEstq2w.text: this time around i got 2 try the ramen.  i got the hakana.  prob woulda been better for a colder day.  the broth was too salty for me but the noodles were good.    still got the clams so i was satiated.

TM_nVVzd5x_J4WbUb2eGwA.text: The emphasis at CBNC is on the food.  Companion and I both had the lunch special, a California roll and Udan or Soba noodle soup.  There are a half dozen selection of soups and you're sure to find something tasty.  I'll come back for noodle soup, it's flavorful and BIG.  The lunch special also comes with a mixed green salad, about the size of a normal salad course, and a tasty ginger dressing.  I finished my salad before the sushi and noodle soup arrived and simply could not finish my meal.  A quick word about the sushi here, have reasonable expectations.  It's not their forte and it's far below the quality of the rest of the meal. I'd give CBNC three and half stars but I think dining is about more than just the food.  The decor here is a mish-mash of western, asian, coffee house garb.  It really doesn't work and kept me a bit uncomfortable, in large part due to the abundance of nick-nacks on the table (little lamp [non-working], metal cactus sculpture and the assorted condiments).  It's a good thing the service is friendly and helpful because the menu is extensive.  Our waitress steered us toward Udan noodles (Soba noodles are a bit more substantial and made of wheat?) and we were happy about our choices. If CBNC would tighten its menu and choose one decor I'd probably be raving about it.  For now, it's just OK but I'll be back for another noodle lunch.

pS3SrcrnFOJNZgikKWAuTQ.text: They're food is really good.  And the staff is so fun and polite.  They have an awesome happy hour that is from 3-6 on weekdays where you get sushi and beer and some appetizer's for half off which is hard to beat.  The sauce for the udon noodles is really good too....and if you like spicy, the spicy korean noodles are really good as well.  All in all, its a great place.

2Ap5yIE3tLOchrW1N_neAA.text: All I have to say is YUM YUM YUM YUM! Sometimes their service is pretty slow, but the food is so worth it. It's healthy, fresh and utterly delightful! The bread that they serve before the meal is AMAZING! Order the wakame salad with shrimp and get the ginger dressing...you will thank me later.

-K-JCKKe2UQHWuRoyUZtSA.text: Yum, nice staff, cheap good food, yum.

m7vuCJqacUFXt3lzbLwgPg.text: Went for a little dinner and a beer before going out for some karaoke and dancing last night. We were having a great time, good food and atmosphere, when suddenly one of the servers/bus boys started hitting on my boyfriend. Whispering in his ear, going so far as to ask him to go out back to meet him. I didn't care for that bit of testosterone overload, but otherwise a good experience.

0oAfB_LwMY_ItJkYdZNfAQ.text: Craving a noodle soup--thought I'd check this place after seeing the reviews.  Upon entering I didn't like the air quality, smelled like dirty deep frying oil.  Upon perusing the menu and looking around at other diners food, I realized it was mostly composed of tempura, duh, deep fried.  Yikes, I am not a fan of deep frying but that explained the smell.   I opted for the shrimp udon soup.  It wasn't anything near the wonderful soup I had experienced elsewhere, especially this great Japanese restaurant in Chiang Mai that had this amazing moat around the sushi chefs were they would float the sushi on little boats that you could pick and choose.  Very disappointing, broth, noodles, spinach, green onion and 2 shrimp, $8.  I did get an added bonus of deep fat smell covering my clothing.

g6PdDdjADgHoNsmUdqCHmw.text: Not bad. The minute I stepped in this place I thought that I had accidentally looked up a previous address for CherryBlossom. I get that it's a fusion restaurant but it's a bit of a surreal experience to feel like you're eating sushi in a Mimi's Diner. Poking fun at the decor aside, CherryBlossom without a doubt knows it's Japanese cuisine. I forgot what types of sushi rolls I ordered but they certainly hit the spot as did the bowl of udon. It's not glamorous, and it's definitely not the best Japanese food, but if you're looking to dish out on the leaner side for lunch this is the place to swing by.

wdCM4y1x85Pn8zqZf40X7g.text: I just moved back to Arizona from Yokohama, Japan.  While I was there, my wife and I enjoyed Tonkotsu Ramen at a place called Ippudo.  Upon returning to the States, i thought I would never find Tonkotsu Ramen here.  Luckily, we found Cherry Blossom Noodle Cafe.  My wife and I could order in Japanse (her native tounge) again and the menu offered something other than sushi!  We had Takoyaki (which was expensive, but good) and Tonkotsu Ramen.  The ramen wasn't perfect, but hey....it's Phoenix!  We will certainly be back.

Z7VnyAvgkT9KDxhbdBt0vA.text: We are from San Francisco visiting and a friend recommended this place.  It was awesome.  The tempura was the best.  I loved  the chicken Marsala pasta.  It was weird to find Japanese and Italian in one place,but it works.  Don't forget to try desert.  We had chocolate cake and strawberry cake.  They were so light.  We went back for dinner again the next day to try the salmon spinach pasta and some of the sushi rolls.  The service was attentive even though the place was packed.  I look forward to coming here whenever we are in Az.

tuhMK4Pb_m07ZNzx5o99CA.text: love love love this place. a word to the wise, be careful when ordering take out... they tend to miss a few things due to the noise when calling in. double check your order, otherwise - it's a great hidden food spot!

SFOum2mTvRbazHlDF2S9wg.text: Here's the deal.  If i didn't love the food so much,  I would never go back.  The food is great.  The service is SO bad it's comical.  I always go in knowing I'm going to get the worst service and then I'm ok.  The wait staff is just not really attentive or GREAT at their job, but the baked goods and the food are really great.  Be patient and then you'll be fine.

R26clnGxUorDB-5z11jarA.text: decent food but spotty service...our server,Josh, was inattentive to the point of rude...he brought the entree soup and salad course before the appetizers and left the app plates on the table throughout the entree course...did not check on us during any of the courses but did so with the obivious "regulars" also seated in his section...one of worst servers I've ever encountered to the point of my not returning because of the chance of getting him again

E14NKA2RKh54g35WoloXhA.text: nice place... i went here after seeing all of the reviews.  i think that everyone summed the place up pretty good.  i was supervised by how many different ethnic foods they had... from Italian, to Korean, to Thai and even sushi.  i very affordable place with good food.

wnI3fDdCUUyxG8RrVW_DUA.text: This little joint has an interesting combo of Asian and Italian food. The seafood noodle dish was amazing and they have really excellent flavored sake. Cant wait to try more of their menu :)

h0QLTImZ6fBDEUCRJW_GYw.text: Very good ramen. Had some excellent pot stickers and edamame as well. Cheaply priced as well!

-8p2co6lFG1gM_uLstI0fw.text: When you see the store front...then you walk in it is totally not what you would expect at all. It had a small hole in the wall family owned feel to it. The way it was actually set up on the inside reminds me of a small street restaurant in NYC. Narrow, brick walls, many small tables lined up and friendly people walking around busily working hard to make us all happy. The menu was definately impressive to see so much variety. The portions are huge for main courses and I like how the appetizers are small so you do not feel that you are eating two meals. It's just a snack (which is what an appetizer is) The only unfortunate thing was the lady forgot to bring my hot green tea...oh well. I am asian and have plenty of tea at home if I truly need it. This place is great and I did enjoy the food and ambiance...only, I have other asian places that are more my favorites which is why in comparison this place gets three stars.

qe9YTAEXACPhLgshIUd6dw.text: The food is tasty.  I will definitely make the trip to try it again.  The only issue is it's quite crowded and they don't seem to have enough servers but I guess this is typical to all good restaurants.  I would still recommend this place to anyone.  I will also try their pastry next time.  It appears that this was a bakery in the past and then turned into a restaurant.

pGID2ETDdtnrGI_uiEEA7A.text: This place is fantastic. I decided to get some take out and it was delicious. I didn't want to stop at just one bowl of the Cha-Shu. I will definitely be going back many more times in the future.

RR6BRpNeIJIIN6SRl2smhw.text: Great place for any occasion.  Food is great. Sushi is fresh.  Service is amazing. Eat here once a week. And I live in Chandler

uDzc0d6PZoSorbjUWk9rRA.text: Amazing! Ramen was spicy and delicious! A must try. I totally recommend the California crunchy roll. Fresh flavors and reasonably priced. Will tell every sushi lover I know

2-8gqEGOQ1QqPLnvlqKsqg.text: Cherry Blossom is one of my favorite places to eat. I used to live in Japan and it's some of the best Japanese food I've had outside of Japan. Their Tonkotsu ramen (Hakata ramen on the menu) is best I've found in PHX. Their other menu items are also pretty tasty. Their prices are also pretty reasonable.   The only reason they don't get 5 stars is because of the service. It's rather sub-par. The wait staff are friendly they just aren't overly attentive and often seemed a bit confused or disjointed. I often find myself waiting for sometime after I sit down for a waiter to even come by with water. It's not the worst thing ever, and it's certainly worth it for the food, it's just the only thing keeping them from a 5 star review.

NCItBDeuMd7GEcpNzbiTgQ.text: Always the best ramen. I had a late night craving for ramen so I went for a simple bowl of Hakata Ramen, delicious as always. I was extra hungry so I ordered the ole stand by...Gyoza, another excellent dish. Everything was great except my server was more interested in some guys at another table so I waited for my water, waited for my order to be taken, waited for my check...it took much longer than I wanted for a evening snack on a not so busy evening. Ramen...the best in Phoenix so far.

wzlITP5RFuwQ6nHN8e358Q.text: My sister and I found this place just driving down Camelback, and we are soo happy we did! We started with the Caterpillar and Rainbow rolls (both just $5 during happy hour), both typical rolls, which they did very well. For our main course we split two entrees, the Beef Curry Udon and the Nagasaki dish, which consisted of a variety of seafood and veggies, and the crispy noodles, yum!! All the food was absolutely delicious, and at a fair price, especially during happy hour! What we found really entertaining is the surprising Italian menu they have, random, but it looked equally appetizing. We were sitting right next to the dessert display too, and though we didn't try anything, like their tiramisu, our mouths were watering.  The atmosphere is great; it has a French cafe fell, but with Italian influence, and then all of a sudden: great sushi and noodles! It's a lot of great cuisine under one roof. I'll definitely be returning.

TaL0ZyCNZw3s_fiD0YKEKA.text: Had a craving for spicy Ramen and I was not disappointed. It had just the right amount of spice/hot and the pork meat was delicious.   We also tried the Chicken Katsu and it was perfectly cooked. I've been to places where you can taste the week old chicken and day(s) old oil it was fried in, but not here, it was fresh chicken breast. We also tried the crunchy shrimp roll, it was also good.  The menu was a little odd, it featured sushi and traditional Japanese soups and platters, but it also had a page with Italian food...? Japanese and Italian are two of my favorite foods, but I'd rather they'd be at separate establishments! Lol  Overall our first experience was a good one, our waitress was extremely friendly and very helpful. No complaints here, we will be back soon!

OeoytMR3rwR4Lc2EyxuZiA.text: Two appetizers, two entrees and an alcoholic drink for under $40. The soba w/ buckwheat noodles... delicious and gluten-free. I'm in heaven.

l08hmhe72-S8Tn8TAkXzFA.text: Loved the food! Potstickers are good start and any noodle bowl is good. Ya lil cramped inside but it's a nice cozy kinda feel.

reMK3yXh1oKcWgr1OKMj5A.text: Really good food in a non-chain cafe. Very reasonable prices and great variety on the menu. Went here with family from coastal areas and they were impressed with the seafood. Cozy and inviting environment.

eeC-rlExa5X7ihQl092MAw.text: I had the tofu pasta with clam wine sauce. I have never tried tofu pasta before. It was very good. It's definitely a place for Japanese Italian (noodles) than traditional Japanese, but they have good sushi, too.

Ks08CikaMLYVjHrRWnnt9w.text: This is one of the best places in the valley to get authentic Japanese food at a great price. I've lived in Japan for a while and my wife is also Japanese, so when I and my wife say it's like being back in Japan, believe us. You can tell it's also authentic as the people running the restaurant are actually Japanese (most Japanese restaurants in the valley are some kind of American/Japanese fusion which isn't authentic at all). Anyway, the only downside is that it's in Phoenix which can be a drive depending on where you live. Great food, great prices! !

HSmu_njJIrjffPWK6-9qig.text: I am new here, in this desert land known as Phoenix.  Great cloud patterns, awesome blue sky, urgent and indomitable sun.  In a frenzy of missing LA food (DAIKOKUYA!!), I searched Yelp last night (honestly, more in time-killing mode) to find a place in Phoenix that sells authentic ramen (I am like Naruto with my ramen, fools).  Imagine my shock when I saw this place had ramen...not just ramen, but TONKOTSU ramen.  Then, and this is the killer, it was across the street from where I'm staying!  "At last," I thought, "God has forgiven me for that unfortunate incident in junior high on that co-ed camping trip."  Been making "good deed" installment payments on that incident for awhile.  Alas, he still has a bone to pick:  3 stars because the food wasn't just "it's not Daikokuya," but just not good.  Noodles were freshly un-bricked, 3 pieces of Oscar Meyer lunchmeat (or one slice cut up), and...actually, that's it.  No veggies, no seaweed, no egg, nothing else.  If you like ramen (and, more importantly, have had good ramen), probably not the place to rush to.  Shrimp dumplings were OK, though. Service was sketch:  took a crapload of time to flag my waitress to close out.  Place gets high marks from others, though, so I'll have to try something else some other time.  Maybe.  The heart takes awhile to heal.

PoQSE_6A23b5NTWaV31m8Q.text: Love Cherry Blossom; as close to my mother's cooking as I can get in Phoenix...From Udon Soup, Soba Noodles, Tempura, fresh fish dishes, Tonkatsu, Curry, Korean Spicy Rib, even this wonderful Mushroom & Scallop pasta dish they only have at happy hour (Please put it on the menu!!!) Haven't had a bad meal here...try to go here at least a couple times a month!!! Okay, had 1 bad dish; they didn't have Orange Roughy; so they subsituted Oreo Dory Fish; 2 bites, I sent it back; and got the salmon.  Which was flawless as usual. They do small touches; when asked; like ground daikon.  Something my mother & father do; when I go home to visit. Also, wish they would have Tsukemono; but maybe I have to bring my own from home... Gohan(Rice) is always perfect; so that's probably why I like this place and Tokyo Express next door.

AJo6iqfZiR_D5SVgjkVpPQ.text: The food here is pretty good.  I've been coming here for years and they are pretty consistent, at least with certain items.  I don't eat the sushi here, nor have I really had it here, so I can't say if it's bad or good.  Killer luch specials, just don't go if you are hurried, service is a touch on the 'casual' side.  Good value for lunch especially!  They also have a happy hour menu with various items, otherwise evrything hovers around $10  Excellent:  Chicken Katsu-Just like mom used to make with a slightly americanized tonkatsu sauce...but still good  Pork Katsu-YUM  Chicken Coleslaw Salad-Fresh with tons of chicken, had to take some home to go!  Shrimp Tempura Udon-good shrimps, noodles for a cold day  Teriyaki Chicken Bento Box-GOOD!  Teriyaki Salmon Bento Box-Good!

XklsoFn0haKscTldBOV9GQ.text: Wow! Didn't expect that! Excellent food the whole way around. Japanese and Italian mix? Ya gotta go. Sushi is excellent. Fast service but not fast food!!

EulHfyfnjM_BY2y3DFGD0Q.text: They lost a loyal customer, I will not return. Bad service, mold on the bread.  I have been coming here for years now, I have recommended this place to people and they have taken their friends. I have been served by the owner, who is phenomenal. She knows how to make customers feel special! Unfortunately the staff doesn't have the same exceptional customer service as she does. The service is usually mediocre at best. I have overlooked this because the food is good and on occasion the owner would serve us and give us a great experience.  But I won't return as my last visit was wrought with terrible serve and poor quality food. The server we had was exceptionally bad, it seemed likey from lack of experience and/or training. She miscounted the amount of waters we needed then didn't come back, we had to go find someone and request the missing water. They didn't give us silverware and when we asked the busser for some she said, "Ask your waitress". The appetizers arrived as we were finishing our meal.  Then after eating part of a roll I found mold on the bread. No one in my party ate their bread rolls after that, understandably. The manager was informed of the situation and didn't even come to the table, I had to ask the server to tell him to come over.  His response to me was "It's just a little bit of mold. And anyways the bread is free." I was appalled. He offered to replace the one moldy roll with a fresh one and that was it. Over and over he repeated "it was only a little bit of mold". This made me question all the other food, if a little bit of mold was acceptable for a customer to eat then what else was acceptable? My group and I began to have doubts about the food we were eating and left most of the food untouched. I really did enjoy their food in the past, but if moldy bread is fine with management then this is not a place I want to eat.

GM5RfEJeUCDX2n0t_ssgYA.text: Good food, slow service  My wife and I had Cherryblossom on our list for a while. Finally stopped in for lunch when we were in the area and noticed the crowd wasn't overflowing. Both parking and seating are tight. And this is obviously a popular spot.   We were seated quickly, but no waiter visited for just over ten minutes. I signaled to the hostess lady and she nodded, saying she would send him over. Finally had our orders in about 15 minutes after being seated-- Champon for me and Udon Sucki for her along with two rolls of sushi and gyoza.  Initial drinks landed soon after ordering and food followed some minutes behind. That's all we saw of our waiter again for a long while. The lack of service really put a damper of the experience since we came in excited to eat here.  The food was only okay by our tastes. The broth was okay, if bland and diluted. The noodles were par for the course. They were very generous on the seafood in the Champon, which was nice. The sushi was good, whereas the gyoza was very light on meat.   We probably expected too much after seeing so many crowds. Would try them again... maybe something from the Korean side of the menu?

09y7aIWb_m2jp3kVvA-h7w.text: I've actually never heard of this place since I live in the East Valley so it is quite far for me. However, my friends were RAVING about it and wanted to come here for dinner last night and I'm always up for trying new places. =)  I actually really liked the ambiance of the restaurant. It has a cozy, mom and pop shop feel to it. As far as the menu, there are so many things to choose from! They have such a variety of things on the menu that it was so hard to know what to get. Plus I was starving so I wanted to try EVERYTHING! You can have some italian pasta, ramen noodles, sushi, cold noodles, hot noodles, Thai noodles or a rice dish. It was such a huge selection to choose from.   I'm glad I came with my friends because I was so indecisive on what to order. I ended up getting the Chicken Pad Thai with a milk green tea to wash it down. I've never really enjoyed a green tea but when I saw it on the menu it was something different so I wanted to try it. It was actually quite tasty. They also have a variety of wines and cocktails to choose from. The Chicken Pad Thai itself was ok. I thought it was a bit salty and wasn't anything spectacular.   All in all, I don't think it's a restaurant that I would drive across town to. If I was in the area then it would most likely be an option to choose from, mainly because I also want to try their sushi and ramen noodles. But they are well known for their noodles so I'd like to come back to try that next time. =)

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken pad thai

HNrKHNXfmmQABRuWEDqUBg.text: Great service with outstanding fresh food! Flavors are on point and the desert is stupid delicious!!!

D2F9lWrb6hQh2Y8xTrTXIQ.text: The beef udon suki is the best here and it's my to go dish every time I come here. I live in chandler but will drive all the way here just to eat this dish. The broth is so flavorful and every time you take a bite of the beef, udon and the soup it's amazing! The portion is big and they don't skimp on the meat which I appreciate :)

w5qivvolW2YJ-U4iq-hXig.text: First time here. Fast and friendly service, delish food (with a good and variable menu), and a nice and clean environment.

dp-uWOmkzrl5I-C703TVlA.text: This was my first experience with Ramen and I loved it. The cafe is clean and small inside. The employees are friendly. And the food is great. I also had sushi that was awesome. I recommend this place. Lunch for two came out to $40.

me8p4NGLpphLhlHAwBW2MQ.text: My first time eating here was a pleasant experience. I came in right as the lunch rush was ending, tables were still full so I sat at the bar. I was seated quickly and had my order in front of me in less than 20 mins. Which was shocking due to the crowd. I ordered the curry chicken Katsu. It was DELICIOUS. Perfect curry flavor. My waiter was attentive but he did seem a bit annoyed by his manager or maybe it was just typical kitchen drama. Since I was sitting at the bar, the cooks and I had a great laugh about it. I will be back and hope to try one of tempting desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Curry chicken Katsu! Delicious!

-jL85bg1WmX3Q1F2KOZ6EA.text: The food here is awesome and very flavorful!  If you are looking for a wide selection of Japanese food that is fresh and delicious, look no further!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood Udon

x2Jcbt1XuqJuh36xetPxTQ.text: If you're craving for noodles, stop by Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe! The usual starter for me is the all in one tempura that includes fried vegetables, fish, calamari, and shrimp. For the entree, go for a noodle dish. My preference is the cha shu which is the hakata ramen but with more bba pork! The broth is a milky white broth that will warm your soul. Green onions and strips of mushroom as garnish. Lastly, the noodles are the perfect consistency. You'll want to eat your noodle dish as soon as possible to avoid getting the noodles mushy. If you do not prefer ramen, there are other dishes featuring udon and soba noodles along with a variety of non-noodle dishes.

hq9mjZEzjh46-ajfSWc3DA.text: Excellent food and excellent service! We ordered the tatamain ramen (spiciest signature dish ramen) and our waitress (Lilian) was incredible! It was our first time and we will be back and back again---great restaurant!  Thank you!!!

68G30eAbk03JUPiWis6Kog.text: Really good! They definitely KNOW THEIR NOODLES! I only say 4-star based on the ambiance. The restaurant was kind of bright and unromantic for date night (looks like it used to be a Marie calendar's or a Cracker Barrel with the wooden booths and all the farmhouse-homey decor), but the food was great and well-priced and our server was really knowledgeable on the menu and the exact right amount of attentive.

N-nuc5bhSCfF1VrqPpYTUQ.text: Although at first I got confused with the concept or the setting of the place, different kind of menu, The menu offers sushi, Italian, ramen, rice, noodles, meat, tofu, seafood, and desserts.  The calamary crispy enough although I still could see the oil left on the plate.  The service was nice.  I would like to go back to try something else.

B0ITZnfplwX1hcZKCTT7Zg.text: FOOD - I could say that their RAMEN is the best in the valley so far. Lots of choices and their appetizers are really good as well.   SERVICE - Fast and friendly. Thats what matters right?   AMBIENCE - Feels like a True asian restaurant with the the decor and lights.  PRICE - Very decent and reasonable. I paid $10 for a ramen bowl and $4 for an appetizer.   RECOMMENDATION - BEST RAMEN in the valley. I highly suggest to try this place out. Better ramen than other ramen places like Tampopo and ramen republic in tempe.

EeLYAV8uCozRPzP9SunQmw.text: Decent food, I like the twist of Italian and Asian cuisine. A bit pricey, but if you have a few extra dollars its not so bad every once in awhile. Their menu is decent with options. Food took awhile to come out, but they were super busy and completely packed so I'll give them some slack there.

dJp0ht_jSIDfFvDYb8LQvg.text: Great place for fusion style food. A combination of Japanese and Italian. Been here several times now and always good food. Recently the portion size has gotten smaller and price a bit higher though.

4qS9_Q7WGcKd7ROam1-OXA.text: Friend told me about the place when in Phoenix because I was craving pasta and he was craving ramen. This place has the best of both worlds with pasta choices and ramen choices! Also had a dessert of the taro cake which was definitely satisfying.

C6KMGqRW44fOEidGjwifqA.text: It's been a while since I've eaten here but last time we were here we ordered a rainbow roll, soba noodles with chicken and ramen. Let me just say, don't get the sushi, this place definitely specializes in their hot dishes. Roommate at the time and I both enjoyed our soups so we will be back again for that. I thought this was Japanese food only but the menu has all kinds of Asian food... Not a fan of that because you always ending up loving half the menu and hating the other half. Stick to your specialties please! I will be back eventually to try some more items.    Parking lot gets packed FAST and I've always had to wait at least an hour to be seated.

GwWS9TlcxwG8_OtfdGsbow.text: This is one of my favorite spots to eat in Phoenix. It's a pretty tiny restaurant tucked away in a small shopping center. The interior is really nice with quite a bit of seating despite how the restaurants size. The kitchen is open so you can see the cooks making your food, which is kinda nice. I always get a tan tan men when I come here but I've also tried several of their sushi rolls, yakiniku, cha shu and some other dishes that I can't remember off the top of my head. I've never been disappointed by anything! I would like to try some of their pasta dishes sometime but I always end up getting tan tan men because it's so good. I must also add that I often drive here all the way from Goodyear, but it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tan tan men

tak-_jFyHZj9YQot6_e6gw.text: This is a unique kind of restaurant with a really varying menu that serves noodles of all different types, from Italian to Thai.  There is always a wait and the service can be a little bit questionable, but the food never disappoints. I have decided that there pad Thai is my favorite and that is typically what I order but I have also had the Ramen and a spaghetti dish and been impressed with all of them. Parking can sometimes be difficult because Oreganos is next-door and a lot of folks park in this lot and walk over to Oreganos.

seX80nSbQW5R59Y0zLpHww.text: The mix between Italian and Japanese plus the really good service equals a very good restaurant. When you combine the food and this amazing pastries it brings it up to an excellent restaurant.  It's a small place but you can tell everything is made with love. The beef curry udon was a good broth with taste udon noodles - highly recommend it. Gyoza was very good as well as the mango tango.

HUZxPnAYwBLKRlN5x3_duQ.text: Don't know why this place is rated so high. Average fooooooood. Been here three times and I just don't understand why people rate this place higher than 3 stars. Very average restaurant. I have had the nigiri, ramen, and udon. If you don't believe me and still dine here get the udon it was ok.

Xy10Wcl-f5OlKDWvLgqonw.text: I'm so confused by the amazing reviews. Maybe I just came on a really off day, but Cherryblossom Cafe was both extremely underwhelming in terms of food and service.   The interior has a dimly-lit, cozy ambiance, but it was really, really hot inside (and I usually dislike air conditioning). That coupled with the small space and coziness of the tables made for a very uncomfortable lunch. Our waitress was probably exhausted from the heat and lunchtime rush as well, and she seemed short and irritable as she took our order. She checked on us all of one time in the long 45-minute wait before the food came, and we had to try repeatedly to flag down a server for water refills. Asking for the check took similarly long, to the point where we walked up to the counter to pay.   Japchae: This was probably the worst rendition of this Korean noodle dish I've ever had. It was a smaller appetizer potion, hence the lower price point. The noodles were thinner than usual, severely undercooked, and salty to the point of being inedible. The beef slices were thin and over-marinated so they were even saltier than the other components of the dish. I tried a few mouthful because I was so hungry by the time this came, but each mouthful of crunchy noodles was less palatable than the last.  Yakisoba: Similarly to the japchae, this dish was deathly salty. To add insult to injury, the vegetables and some of the meat were burnt. I think they were probably at be bottom of the wok during stir-frying and left there for too long. I'm a fan of the toasty flavor of wok break, but not when the ingredients are bitter. I thought the noodles were a touch underdone, but it wasn't as bad as the japchae. As far as stir-fried. noodles go, I wouldn't order this again.  Champon: This dish wasn't bad, as the soup wasn't too salty and there was a good portion of seafood. I liked the baby octopus, squid, and shrimp. The noodles were chewy and elastic, and the portion was pretty large.  Cha-shu ramen: This was probably the best dish of the meal, as the broth was creamy and flavorful. I wouldn't say it was authentic because I didn't get that pork broth flavor I usually look for in my ramen, but the flavor was pleasant. The noodles were undercooked so the center was slightly crunchy, but I let them soak in the hot broth for about ten minutes and they were fine. The pork had been cooked and refrigerated, but it's rare to find a restaurant that doesn't do this since cha-shu takes a while to cook.  I probably won't be back, although I didn't try the sushi and that's what other tables around me seemed to order instead of noodle dishes. Based on my experience, I wouldn't recommend this restaurant for its namesake: noodles.

We haven't been here in over a year. Still very good service and fantastic food. Try the Korea Beef Hot plate and the spicy shrimp appetizers.

qj6p0iaMquSvzotxIlD3lg.text: Kind of a strange combination of Sushi and Italian food, but great food and even better looking deserts...

BQrhP-A4dedVa-TPe90fzw.text: The hakata ramen and potstickers were amazing! Completely recommend. Environment was lovely as well

Fgezumpeyxb2HPtb3hAVrQ.text: I always call it.... As is.. This place has great food, and something for everyone.  This traditional Japanese eatery actually has their own, very delicious version of spaghetti with meat sauce.  I highly recommend checking this place out.

XjaLUS66JnR_v20s47bzww.text: Oddly enough, I've been to Cherryblossom loads of times in the past. How I haven't reviewed it is beyond me. But, that's neither here nor there. I returned to Cherryblossom for a first-date last night and was reminded why this is such a great place.  We shared the gyoza, which Adam hadn't ever had before. Served in a sizzling pan, they were wonderful...and perfectly portioned for two people. He ordered the Hot Thai Beef Salad (which he apparently orders every time he comes here), I had the cold Zaru Soba. My noodles were terrific with their dipping sauce. I tried Adam's beef, and it was deliciously tender.  Can't wait to come back.

Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gyoza

UWqocbn7ceq2ijJV4TbXzQ.text: Ambience is good. Not too crowded when I visited. Food was good for the price. Servers are alright. I felt they are not as warm as most servers are but they were not rude either. I would come back to try different things if I'm on that side of town.

0G6etLvnYGqauFoDX-QNFw.text: Late night drop in. The shrimp Pad Thai was delish and not lacking in shrimp. Had them add green onions to it. The egg was cooked to perfection. Huge serving! Thai tea was tasty too.  My daughter ordered chicken ramen noodles and said it was the best she ever had. I didn't taste it as she was sick with a nasty cold, but said it was soothing to the throat. I was just glad she ate. She ordered a Shirley Temple. No refills on drinks.  If you sit in the back room just before closing, a heads up - that's where the employees sit, grab a bite, and talk about each other. Service was great.
