yMFAzv8TwXCfU4G3SlWpsg.text: One of the best places for ramen and sushi , the menu hold a variety of delicious Asian/ Italian food  including sushi and sake , but by far their ramen is one of the best ! For appetizers we always gyoza they are some pan fried pork vegetable pot stickers with a special sauce and they are to die for .  Can forget their complementary freshly baked bread it's so soft and delicious. It's a small cozy place with great atmosphere and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork belly ramen
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gyoza

5_V0nwWzCvDGhx4gwmpElw.text: Oh Cherry Blossom Noodle Cafe I'm going to miss you . The Ebi-ten Udon will bring me back but only once or twice a year. My family has frequented this restaurant for many years. Before all the hype and the city found out about you. You won't hurt for business but you lost some customers tonight.   If you've never been you must go. The shear variety they offer and certain dishes which are delicious are worth a try. That being said the quality of their food has suffered some. The Tokyo Express they own next store has bled over just enough that someone whose been going there since the early 2000's can tell. The service tonight was horrible and the young lady at the front who rolled her eyes at a simple request to change tables (slow night lots of room) sealed the deal. I'm not going to drop a couple of bills to be treated like that. Not when the city now offers many more options.  I'm actually kind of sad. This used to be "Our" place.

EY5EeZelz4Lltmeo5trRFQ.text: The bread is amazing!!!! We have had a few dishes here and they were mostly good. But their water taste terrible. And the water affects their soups and soda. So I have to take that into account when ordering here

nCroreDUWL7DHjlhurjKtA.text: Very disappointed with this place, I've been coming here for years but I have to say today changed my feelings on this place and don't think I will ever be back, I came in and was seated, we were not greeted at all within the first 5 mins, I then saw 2 other parties be seated and greeted right away, I then walked to the front to ask what was going on and an employee by the name of Kristin told me they were very busy and has only two servers, not sure why that was a reason for not being greeted before the 2 parties that had been seated 5 minutes after I was. She told me she would send a server but I was so annoyed by then I walked out as she started to laugh and say bye have a good day. Cherry blossom has went down over the years unfortunately because I use to love the place, not sure who management is but they should probably consider hiring more employees!!

IOZnkwEyu3ZtbYBVaTS3Sg.text: I ordered the vegetable roll and vegetable tempura roll. They cheaply cut the rolls very thin. It doesn't even feel like you're eating sushi. I've ordered these types of rolls at various establishments and this one is a great disappointment. I was astounded at how poorly these so called sushi rolls were. Also they only gave me 7 pieces on one of the orders. I definitely would not eat here ever again. There are plenty of others sushi places that can successfully produce a simple roll, and not skimp on the portion.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. TWO orders. Skimped on the portion by cutting them VERY thin. CHEAP way to make sushi. Gave me 7 pieces on one instead of 8. Thumbs down.

LYAlCV6RBf8mwYLVeTXtfA.text: So far this is the best noodle and sushi place I have been to. Customer service  is excellent and it's a little cute place clean also.

OvYfD_gjaXkxH45Y87Ax-w.text: Amazing place to go! I ordered tempura Soba noodle and it was very delicious! Temperature of those soup was perfect!

ESzZBSLiQkMlp3wiGccj8w.text: Wow, I've never seen a restaurant with so many rest reviews.  A friend and I decided to give this place a try!  We order the Tan Tan Ramen for $12 and the Beef Noodle stir fry for $12 along with a hour happy rainbow roll for $6.50  The Tan Tan Ramen had lots of Ramen and it was really filling. The right amount of spice as well!  The Beef Boodle Stir Fry was actually more spicier than I expected. It was still tasty, definitely not for someone who doesn't like spicy.   My favorite was actually the Rainbow roll. Not a bad deal for only $6.50  If I'm ever on this side of town, I would come back for half hour and get sushi. I felt like the entrees for expensive for what they were.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tan tan ramen
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rainbow roll

_XLqQ4Dq84nPyPeJqZkFUA.text: Sorry to say I have to adjust my review downward....  I've been here probably a half dozen times and really enjoyed the place, but my recent visits have been less than satisfying.  The last couple of times they did not get my order correctly.  I think it's a nice touch if the waiters can remember your order without writing it down, but they might want to start writing it down here.  I ordered the ramen without sprouts and a drink, and the ramen came with sprouts and my drink never came.  The time before that they brought out the wrong sushi appetizer, so it's starting to be a pattern.  Not good.  I can usually set that aside because I enjoy the ramen so much, but it doesn't have the same kick to it that it used to.  Maybe I had an off day batch but it wasn't something that I'd be willing to overlook the other issues for.  I was waiting for a while for my check so I finally went up to the counter instead of waiting any longer.  Overall it felt disappointing.

lioq33NYYHMqBQVzFtK7Yw.text: Came here on a Saturday night with my girlfriend around 7:30 and was seated right away. Super cute atmosphere and friendly staff. Aside from the great service the food was delicious. We started with the "extremely" spicy gyoza pot....not spicy at all, but still very tasty! I ordered the hakata ramen with a poached egg ! And my girlfriend the cha-shu. The broth was savory and creamy. Added some chili paste to add some spice and it was perfect!   I definitely recommend trying this place!

e0vStcdDbwwcOyTfWDr3EA.text: The chicken Phad Thai here is like the casting of Mance Rayder in Game of Thrones...like I'm sure he is a great actor but his face is weird.

r7OoxLvd7IMV-GVUiRTObw.text: I probably drive past Noodle Cafe at least three times a week. Every time, I think, "I wonder if they have good noodle soup? I'd like a bowl of noodle soup." Then I keep driving, because it's usually 11 pm.   However today, all of the stars aligned and I stopped in for lunch. I had the Udon Noodle Combo (Bowl of Udon soup and California Roll). The Udon was with "Mixed Mountain Vegetables" (which had an extremely similar flavor to chives and spinach). The food was good; not extraordinary, but good.   I considered giving CherryBlossom Noodle Cafe three stars, but when it came down to it, the service was good and helpful, my order was done quickly, and the price is right. In my book, that's worth the extra star!

189xokDNVkP8OtG8ApSh7A.text: OMG a new food experience!  Amazing amazing food and extremely reasonable. We accidentally happened upon this treasure, and had to wait in line on a thursday at 6 PM, so it's very popular indeed.  The giant calamari salad is my new addiction. The service was friendly and enthusiastic.  Great place ... wish they would add a location in Sedona, where the food and service is needing much improvement.

VPaslXwBP4xfRFnMhEQtlw.text: This is one of the place I would have never come to if no one told me ...  But I am pleasantly surprised ...   I wanted dessert and wanted something different from the normal AJ stuffs (they are good I know... just wasn't feeling it) I ordered the tropical cake ... OMG, it was so good !!! The cake is perfectly moist and with layered home-made whipped cream along with bunch of tropical fruit .... oh did I mention I love my whipped-cream & strawberry :P   The whipped cream is so heavenly creamy ... and not overly sweet, just perfect with the natural sweetness from the fruit ... haven't had cake that is so good for a long while.... yummmmm  I cannot speak for their noodles or other dishes ... but it seems promising.  Will try it someday, cute little place inside

mynMgNCzJKRsDBJob2-34A.text: Adorable, simply, adorable!  I love how I just drive by places like this and never think to try them or never see them at all, I sure have been missing out. Like, how interesting to have the choice between pasta or Asian food, I wouldn't have thought to make the connection, so props to the owners. Normally, I would say that a place like this is "culturally-confused", but they do a good job at it so I can't complain. There was European and Asian decor all over the place, hah, loved the tele booth! It was so cozy and clean, the store fronts to places like these always throw me off, I never know what to expect inside.  I had a very large lunch today, my combo came with salad, soba/udon soup, and a Californian roll. I choose the Kitsune Udon, I never had tofu seasoned like that before, it was almost like eating dessert, in a big bowl of noodles, so very sweet. I'm not the one to purposefully eat Californian rolls but there's was great and so nicely presented. And to drink, (smirk) I had the Japanese Mojito, which had sake instead of rum (I figured why the heck not, I tried a mojito made with whiskey the week prior!). Shockingly delicious, def could taste the sake but in a good way, also there iced green tea was refreshing.  Now, with a full belly and happy heart, this afternoon's studying will be a bit more bearable. Thank you for an afternoon affair to remember Cherryblossom!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kitsune Udon Soup
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. CA roll
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mojito n Lunch Side Salad

kw4wn_OZTw8nEu1M2puXog.text: I went back again for more ramen.  This time is just as good as last time, with even larger portion.  I also went during happy hour this time around 4:30pm on a Wednesday and the restaurant was kicking.  Catepillar roll had good portion size and fresh for $6, calamari too.  They also had spicy ribs on the appetizer menu...got to try that next.  Udon in iron pot looked good too! Service is once again fast and friendly.  It really is becoming one of my favorite joints in AZ.  Located in a small plaza.  4.5 stars!

Spv3Nk0VUgfG_T9qo56Neg.text: Everyone really enjoyed eating here.  We a beef udon hot pot, pork ramen, pad Thai and tan tan men. The broths were all delicious and unique.  It was fairly 'Americanized' but so are we, so it was great. I would highly recommend.

jfYULOvs3e8NSq7i73Ch2g.text: The best Japanese restaurant in Phoenix that I have been to so far.  I am a Japan native and this comes close to home cooking. Love it. Also, the desserts are a light and wonderful treat.

1uaN8WOMG114QmHs5ZLEnQ.text: The items on the menu were a hit and miss it seems like from the things my table ordered - from katsu-don to their Vongole. Some of our food was good while others were subpar and bland. I ordered the Vongole and while the clams were good, the pasta was bland. The pasta was more of a bed for the clams as opposed to being a part of the dish. Expect the service to be slow during dinner times.

Dj2IhDwFf5uSvmyrDfBBpg.text: I don't get what people like about this place. It's generally crowded with rushed service and the food has yet to impress. I've tried at least twice -- maybe I'm ordering wrong but I really just don't get it...

vCnIxin5ursmoo0fFD7dgQ.text: Tried it again ONLY because some friends were having a special occasion for an early-ish dinner.  One would think that the owners would at least LOOK at the reviews. Would address some of the issues but it never fails to amaze me that time and time again they have all the same issues and all the same problems.   This time the staff behind the counter in what I imagine barely passes as a kitchen, were so loud, rude and inappropriate that we could hear their banter and loud voices in the dining area.   Is there no manager!?!  I didn't think it was possible that the food could possibly get worse but it has. The upside is the calamari wasn't quite as rubber-like this time. On the downside, the service still was HORRIBLE in every way.  So, no good news here. Avoid.

Xo3kq0wVpCR-n31KWEaNZg.text: I got the worst food poisoning I have ever had in my life from this place. It has been three days and I'm still having trouble eating and digesting food. I do not recommend eating here

xFfNAItXhClCdardpBRjbQ.text: I've been here only once for lunch and I was really pleased.  I think the Bento Box is the best value, perfect for a quick lunch.  The decor is really surprisingly authentic to a neighborhood ramen-ya in Japan.  The staff were very nice.  I took a little tart with me as a treat for later, loved it, and wished I'd gotten more.  I'm definitely going back again.

JXf9ivbb0CPELChqFfGnNg.text: Hmm...I wouldn't say this is the best meal I've ever had and paying $30 for a mediocre meal isn't my idea of a good time.   The night started with a socially awkward waiter, who wasn't a bad server exactly, but it just made the mid-meal interruptions more noticeable.  I got some pad thai and the best thing was the sauce. I can say I thought it was pretty decent, but the rest was meh.. The chicken was dry, the tofu was more chewy than tofu should be....but the worst part! is that my noodles were not good!! It's a NOODLE cafe!   Might be for some people, but it's not for me.

4JM55t4ce8ps3emofACJWQ.text: This is a delicious spot especially for lunch. Sushi is fresh and good. Spicy gyoza soup appetizer is delicious and flavorful. The shrimp lettuce wraps aren't traditional, they taste more like something you would serve on top of rice, however they are amazing!! Tan tan men is good for a cold day, but doesn't have much meat.. Huge portion of noodles though. Place is so cute inside even though it looks like a shitty strip mall location! Must go! I will be back many more times.

mxz59mDmaAm5-tC-0msXxA.text: This place is pretty amazing!  Not because of the food or decor, but rather the hostess, who is smarter than the average bear. To be clear, the hostess I am referring to is the short Mexican lady that can't keep up with her duties as a hostess (but obviously is oblivious to the fact). When it started getting busy, I saw her neglect multiple people upfront who were waiting to put their names on a wait list since she thought it was better to let the area get so crowded waiters couldn't get through. She eventually started a list but didn't put for names of the people who she said she would remember that were already waiting. As you would suspect, Ms. Einstein started seating people from the list ahead of those that were waiting. I witnessed this and saw people getting pretty upset with her and the lack of organization. The front desk area was chaos...it was hilarious!  At one point there was a waiter standing in the middle of a crowd people upfront looking helpless.  Anyways, just wanted to give a standing ovation to the hostess with the mostess...you deserve a gold star!!!  Wait who are those customers leaving..."Cherry Lost-em" as in customers forever!  Ha!  Couldn't resist!

l6uAzGQRsRQ8ClZa7Fci6g.text: Atmosphere plus food is great.  The service exceeded my expectations based on other reviews here.  We tried both the chicken pad thai (5 stars especially if you love cilantro) and the korean beef. Lots of leftovers for lunch today :)  I will let others know about this hidden gem.

qVc4nPA6Dq-FcHXU0vqEcQ.text: The good: Nice ambiance, friendly service. I was trying to find a good ramen place (so spoiled by Orenchi in the bay area... that's the golden standard). Walked in and saw some Asian people so thought it was a good sign.   The bad: Ordered chicken karage and ramen - chicken karage looked straight outta the freezer section at your local supermarket!   If you haven't had good chicken karage, it's fried (chicken, duh) with a batter similar to tempura (lighter than traditional American batters). Nope, this was your standard frozen, then warmed chicken with a rubbery-coating-that-passes-as-real-fried-food. If I wanted frozen food, I would have just made it myself (no I wouldn't, that shit tastes terrible).   The sauce was uninspiring, but hey, does it matter if the chicken isn't worth it?   The ugly:  The ramen I ordered came out... and disappointment abounds. First, the noodles looked like what you buy at the supermarket. So... yeah, if I want supermarket food, I'll just go to the supermarket. Am I wrong to expect restaurants to actually prepare food from scratch? Oh but it's so hard to make noodles by hand/machine you say? THAT'S WHY I SPEND MONEY IN A RESTAURANT!!!!  What about the broth? The life-sustaining broth that is cooked for hours if not days and ties the entire dish together ... well let's not get too excited because once again, it tastes more like powdered mix.   Are we sensing a theme here? Lots of supermarket stuff, at a premium price. Sorry, that's not why I go to a restaurant.  So why did I even bother trying this place? Because Yelp had promised me a grand culinary experience (okay maybe not grand, but good at least). This was really sub-par at best; the nicest servers or prettiest backdrop cannot make up for low-quality food. But I am a temporary tourist in Phoenix (4 months for work, normally in SF), so take my ran with a grain of salt. Maybe all that big city living has made me a (ramen) snob; YMMV

3kdOoRj1vhesTWStPDolTQ.text: Absolutely delicious, and a very pleasant surprise.  While it seems like a little strip mall joint, it's really quite pretty inside.  The menu is extensive, and full of vegetarian options (important for me, a veggie).  We shared the ginger eggplant app to start, and then shared some veggie rolls as well. One diner got the chicken parm (oh yes...they also have Italian food...and yummy banana bread along with white rolls), two of us got only sushi, and I got the mushroom tofu dish.  Everyone cleared their plates. Very tasty, and quite affordable.  One thought - their mixed drinks, at the least the specialty ones, are really odd. I definitely won't be ordering that again. However, everything else was tasty, and we'll be back. Just don't go if you're in a hurry - service left something to be desired. Like the bill.

rNqVQIK_3SjCWAj3115DMA.text: I'm very spoiled, eating a lot of ramen in NY and N Cali so my expectations are very high. But I have to say that the ramen (and food in general) at Cherry Blossom is very good. Came in early and took advantage of happy hour for draft beer and appetizers ...gyoza and a caterpillar roll. Had their ramen which was pretty good. I spiced it up with some hot sauce and really increased the intensity. Phoenix suffers from a lack of good Asian good in general, but ramen specifically. F you want a good priced dinner and solid tasting food, cherry blossom is a great option in the heart of Phoenix.

I2OL1JSSMeQUvKwz_lO0QQ.text: This place was so good and it's super cute inside too. It's always packed whenever I go, but the wait is worth it.

cURNv_iJLNQRu18eW5-kmQ.text: The service was friendly and inviting. The atmosphere was casual and light, it did not feel like we were in Phoenix! The food was delicious and flavorful. We had fried pork belly, shrimp udon, and spicy Korean beef (not very spicy at all but you can add hot sauce). The fried pork belly had an amazing glaze sauce!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp tempura udon noodles, fried pork belly, and spicy Korean beef everything was amazing!!!

CR68g4ZPBXhQ4V1jEDZ55Q.text: This is the most authentic Japanese food you'll find in Arizona. I lived in Japan for three years and my spouse is from Japan and this place has the broadest menu and best ramen. Don't be weirded out by the Italian menu. It's Japanese style Italian which has a lighter taste and unique flavor. The owners are great (also from Japan) and their servers are awesome! Oh, the cakes are also amazing! Not too sweet and perfect to enjoy as a treat. Nothing on the dessert menu is a disappointment!

u0C3XEIf9ka8GDkBmn9PVQ.text: Don't listen to all the over entitled cry-babies. Is this place busy? Yes, and there's a reason for it. Their food is amazing and the staff do their best to accommodate. Last time my friends and I ate here it took a while to be seated, get our food and one entree came out later than the others. It was the dinner rush so kind of to be expected. We didn't feel comfortable eating without the last person's entree. So we waited and our server noticed without us saying anything. Our server stepped up and refreshed the rest of our meals (ramen) so that everyone had hot meals at the same time. Then he removed the late entree from the bill for the inconvenience and gave us TWO amazing desserts on the house as a way of apologizing for any inconvenience. We never made a stink, but this was certainly appreciated and more than made up for any long wait or inconvenience. This is not something I'd expect on every visit, but it does go to show that the staff is doing what they can to ensure an enjoyable visit. As for the food, everything has been wonderful and delicious. Curious to try their Italian selections next time!

AYT4PUkfxiK8XqJuPEjONw.text: This place has a little bit of everything. They bring you bread and a salad like an Italian restaurant and the sushi is delicious!  Located in a Small shopping center but very warm atmosphere inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WpqFXVz37jWdsZUNuJk3xw.text: Lunch at Cherry Blossom is usually a five-star experience, but today not so much. We ordered the Bento boxes. The miso soup was too salty to eat so we sent it back. The waitress apologized, promising to bring a replacement. The replacement didn't come till after we were halfway into our bento boxes. The boxes included sushi, but no wasabi or Ginger! The sushi rolls, salad, orange slices and the tempura were yummy, but the steak was too tough to eat. After the waitress brought our check, she didn't return to pick up the credit card so I carried it over to the cashier. Well, maybe they were short staffed so I'll cut the server some slack, but the substandard soup and steak and the sushi served sans ginger are just disappointing.

sbqb8DBsgiY-d_9gzL5hzg.text: I was a bit skeptical about this place. Coming from Korea town in California it's hard to find a really good noodle place. However this noodle place is like no other. They serve Italian dishes as well. It's like an Asian Italian fusion restaurant. Pretty weird, but it WORKS in their favor. The bread they serve once you're seated is pretty amazing. I ordered spring rolls, dumplings, and veggie udon soup. Really good! Not disappointed at all!

2NKMpy_kgrsfo3SH4Z6e3g.text: The miso soup with salmon is always great. The service is good and the food comes out in a timely manner. It's a bit small inside but thats not a bad thing.

FL6RNRem_oErsmUKzxI36g.text: Food was trash. Noodles were trash. Chicken Parmesan was trash. Even they water was trash. Save your money and go to The Street in Mesa.

WdbQazZug-S1z4Ys70OxGw.text: I called them to order birthday cake. I have ordered so many times for 3 years. The waitress who answered my call was very rude and unprofessional. I contacted them via face book messenger and told about the waitress's behavior. The person who responded said " seems like I called wrong number" Omg I had been calling there last 3 years. I was upset double. Finally Japanese lady called me to apology but they lost loyal customer. They need to train their employees.

vKaT-0JyOxkBt8qJpcpLVQ.text: The girl wearing the cat ears working the cash register was very rude!! Service with a smile actually works!! If u hate ur job that much then find a new one!!

1CkgkTsEbHeKBF99EQx5Pg.text: Omg I miss living close to this place. Food never fails to impress. The atmosphere is very quaint and small neighborhood feel.

3zAoCN2nXGW1C_7Ix8GTXQ.text: I always come for the ramen to have flashbacks of Japan.  Great place!

ZXvaEbMRRgaaX-I2hxWr-g.text: I live right near here, and I've always been skeptical of it because of the shopping center it is in. Tonight I decided to give it a try and I was very impressed! The inside was much nicer than I had expected, with wooden tables and mellow lighting. I got the soba noodle soup with chicken; it was superb! The soba noodles there are made of 100% buckwheat. My friend got the vegetable and tofu ramen, which was equally delicious! The broth was light in color with a hint of spice.  Each dish that passed us on the way to their orderers turned our heads, and we found ourselves repeating "oh I want to try that next time I come!" Therefore, I can say with certainty that I will return!

D5W1ASl0Kkj-hqJWD_LCZw.text: This place gets packed -- And for good reason.   On my business trips to the Phoenix area, I always stop in here.   In fact, last week I went into Cherry Blossom two times:  once for dinner and then also lunch on a different day.    They have an extensive menu with rice, noodle, soup and sushi dishes.  Then there's a page for Japanese/Italian dishes.  I end up being a creature of habit here.. I always get a bowl of chashu ramen and an order of salmon sashimi.  If I'm extra hungry, I'll add an order of yellowtail sashimi too, then finish off with green tea ice cream.    This is a comforting cafe that has high quality, familiar Japanese cuisine with a little Italian fusion twist on some of their food.  The prices aren't super low, but I don't mind paying the premium.    I always try to get here before the meal rushes.  So I get in here for dinner at 6pm or earlier.  If it's lunch, I come in at 11:15 or 11:30.   If you don't plan accordingly... You'll be waiting in a freaking long line!

GYG8lbnhRFYP2fMEFsNyTA.text: I live 5 min away from restaurant , most of the time I order for take out. Noodles are excellent for sure , only complaint I have it's a slow service when we dine in. I mean slow service consistently, customers shouldn't have to wait 10 min just to place beverage order. By the time a server comes to the table we are always ready to place whole order.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZZk-XN8yUZ3wHtgQ8n87vw.text: I've been craving ramen and yelp had lead me to this place. I'm glad it did. I came here for lunch and had their ramen and California roll lunch special. The ramen soup was so flavorful and perfectly cooked! I'm still craving it right now. The California roll was fresh and a great portion as well. I can't wait to come back and try more things on their lunch menu but you better bet I'll be ordering that ramen lunch special sooner than later!

PBkp08z0EFglmP0HFvD8Mg.text: Everything was delicious! Started with fried tofu and gyoza, moved on to bento box, chicken pad Thai and Cajun shrimp with smoked mozzarella. Will be back many times!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bento Box
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VE3ft3lqHL80ZotPafVZuA.text: Best noodles in PHX! The spicy noodles are so spicy but sooo good! The place is always packed but they work fast and keep the place clean. They offer a variety of different options and dessert.

SSah4CbxIAkRgAj_g5oObA.text: Loved the happy hour and cute atmosphere here! Happy hour ends at 6 so be sure to come by. We got tofu steak, rainbow roll, salmon sashimi and crunchy roll for a total of $19! Definitely get the salmon sashimi. It was a great deal for only $6, generous servings and the salmon was buttery and delicious. The crunchy roll was only $3 and was great deal, it wasn't the best but it was great for the price and serving.   Service was great and they even let us bring in milk tea from Snoh next door. I would love to come back during happy hour and try the other deals. Even the regular menu seemed pretty cheap, ramen is only priced arond $6-7.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crunchy roll rainbow roll and salmon sashimi

_tSA_Dg1R5YrrgQ298X4tA.text: A family favorite (we've been returning for around 10 years now)! Typically, we order the cha-su ramen and the katsu-don bowl. I would recommend ordering the "more cha su" option for a more decent-sized portion of cha su. The katsu don is really amazing and is comparable to the same dish that we have previously tried in Japan!

fqVq3FmzOgG_q2qlftcDdQ.text: I've been going to Cherryblossom for almost 5 years now and I went from being a huge fan, to thinking that it was mediocre, to being a huge fan again. I am a regular here, and come in about 3-4 times a week. The food isn't the greatest, however for the price, it is totally, totally worth it. They have bento boxes for lunch that will cost you less than $12, and it has a ton of food in it. It usually comes with a roll, salad, miso soup and depending on the bento box for the day, NY steak and/or teriyaki chicken.   Their ramen is perhaps my favorite in Arizona, as they keep it pretty simple and traditional. I always get the hakata ramen (only $6.85) , or chashu ramen if I want more pork. Sushi isn't the freshest, but again, it's pretty cheap.  I love their cripsy calamari. The wasabi mayo sauce it comes with is so delicious. My boyfriend loves the spicy gyoza hotpot. I am not a huge fan of their soft shell crab - I felt like they put too much cajun spice in it. I've had the sukiyaki before which was pretty good, and the korean spicy beef is one of my faves.   Service is always good. This place is always so busy and so are the servers so service can be slow sometimes, but everyone here is a sweetheart.

B054V1cBUm5jZfYKx72vjg.text: We've been here a couple of times, and left happy each time.   We got the pot stickers to start out with. They were pretty good, especially with the dipping sauce (which is a vinegar based sauce). I usually like my pot stickers a little crispier, and these were just crispy on one side, but they were still good.  The first time we went, my boyfriend thought he was ordering the pork katsu curry, but actually ordered the plain pork katsu. Although disappointed, he still enjoyed it. He didn't realize they were two different things and made note of it. Next time, he ordered the pork katsu curry and really liked it.  I ordered the Korean spicy beef the first time I came. It was delicious! I had more than enough for leftovers, and when I brought it into work the next day my coworkers were jealous. The second time I got the yakisoba, which was good, but I don't think I would order it again, since it's a pretty simple dish and something that I could easily make at home.  Unfortunately, I no longer live in the central Phoenix area so we probably  won't be visiting very often, but hopefully we can make it back here again sometime.

0uHyER7dn7PVkEfxWZde9A.text: YUM, Yum, yummmmmm! WE  this place to no ends! This place is the reason I learned to share dessert with my bf LMAO. If you are ever so fortune to select a blueberry cheesecake for dessert you may end up having to share because they run out fast! We love that cheesecake so much that we order it for our bdays. The noodles and sushi never disappoint and the staff there are well trained and friendly.

xWj6y6fQ8uWQvo06HYKgIQ.text: Very cool and slightly confusing atmosphere here.  I say confusing, but in a good way.  The vibe of the place is very Asian, but the decor is totally like an Italian eatery, which I really enjoyed.  Regarding the food, we've good twice.  The first time I ordered the udon, which was awesome!  I've had a hard time finding good thick udon in AZ,...which I guess is understandable, but nevertheless still frustrating.  At any rate the udon here was very good and the meat was very tender and lean.  My only complaint is not much comes in the soup, so you have to add it on which cost extra.  Then the second time I had the chicken parm.  The sauce was very good and had great flavor.  It wasn't too sour like some red sauces and the chicken was moist and seasoned well.  However, I don't think I'd order it again simply because of the breading.  The texture of the breading was a little off for me and the crumbs were a little too fine.  However, for complete disclosure, I'm not Italian and I didn't grow up eating the food so maybe the texture was spot on; at least the rest of the meal was.   All-in-all I can't wait to go back and try some of their other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Parm.
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Udon

9CQN01ylm2d72z05ohUcYQ.text: Again this week the Jolly diners visited a wonderful Japanese restaurant. Unlike the others that we have visited, the cherry blossom Cafe also serves Italian food which is unique. For the appetizer, we had tofu salad, some fried tofu with glass noodles, and some baked eggplant. All of them were expertly prepared and delicious. For entrees, my sister and I had tofu steak, while my mother had tempura shrimp well my mother had tempura shrimp. Everything was delicious well served the staff couldn't have been nicer and we thoroughly enjoyed the meal. The Jolly diners unanimously rate the Cherry Blossom Cafe at a 5 out of 5 stars.

Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp tempura
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tofu salad

Ds7MDVC5W_plgM8OcElEUg.text: The last time I reviewed this Awesome place was 3 years ago. Every time the owner sees us we get a warm welcome. The last time I was there which was like 2-3 weeks ago I guess they had a vendor trying to sell them a new Sake, the owner when she noticed us, walked up to us on her way back to her meeting and welcomed us.  She then began telling us about the the product that they were interested in getting and gave a sample to my wife and I and asked for out option on it. Like I said it was awesome; and I hope they got the sake because it was great. I personally will always recommend the Cha-Shu ramen. It's delish ^_^.

8YOgBFtiJsn9_lH0cz_VIQ.text: Amazing ramen. I can't stress that enough. Great happy hour prices for Japanese fried foods, Italian pasta, and sushi. $6.50 for a portion of salmon. It doesn't get better I believe.

AbZA-YjmQPpZy2lk6kJDUw.text: I'm really disappointed at my experience here. I come here monthly because I enjoy the food here and I brought my family from out of town to try my favorite Japanese restaurant. The server didn't even tell us his name and it took a while for us to get a drink order in for waters. When the waiter took our order for alcohol, sake bombs, he said whatever was on there [on the menu] was what we were gonna get, as if he didn't know what beer/alcohol was on the menu (we just specified which beer we'd like to have with our sake because there were different ones listed). There was a lady that came over to our table and actually communicated with us about our entrees but she wasn't our waiter. This visit just left a sour taste in my mouth and I am embarrassed that I called this restaurant my favorite restaurant in Downtown Phx.

j1Sa-XRby0Kqq9ztYEXI7w.text: Don't waste your time. Cherry blossom is just hipster & trendy. People only go for the unique menu. They don't do anything well. Their food is average at best. Most of the food is a bad version of whatever it's supposed to be. If you never go you won't be missing out on anything.   There's always an unexplainably long wait. Service is usually bad. Too expensive for how bad the food is. Go somewhere else.

zD0PIVcHVqEkUKd5Ch2iMw.text: I used to come here more regularly. Food consistently great (up until last year.) Now just...occasionally good. Sadly, no longer worth the 20 minute drive.

W7MkbbFKVaAvePmPzVYi5w.text: My family and I have been going to this restaurant for years. We know the owners and servers now.  Their service is great, except you will be waiting in line to be seated during their busy nights. This place will be busy for dinner and for lunch even during weekdays.  So this is not a place to go if you're in a hurry, but it's worth the wait.  Their food is so good that this is my family and friends favorite hang out spot. We love everything from their Italian pasta (chicken Parmesan or Pescatore), ramen, katsu, summer rolls (gotta try this), spicy Korean beef noodles, and more. I like their tropical iced tea and my daughter loves their freshly baked bread rolls. It's really a gem and you will absolutely love almost all the dishes you try.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They serve handmade strawberry cake.
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pescatore is my absolute favorite Italian meal.

bmBBRuenxKn290YovHicaQ.text: The food here felt mediocre... I had high hopes for Cherryblossom but it didnt live up to the hype. They had a lot of different asian fare from korean spicy soup to Japanese ramen/ udon, gyoza and italian. When I made a special order with the udon the waitress didn't know that it was a common japanese dish to get katsu udon.   My husband's ramen was tiny! No wonder it was only 7.95 but had no normal ramen finishes like soft boiled egg, seaweed or  radish and broth was very bland. The food here was dissapointing and the waitresses kept making unnecessary comments that made us feel unwelcome. We probably wont come again especially since it's in downtown. Good thing is Snoh shavery has boba and desserts next door!

yn_8Zn6yEvmF-d2RxYL51g.text: First time there and our order was not placed. Luckily after 45 minutes of waiting for our food our server came over and admitted that she never put it in.   P. S. Their water tasted like fish.

1f3pPtPwGo_-c6pP-xcM5w.text: Fantastic experience! I came during the happy hour with 3 dollar gyoza , and 4 dollar sushi. I came hungry left and left full.  The quality of the food here surprised me most along with the fair pricing associated. The staff were super friendly.  I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and will definitely be frequenting here  as a new resident of Phoenix, Arizona.

mQTgqfPaQpsPkjaegR0W5Q.text: Food is good, or would be- if they didn't serve me severely undercooked chicken in my Tokyo Ramen. Would be open to trying it again in the future because I loved the ambiance, our server was kind, and the appetizer we ordered was very good. Just very wary now about the lack of attention paid to my food at a restaurant where attention to detail is very important to avoid contamination

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Unfortunately the chicken was so severely undercooked, but it&#39;s great looking.

nCJGzKS1X6AARXwnkyVYBg.text: My Japanese family has been coming here for years! Great Japanese food and service. We live about 45 minutes away and it is worth the drive every single time.

lWfwiJkfnfS4BSCY0FxR2A.text: Honestly, the service was poor. Long wait times, and half the time I was confused about what the hell was going on? Like am I supposed to pay now or are they coming to give us the check? The food quality was not super fresh, you don't leave in great spirits. Also adding an extra charge for something we were told would be included was not cool.

Xi30hgp3kfy9J7jVQ_VE2Q.text: Had the Spicy Korean Noodles and they are delicious. Every time I return to Cherryblossom I have tried different plates and they do not disappoint.
