wChlxkIuumG8svU7lh1xrg.text: I came here on Sunday for lunch with a craving for ramen. Cherry Blossom Noodle Cafe was bustling and fully packed with customers which was a good sign for the business.   I ordered the Char Su Ramen and thought it was a solid okay. The broth wasn't hot and the noodles tasted like it was pre-packaged. I may be somewhat a ramen snob because I had ramen in Japan, SF and NY so if you're a ramen connoisseur, I would recommend getting something different off the menu.

1KabGml1DXJfRrzI8m21pg.text: Eclectic, fusion, funky, ok but add delicious. Despite the specious history of Marco Polo bringing back noodles from China to Italy, there is no real reason to expect a kitchen to prosper handling both cuisines. These guys do it very well. Maybe the best potstickers we've had, and the hot pots are perfectly seasoned and textured. At One meal we ordered the entire appetizer menu. We were impressed with every dish. Check and see if they have their special raspberry tort on the dessert menu.

xshJfvG7-zPq903A9eGZ7Q.text: This is my 19yr old son's FAVORITE restaurant... It has enough variety to make everybody in your group happy.  We have taken Chinese, Japanese, and Korean international students here, all have been happy with the variety, authenticity, and taste of the food.     As for me... I am the penny pincher in the group, and over the years I have noticed changes in the restaurant, and the food provided... When we first started going there, they used to have after dinner mints.  There was a delicious variety of bread in a basket brought to the table, always enough food on the platter for a left over meal, and the price was reasonable.   The after dinner mints were stopped a few years ago. Recently, when we went to celebrate my son's birthday, we were told there would be a charge to eat his cake at the restaurant, so we ate it at home, in the past we have left pieces for the staff who wanted some.  The bread was simply rolls, and when we asked for a refill were told it would be a dollar "a roll", (forget that).  Everybody finished the meal on their plate, no left overs (wah) .  And worst of all, the receipt was in two pieces, that I was told had been added by hand .... My husband did not want to create an incident on my son's birthday, and would not allow me to question the addition, which did not appear correct to me...  They may have added the tip in to the total, but because I did not question it... we tipped from the total...  6 people, 2 appetizers, 2 drinks, 2 sodas, 6 entrees.   $110.

4bq3R1Qes6CZMHrFF5RJpw.text: This place is one of my favorite places to eat. Food is excellent and the people are so nice there. I go there at least twice monthly. Food is always good and the staff is always pleasant regardless of how busy they are, and they do get very busy.

oPdvA0EeZgPJ2Mav9sSJtQ.text: 3.5 stars, but I've rounded up.  I've been coming here for years...and I keep coming back.  Its known for the noodles and I'd recommend the ramen (nothing like the packaged stuff you get for 20 cents, and you'd stock up and eat three times a day as a starving student).  I also love the udon noodles.   If you're more of a rice person, the unagi (freshwater eel) rice box is my husband's favorite.  But a recent price jump in the price (it used to be 11, and now is 17) is making him change his mind about what to order.  The sushi is decent, but this is not a sushi house, so keep that in mind.  The complimentary bread is awesome (although they don't give banana bread anymore, and that really was my favorite).  Lastly, as others have said the service isn't the best.  It's a bit slow, and they're always very crowded.  But take your time and enjoy the company you're with and you'll be fine!

AfPhOkHD5PfFaarp8VWo2w.text: My favorite restaurant in Phoenix. The menu offers so many choices. For a tiny kitchen it is amazing the variety of dishes t b at come out. Service is great and the staff is consistent.

E4Wh_5f1d0XK_2PRpafABg.text: This place is amazing for so many reasons!!!!!!  Lets start with their customer service and attention to detail!  We had our to go order and our left overs and we are on the way out and our waitress checks our bag and says "hold on part of it is missing" WOW!  I gotta say that hasn't ever happened to me in any restaurant!  I would have been home and then realized I was missing something and then had to go back!  Also for all my veggie friends...this place has some amazing options for us.  I gotta say I haven't enjoyed a meal as much as this place in a VERY long time and their excellent customer service is the icing on the cake.  The best part however is hearing tourists say "HEY THAT WAS CONNIE CHUNG" I corrected them and said "Do you mean Lin Sue Cooney?" it was good for a laugh but you just never know who you will see here!  it is AMAZING!  GO!!!!

pkBwBueeVEtT0p824TEHow.text: Love there food! I've tried almost half of the menu and my favorite still is the beef curry udon. Service is a bit slow but worth the wait!!

7BMtPzs317SqAX6saBLGKw.text: By far the best Asian fusion I have ever had! Staff is incredibly friendly, welcoming, and polite. Over all other businesses in the Valley, I recommend this one. Go here! You will not be disappointed.

zIQ4HdOxVhM7Xe-P6QWmqA.text: We had dinner tonight and tried several dishes . Their menu is huge . We were seated promptly we ride their sushi . The rice was a little hard. We ordered tempura. The vegetables were cut too thin and ended up overcooked.  The pad that had no flavor and the meat was way overcooked.  The ya kissable noodles had too much meat was  overcooked. We were seated by the door and had to tolerate the heat coming in.

cdkOQ1h5YSFEbfSejfDGuw.text: Cherry Blossom is a great lunch place--fantastic ambiance, excellent food.  I adore the soups especially--flavorful, warm, and filling.  My favorite is the miso ramen, but I will also order the udon and soba noodle soups as well.  My partner had the lunch bento, but found it slightly spicy for her taste.  The service is okay--not the friendliest staff, but polite and efficient.  Still, if you're in the area for lunch, this little hideaway is like getting out of the city for an hour or so.  Very relaxing.

IVuwiBvfwX9Ly1qD-EbQ9A.text: Great place to eat, best Japanese food around great soups with noodles, very polite employees and superclean restaurant always busy

lIMx00xGxctLrpXC0zWZEg.text: This place is phenomenal and yes I wholeheartedly agree with other reviews that the best seats are at the bar...they are prime real estate as you get to see the beautiful dishes that come out of the kitchen. Get there early as we did (5 p.m) or risk waiting a long while. By 6 p.m, there was a line out the door!  The variety on the menu is downright staggering. There is everything from salads, sushi, noodle, rice, even Italian dishes.  My friend Michelle and I shared a total of three dishes and it was plenty of food. We ordered a ramen noodle dish with barbecue pork, a chicken katsu curry over rice, and a spicy Korean noodle dish. We had no room for dessert after these dishes!  I cannot fault this restaurant for anything. The flavors, colors and prices were outstanding. Despite the bustling kitchen and the somewhat hurried staff, everyone was so incredibly pleasant. and service was warm and efficient. Considering all the orders that the kitchen staff were mingling with, our food came out in literally no time at all.  Cherry Blossom noodle cafe is more what I call an Asian fusion restaurant. It is a little dive that looks like nothing from the outside. You just have to be courageous enough to open the front door and discover the fabulous flavors of Asia that await to conquer your palate. I definitely would not say that Cherry Blossom  is Japanese by denomination. By far, it is my favorite Asian restaurant in the valley due to its incredible variety and flavors.

dkZq-EQnZrZW4CbGK_xrHQ.text: Absolutely love this place! I've always had the best service, the most wonderful food, and wonderful companions while at this restraint!!

s5U1FJNquegloXaFTpMecg.text: Great food, not so great service. Hakata noodles are delicious. Small restaurant, but worth a try.

AFiR0MVAtqUF_fcv2ND2hA.text: Love the noodle there! So authentic and delicious! I usually order Dan Dan noodle and I love the minced pork and its spicy soup! Although the service is a little slow, but still, Highly recommend!

tiOQoC5X4xIUB7aaZKqSaA.text: The tantan men soup was spicy and delicious! My friend and I split the huge portion and an order of the Alaska rolls = also very good!

mzLgs-_RlIeqVK7kb57BCw.text: First of all, Everyone I have introduce this place (and this is quite a few people) continue coming back over and over again. Best place for happy hour sushi weekdays from 3-6pm. If you don't like sushi no worries this place has you covered. Italian pasta dishes available. Suggestion: Try the spicy Tan Tan Ramen or the Yakisoba Noodles. Dessert is a MUST here. All desserts are made daily at the restaurant. I always get the Flan its creamy and caramel delicious!

RJk1IU14P7kamfSvyUX_ZQ.text: My fiance and I love this place. The happy hour is great and ebi chili is great, and spicy! The ramen is great and we're obsessed with their weird cakes. The servers are super friendly and always helpful. Sushi is always tastey.

yKstt5G9uogonq1Obtkn3Q.text: One of my favorite restaurants. Yesterday was my first time eating authentic ramen and it was delicious! They also have wonderful sushi. I also tried their Chilled Spinach with Sesame Soy Sauce. Loved it.

oTF8ToUNn_qGEZFt5mSlrg.text: Delicious. If you have never tried ramen this is a great place to try it out! This cafe offers a variety of ramens and Japanese food! I recommend the spicy gyoza in soup & the hakata ramen! The waiters are all very polite & genuinely sweet. I will be coming back to eat here!

2j4qOCOVVBh1SiCJwpocbA.text: My favorite place to get Japanese ramen. Their broth is amazing! Very authentic!

O3IjA2Myvgh0c27bf77OvQ.text: I've been here a few times now and am thoroughly please with the food, service, ambiance, and well...just about everything.  I'm a vegetarian and have tons of options, beyond just removing meat from the dish.  They also have a decent number of Sake based adult beverages, also worth trying.  Will definitely be back!

WDiDKdMAtWy-Li9i7W732A.text: I had a craving for ramen and decided to try CherryBlossom since I had heard so many great things about it. Unfortunately, I was pretty disappointed.  I called to order the Cha-Shu for take out. The lady said it would be 15-20 minutes, so I got there about 25 minutes later. I still ended up waiting for another 10 minutes. Waiting wouldn't have been so terrible if there was actually a place to wait. The entry area has two chairs, and a hutch in the way. So not only is there nowhere to sit, there is really nowhere to stand. It didn't help that there were 3 other parties waiting to be sat, along with a steady stream of people coming in to add their name on the wait. I ended up being awkwardly in the way of everyone the whole time, even though I tried to stay out of the way.  I finally got my ramen and headed home. I was willing to forgive all if the ramen was good but it was pretty bland. I ended up adding a bunch of Sriracha to it so that it would have some flavor.  The rest of the menu sounds good, and I would be willing to give a second chance, but i certainly won't be rushing back anytime soon.

vFr1UQW_dsmBD12fL23oaw.text: I've been coming to Cherry Blossom since they were the little bakery attached to Tokyo Express - before the Noodle Cafe idea was launched. I've sampled a good deal of the menu, and most of it is quite good. Most recently, we were a party of six for a luncheon of Yelp friends and to celebrate a birthday. I ordered the special lunch box (bento box) and think it was the best choice of the day! (But everyone I was with thinks they got the best item of the day - always a great sign!) Miso soup, 4 or 5 tempura items, half a spicy tuna roll, salad, and the entree of the day - in this case, very well seasoned beef and onions on rice.  Everything is consistently fresh and flavorful, and prices are fair.  Since I was aware of the "bakery" aspect of the cafe, I went in a few days before the lunch to order a surprise birthday cake. I was told the strawberry shortcake was the most popular, so I went with that. Everyone at the table loved it - and the birthday girl was sufficiently surprised and got to bring half of it home. The cake wasn't cheap - but while I didn't check the dessert prices for individual slices - I am guessing it would have been close to the same to order six separate desserts. So - if you have a decent size group - it's well worth it to buy the cake in advance!

a6k-7oL8KoAQbn7MEjY-rw.text: Very delicious place to eat. But did hate that we had to wait forever to be seated while people behind us got seated before us. Then server that we had she was amazing. Food very delious I loved the sushi!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best dish ever.
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing squid.

0KVQ0RWyDYe-7dU_wjd0aQ.text: Cherrblossom is one of my favorite places to eat in the Phoenix area. I'm by no means a Hipster or a Millennial so I'm not looking for frills or any pretentious modern amenities. I'm not looking for odd molecular gastronomy or quirky dishes. That being said, what I am looking for is good food, at a good price. That is what Cherryblossom delivers.  I've had almost everything off the menu since I've moved to AZ, but my favorite has to be the Marsala Chicken. Yes, my favorite is an Italian dish. Here's the kicker though, it's homemade spinach pasta with a Marsala cream sauce, mushrooms, spinach and chicken. The kicker being the pasta if that went over your head. I've had it to go, to eat in, and even after already eating another meal. The service is attentive, a little curt but that's expected with the culture of it and it's all perfectly fine with me. Pricing is affordable, I don't drink alcohol so I cant say anything on that pricing. Food wise its very affordable.  Definitely a must visit if you're looking for good food at a good price, and aren't looking for a hip youngster environment, sorry hipsters and millennials this aint your jam.

8IIr3ZexzR0EW0-f5TLeqA.text: Great Steamed Shrimp Dumplings!!! Great Service  When I arrived I was immediately seated. Kenny, my server, took care of me right away and was helpful and attentive throughout my meal, making sure of the quality of what I was served.  I LOVED the Shrimp Shumai (steamed shrimp dumplings). They were light and flavorful and served on top of a swirl of spicy Chinese mustard.    I wasn't so crazy about the texture of the Ramen noodles (seemed more like rice noodles), but that aside, my Cha-shu (Hakata with extra pork) was very tasty, and a generous portion.   I ordered the Korean Spicy Beef to go and it was delicious warmed for dinner later in the evening. It was mildly spicy and nicely seasoned.   Overall, I had a great experience. I'll be going back again, but skipping the ramen noodles next time. The prices seemed reasonable for the quality and quantity of the food.

qvFhitf6dd6WQ_uqN_d_Hw.text: Ok, for starters, I never write reviews. This was my first time at Cherry Blossom Noodle Cafe, and I was very excited about it. But the service was horrible. Our table didn't have any utensils: no napkins, appetizer plates, etc. We had to ask for utensils because the server was completely oblivious of the fact. Then she walked away when one of us was still trying to order. We were offered refills ONCE, way after we had finished our food. Then when we paid, our checks were switched and had to have them redone because some of us were being charged more than usual. Overall the food was delicious (I got the Hatakana Ramen) but in terms of service the place is not very good.

9Uz621S4yjbBb0Tq2iVP4g.text: I have heard of this place numerous times, and ive been recommended to come here by many of my foodie friends so today i decided to finally make a visit. This may be the first 1 star review i'm doing too. Okay, so i came here with a company and we each ordered a ramen, that is, Cha-shu ramen and tam tam ramen. We each got an appetizer too, gyoza and vegetable tempura. Gyoza was okay, and so was vegetable tempura. The sauces were too watery but i didn't care much because we were waiting for the ramen. Our ramen comes out looking all delicious but the taste was nothing extraordinary. It was no more than just okay. The tam tam ramen broth just tasted like tabasco sauce, and overall it was too sour more than spicy so i couldnt finish it. I liked how it was nicely decorated inside and it surely is a nice restaurant but i think i was expecting too much out of it. In the beginning of the meal our waiter brought a tuna sashimi to our table, which we didn't order, so we didnt touch it but he had informed us he has another dish for us on its way so i thought they had a lunch special or something going on, and because neither of us eat raw fish we just let it sit on our table until we asked for our bill. I was still curious so i took half a bite of it and i was shocked how smelly the fish was, and that was one reason that made me decide to leave a one star review. Never have i ever had fish smell that bad in my life. Although i don't eat raw fish, i know how it's supposed to taste and smell like, but theirs was very very old. If i didn't think that was a free dish, i would have called someone to complain about it. It was THAT BAD. Before our waiter brings our check, he seemed to have realized he brought it to the wrong table and he takes it back to the kitchen without saying a word to us or asking questions, and a couple minutes after he took it to the table behind ours. I don't know if they made new ones or it was the same plate, but i would like to hear what the person who ordered it has got to say about the fish. Mediocre food and very bad raw fish. My favorite about this restaurant was my diet pepsi. I am glad i got a soft drink because after i tasted the fish i felt the necessity to wash my mouth.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The pork pieces are good
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chashu ramen
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuna sashimi. Very bad smell.

-9E7c5Zhb-yqNdsr1uXRwQ.text: We had the Tokyo Ramen.  Noodles, broth & chicken were bland.  I imagine cardboard has a similar taste.  Service was beyond slow. Skip this place and go to Noodle Bar on Adams downtown; far superior on every level

rFvJACoydAUwI--LlSTc5A.text: 03/14/17 Yelp review Cherry Blossom Phoenix Arizona 914 E Camelback road 85014   Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe is a small restaurant located in central downtown Phoenix and contains not only high quality Japanese food, but affordable food. When finding a restaurant that has authentic food with appropriate pricing its downfall usually is it's interior. This may entail crumbling walls, dingy furniture, unwashed dining utensils, greasy tables and more. In Cherry Blossom this was most certainly not the case.  My experience at Cherryblossom was one I find rare these days. The lighting inside was very dim, which allows for a more intimate meal. Although the seating could have been more spacious, there is a comfortable amount of room for conversation when dining with friends or family. The decor throughout the store consisted of Japanese posters and an abundant amount of Japanese delicacies. I found this to be very enlightening as I not only look for restaurants that contain good food, but an eye-opening experience into other cultures. The outside of this restaurant does not do justice into conveying this restaurants "True colors". The saying, don't judge a book by its cover, is one customers have to keep in mind when attending.  When I arrived I was greeted by a very attentive and kind waitress. She notified me that at the time of my arrival was Happy Hour. I felt the Happy Hour menu was quite bland so to those looking for dirt-cheap sushi you are not going to get much out of that menu.  In the end I ordered the standard Rainbow Roll and Caterpillar Roll. The main components of the Rainbow Roll consisted of  sashimi, crab and avocado. This roll was deliciously moist, due to the avocado and tasted fresh. I can say the same for the Caterpillar Roll. It consisted of avocado, cucumber and eel. The eel gave for a juicy flavor and the avocado on the outside paved way for a soft texture that I highly enjoyed.   When the check arrived to my table it totaled out to be $13.00. The Rainbow Roll and Caterpillar Roll's were both $6.50 each. I would have to say these prices are pretty decent given these rolls are not only very prevalent in Japanese restaurants in Arizona, but classic. I truly believe those looking for some delicious sushi, but don't have a lot in their wallet should try out this restaurant. Like I said before, the only downside was the Happy Hour menu. It did not consist of a variety of foods. It seemed it only had appetizers and not very many entrees. If you are not interested in sushi, but want to go for another Japanese dish I would suggest that you try their Ramen. Its important I stress this restaurant is not a designated sushi restaurant. In fact, I heard about this place from a close Japanese friend of mine who, and like many others, raved about their Ramen. With that said, there is an eclectic amount of food for everyone. Cherryblossom offers something for everyone.  In conclusion I rate this restaurant four out of five stars. In my experience I was greeted by a nice and attentive waitress. The food was well priced and tasted deliciously fresh. Its atmosphere felt authentic to Japanese culture, which made the overall experience eye-opening. I dropped one star for the restaurant's Happy Hour menu, but don't let this differ you form ever coming. It was great!

IeU1BHMINu-_ROFlsAkb-A.text: If you like noodles, don't walk- run to cherry blossom. We've tried all their Asian noodles, and there's nothing not to like. No idea what the Italian ones are like, but I'll update this when I know. The atmosphere is very cozy- they really made the best of the space which I think was a fast food joint originally. Make time for the happy hour on weekdays for great deals. (Fun fact- they've won three Best of Phoenix awards)

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Whitefish bento box special: tempura and pickled vegetables, side salad, rice, and of course the fish. All very tasty!

-LWoeQ1D2EW8lZh270D-Zw.text: First time here with a friend and I have to say not bad. Went during the day around 2pm which was perfect. Not too busy or slow either. The ambience was lovely, clean place, and the waiter was nice(got our order out on time and checked up on us to make sure we were doing okay)  Tried the gyoza as an appetizer and it was absolutely delicious! Will definitely get this again next time :) For the entree I got the tan tan men ramen and my friend got the hakata ramen (she said it was very tasty!). Warning * do not eat this if you have a cut on your mouth or chapped lips! Lol It was very spicy especially if you are not used to it, but it had a good flavor to it. Maybe less pepper flakes next time? The noodles were cooked well and overall flavorful.  I was very pleased with the visit, we did have to wait a bit to get seated despite it being slow but nothing else too concerning. I will be returning :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The spicy tan tan men ramen and the hakata ramen in the back :) Warning with the tan tan, not for beginners hahaha

bIb5-KcZJHm_UvdltDL0ig.text: Japanese-Italian fusion? Weird! But then we saw that the menu is separated with Italian and Japanese dishes, not mixed together in one dish. I had the Japanese beef udon soup and it was incredible!! The broth was perfect.

d6KBXih9OYTDhz6207TkEg.text: Italian-esque vibe, mainly Japanese dishes, though. It's a funny place, in that half the menu includes Italian dishes. But I'm seriously curious about how often that side gets ordered; seemed like the majority of customers were ordering the Japanese side of the menu. Good edamame and nicely flavored pork belly "bites", ill call them. I ordered an udon noodle ramen soup for my entree and it was delicious. I was also amazed by how much meat there was in the soup. Typically, ramen jips you of an actual amount of meat--not this place! Yum!

XUH-XyGpOU47hgN-z8D9tA.text: Cute place. Nice selections of food. Quick service.  Food tastes good.  We had the pork katsu curry I wish they gave more curry sause becuz the rice portion was a lot. We also had the hataka ramen, it was really really good. One of the best ramen bowl I had in Phoenix.  We also had the double crunch shrimp tempura....I LOVED IT!!!!

MY2BXbHwh5TXsRox9GBbBw.text: OMG this place is delicious !!!! The tan tan ramen was very good and very spicy we also had the spicy beef noodles and the potstickers. Everything was amazing. Even our picky 4 year old was able to eat and she enjoyed her food as well. You may have to wait on a Friday night but well worth it.

1Sew-9aQBXKGwvFEfJLMcg.text: Used to be a good place before. This time around, Yakisoba was super oily and bland. Although, Agedashi tofu was very good. We went on a Friday evening and the place did look quite busy - however, this cannot be an excuse for bad service. When a customer asks for the dessert menu and you say "see the showcase and tell me", you don't deserve a single penny of tip. It took them over 20 minutes to do the math on our bill and get it across to our table! I'm never going back there again :/

KPF0aHpHPREZhSu38JfP4A.text: For my first visit I got the chun shu ramen it was delicious !! It tastes similar to a tonkatsu ramen but you can taste that chun shu is made there and not from a package.

E2BFbpKGRGL53GDd2BK0Mg.text: I live in Tucson and whenever I come into town, I try to have a meal at Cherry Blossom.  It is one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix and I am proud to say that I have been a semi-occasional diner for years.  Everything that I've had there has been tasty.  While they serve Italian and Japanese food, I've only ever eaten off the Japanese menu.  On my latest lunch visit, my sister and I tried a variety of dishes.  For appetizers we had the summer rolls and california rolls.  Both were really tasty, especially the summer rolls.  For the main course, I ordered the daily bento (I'm a sucker for a bento box) and my sister ordered the calamari salad (one of my favorite dishes here).  The food was excellent and we both left the restaurant completely stuffed.  My one criticism is that over the years, I have noticed a slight decline in customer service.  I remember they used to include a slice of banana bread in the bread basket, but now they charge for it.  Also, our lunch waiter was not very attentive.  We had to ask twice for certain items (i.e. chopsticks and spoons) and it took forever to get our check.  As much as I love cherry blossom, I had to dock it a star for that reason.  But I shall continue to frequent this restaurant for all of my Japanese food cravings.

SeoAi3x6IXIo4IKQmK10Cw.text: We had a ramen noodle dish with BBQ pork. It was so tasty!! The noodles were cooked perfectly and  the broth was very flavorful. This soup had shaved mushrooms and sliced green onions. I thought the portion size was large and the price was very good for the amount of food we received. We didn't wait at all and our waiter greeted us within 5min after we sat down. Overall we had an awesome experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ramen noodle soup with shaved mushrooms, green onions and BBQ pork...yum!

mfbvixyk0cE255mNCJHuaA.text: This place is busy on the weekends. Expect a 30 minute wait. I didn't mind, but some other patrons seemed to.   Cherryblossom is very cozy, and the waiter who served us was very nice. He updated us on our orders. Service was a little on the slow side, but given the wait to get a table, I wasn't surprised.  The chicken yakisoba noodles were great, not too much sauce and plenty of chicken; the philly roll was all right--tastes just like any other. My boyfriend was disappointed that the tempura roll was rolled into tempura flakes instead of flash fried. But overall, I enjoyed the food and would like to come back.

xAfZHfBsfSI9A0mfSxDK6w.text: Really big bowls of soup and pork belly that is top notch. You will not be disappointed with the food and the setting and beauty of the place is apt. I give it a point off for not being very authentic though. I think there are other spots in Arizona where you can get equally as good if not better ramen but with cooks that aren't Mexican and with menus that don't serve frivolous stuff like chicken parmesan.

Jty_Kn4JHk00SQ4wrh-wPw.text: If it's a GREAT bowl of traditional Japanese noodle soup you're in search of, this is it.   I'm sold solely on their noodle soup bowls that I haven't tried any of their other entrees. The bowls are big, you get a good amount for your buck in my opinion.   The TanTan Men is good if you're looking for a spicy soup. The Miso is great if you're feeling a seafood soup. The Hakata soup; you will not go wrong ordering this bowl. The noodles, the broth. So good. The Cha-shu; is the Hakata but with MORE delicious pork included, you can't go wrong. And even if you don't normally eat a lot you'll have a hard time not wanting to eat the entire bowl. At least that's what I've experienced.   Because the place is popular and the space is small, you may have to wait awhile for service and to put in your order, but once you receive your delicious bowl of goodness you will quickly forget!

bENhJLfSCCvu91MMGkXz_w.text: Think this place has an identity problem. Japanese and Italian? Hmmmmm....  Food: I had the japanese side of the menu. The special roll and stir fry beef noodles. The roll was under whelming and the noodles were extra greasy.   Service: Place was packed and service was extra slow.  Price: Overpriced.  Restaurant decor: French bistro.  Now do u inderstand my confusion to this fusion? I probably wont b back. Surprised with all the yelp reviews...disappointed.

PG1RkwVxe6HKkfSTgyYKjw.text: I went to this little gem for sushi. It was so delicious. I moved from SD to AZ and have been looking for a GOOD sushi place in the desert. I thought I was out of luck until I found this place. Happy hour has great prices. The ambience is so cute! I will definitely be back again! It is well worth my 30 minute drive there.

3WrBjJ4snp4hmQA0NzTEzg.text: My family and I came here for the first time to each lunch after church. I have to tell you, this is a great place to eat Italian food and Asian food at the same time.  LOL! And to have snoh right next door for dessert was perfect!    I ordered a dish called the Primavera w/ eggplant, chicken and red sauce.  You could either have Soba noodles or Tofu noodles.  I ordered the Soba noodles which was very interesting.  It is healthy and very tasteful.  The prices are inexpensive and within my strict budget.  I would recommend this place to everyone.  Its small but quaint.  We had nine people in our party and we just waited for about 15 min. Fortunately enough we were seated quickly.    I have been in AZ for 5 years, and I cannot find any Asian food that compares to the restaurants in San Jose California where I am from, and this was one of the best places I have gone to.  So I just want to give 5 stars for this place.

43QVnrMqowzooDH4CzJ4Lw.text: I came here during happy hour with a small group of friends the other day and definitely enjoyed the food but the service was...weird. First off they don't have sake bombs which sucks but they do have sake and japanese beer so it kind of threw me off but no big deal. Our  food all came out and was all enjoyable but when my friends asked for a hot sauce or chili pepper flakes it got ignored the first request. On the second request our server made a quick back handed comment on how they were going to ruin the broth before scurrying away again.  Again food was good but service was just stuck out as a sore thumb.

THUwYox3h_Ya9aUkpfyBYQ.text: This place is friggin awesome. Order only took a few minutes. It was everything that we expected and then some. Prices are very good. Very easy to find and I would definitely come back.

juSlgnh4sagDaTq3na5mog.text: Excellent. Ordered the Korean spicy beef dish. It was great. Worth the drive. I will definitely go there again, for sure.

b3HpSWlt6DPwerVQD32rbQ.text: Best ramen place in the valley. Try their hakata ramen. The broth is very soothing and so good. If you like it spicy then definitely try tan tan men. I wish they had more places like this in Phoenix area.

i-HytQ2zsXdm9krJumbBJQ.text: Ramen is a noodle dish near and dear to my heart. There are few noodle dishes out there that can satisfy the palate as well as a solid bowl of ramen. The key to good ramen is the excelling of three primary ingredients: the noodles, the broth, and the protein.   The noodles here are very well made with good consistency, texture, and fantastic compatibility with the broth. The broth itself has that signature creaminess, saltiness, and thickened smoothness that ramen broth should have. It gives the noodles a fine delicious dressing.  Alas, the cha-shu pork is where the dish fails to amaze. While the BBQ flavor of the pork is adequate, CherryBlossom chooses to go the lean route in the preparation. The result is a piece of pork that is thick and devoid of fat. This flaw is a fatal one. Ramen noodles were designed in such a way that its fullest potential can only be achieved with fatty pieces of meat. In a True ramen dish, one seeks out the fatty piece of meat and treasures every bite as it enhances the richness of the broth and is counterbalanced by the starchiness of the noodles. CherryBlossom foregoes this authentic vision and opts for a healthier alternative. While it still delivers on most fronts, my inner samurai still desires that extra reach of flavor.  Other reviews on Yelp also recommend their banana bread. However, I must condemn their banana bread and anybody else on Yelp who sponsors it. Their banana bread is incredibly dry and has a grainy texture quality to it. The flavor itself is very bland and the banana element is barely detectable. A shame.  However, the dinner rolls that do come with your meal are quite good! They have a softness and fluffiness about them that nearly rivals Hawaiian rolls. Freshly baked and packed with flavor. An unexpected surprise!  At the end of the day, the entire experience was pretty good but far from great. CherryBlossom offers an eclectic mix of different cuisines and dishes. Though the ramen could not satiate, I am willing to return to test the other dishes. To be continued...

-SLBBnbkSNBDcPPEM-0Pqg.text: We've driven by this place countless times. It wasn't until a coworker told me about it that I noticed it. Like a lot of restaurants in Phoenix, CB is in a strip mall which I'm starting to get used to.   Went at lunchtime, it wasn't crowded initially, but filled up quickly. Started out with the vegetable tempura. It was okay, just a basic tempura. I ordered the grilled salmon lunch special which came with brown rice and salad. I wasn't crazy about the salad dressing, but the salmon was awesome. Two substantial, well seasoned fillets. With a lunch special you expect the smallest fillet with a ton of rice, not at CB.    My hubby ordered the sausage in red sauce as an appetizer and the hot beef salad. I don't eat meat so I didn't his food (bummer), but he seemed very pleased,   I look forward to returning and trying some Italian dishes. Also, CB is extremely clean and the staff is attentive.

D5ecIgLiXf5bAWxRSCQPXg.text: I have been to the Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe twice. Both times I left not very satisfied with my entire meal. I do have to say the desserts are homemade and good. Otherwise, the food is okay and the service is a little on the slow side. I've had the katsu-don, ramen noodles, and curry. The dishes just fell short of flavor and were bland for me. I also felt the dishes were a bit overpriced.   Overall, I would not put this on my top list of restaurants.

SZEH52tBYbmyUmjoMkCJ8Q.text: Our first time here and we left full, satisfied and happy. It's very reasonably priced and the portions are just right. We loved the variety of the menu. There will be something for each person in your party. Japanese and Italian dishes together on the menu...how clever. A basket of rolls and butter arrives with my order of ramen and edamame...too cool

3-9LxfiALzsrxzczpelA7A.text: Went here with my family over the weekend. Our server was a very sweet lady that provided us great service. She was attentive to what we wanted and commended us for being on time to our reservation. We each ordered different dishes and everyone seemed to really enjoy what they had ordered. The food came out fast which is a huge plus. I ordered the chicken katsu curry and it was very tasty. I liked the radish that came with the dish but it was still missing a bit of a lemon zest taste. I think it would have been better with a side of Kimchi or something similar to it. Last we ordered a green tea mousse cake with red bean filling. Hands down the best green tea cake I've ever had. The atmosphere, the service, the food and the price is all great. I highly recommend this place. Definitely will be back again!

3aNlQIrHcNFymtUQRUP6yA.text: LOVE THIS RESTAURANT!! They have an assortment of items on the menu from sushi to desserts!! Nice indoor decor and the staff is very nice!

Ef7JjYUqjIN7-r6IXhzQ2Q.text: So this place just weirds me out too much. Ramen for dinner and an italian pastry from their dessert window? Makes me think that they were not sure what kind of restaurant to open. In other words, they didn't know which would be better, so they just serve both. If their Asian food was really that amazing, wouldn't they just eschew serving the Italian in the same place, and focus on Asian? Or vice-versa?   So, while their noodles were good, they were missing all the other things that I like about Asian spots...namely, the hot sauces, diced chili in vinegar, asian drinks, maybe some coconut drink/dessert, and other non-noodle things that make an asian noodle place amazing. This is a place for old Phoenicians that think they are going outside of their comfort zone. For them, they are, and it is great. They experiment while they have their trusted spaghetti to fall back on. For a well seasoned Asian food eater like myself, this place fails.

XkrSodQgZhJAQvw2GJ_LDA.text: I like coming to CherryBlossom for the tan tan man Ramon.  It is a great price and I love the favor of it too.  Every time I come the service is great and they are alway really busy.  The restaurant is not all that big,  so when you get there you will probably have to wait 10 to 15 minutes.  I guess in a way this is one of my favorite places to come for Ramon.  It is in a small shopping center off of camelback and 9th street.

jPsKwUpakD3o0Y3cvRxBwA.text: Slow service, very very rude hostess and EXTREMELY inattentive staff  We have been here three times. Ow and keep giving them a chance. It's the same girl who is very rude and the servers are very slow and not knowledgeable about food or menu. Would give them no stars if I could

aCYsZzVmiAQb4VpN2K9pHw.text: Loved the atmosphere, good for a date night. Service and food was great. My Bf has the Hot Thai Beef Salad (no pic) it was super delicious! I had mixed tempura dinner, it was great the fish was really tasty! Will definitely go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

x6yzgoI_EOBj2MlXXxfasA.text: The atmosphere is very cozy and inviting.  The food is amazing to say the least. It is definitely a place to try new dishes, you won't be disappointed,

-Asz8C2N0uIaEBwranvF5g.text: This place is so cute and super delicious! Great portion sizes! Had to take some home it was so much ! Their spicy sauce that they have so yummy too, it goes great with the ramen.

s48dH5li9cfkw144PjyE6Q.text: My first experience trying Ramen and I'm definitely hooked after going to this restaurant!  The waitress was super helpful when she knew that I had never tried Ramen before and I went with her suggestion and loved every bite of it!

fFTAh6NXajwCxKbYsyfTJw.text: Always a pleasure coming here. We've had everything from their ramen, sushi, Italian food..it's all amazing. Service is always great food is always fresh and excellent.

WUtAZLaK_i1xJRphxXb_zA.text: BEWARE OF ORDERING TO GO  I was super excited to try this place after my mom told me about it since we often go to Tokyo Express next door. So we decided to order 2 Hakata Ramen bowls to go after seeing delicious pictures of them on here. First the price online was roughly $6 so I expected the bill to be about $15, but it was $18 for 2 ramen bowls which I don't mind because I just assumed the price increased. After running a couple more errands we returned home excited to eat the ramen and opened the box to see just noddles and just soup. I was extremely disappointed especially after seeing their beautiful presentation online. The soup only have one whole piece of pork with a couple strands extra. The egg is my favorite part and I saw no egg however I don't know if that's just because it's and extra add-on. However overall the soup base was alright, but really without the extra flavors that were supposed to be included it just tasted like instant cup ramen I can buy at the grocery store. Maybe it was just a mistake that they didn't include everything, but in my opinion, it would've been nice to be informed if it would cost extra to include other sides. I wouldn't mind trying this restaurant again however I most likely will not be ordering take out.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hakata Ramen

8pF2whKtSG-eCS5Cx-Ac9Q.text: I've been a regular here for over 6 years and it's about time I write a review about this place. I graduated Uni recently & even had my grad dinner here with family!   QUALITY- I have tried many different plates, gone during dinner and lunch time and I can confidently say that the food has ALWAYS tasted the same for me. It has never been a disappointment, food wise, and that is my go to place for the ika yakisoba, katsudon, peach sake drinks & other delicacies. Food has always tasted and looked 10/10 for me.   SERVICE- the is what has always fluctuated for me. There are some people here that have worked for a while, even years, & they have given me exceptional service. Now the last time I went I had an unpleasant experience with our server, but I'm just going to assume she was new & with time she could better & learn not to rush people (especially when they aren't busy). Service is 8/10.   PRICE- I personally feel like the prices are priced fairly. The food was cheaper before the minimum wage went up in AZ so it's understandable that certain plates have gone up $1-2. Price has been 10/10 for me.   OVERALL- I have and will always support this local restaurant. If you are from out of state, I would HIGHLY recommend this restaurant.

rLERR66DBUnUIZq0r5Cw2w.text: While craving a simple bowl of ramen I ended up here. Not in my regular neck of the woods but nearby. So let's start with the bad. The wait was at least ten minutes to sit. Twenty minutes to order. Fifty minutes for the food to get there. One second for me to want to send it back. I'm not sure about the Italian food but the Japanese Ramen taste like a maruchan package was placed in front of me. Never again. Save yourself the heartache.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef nanban

GvEV6ShypNJGg1-k4aJWWg.text: I am not sure why but my friends had a bad experience here. I however did not. My friends said the ramen that they ordered when they came here was very plain and the broth had no flavor, my experience was the opposite. I really like their ramen and I would definitely come back here again. I got the Cha-su, which was the hakata with more meat. The broth was such a meaty flavor and very satisfying. The texture of the meat was really good. I also like how they give you a good amount of meat. The gyoza and sushi was good as well. I like how they have a variety of options to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-I-O7su5bHF6k9ZZUApCAg.text: small and cute place! We went to this place on a sunday around 1PM and it had 10 mins wait time. We ordered vegetable sushi, Tan Tan-men(ramen with grilled chicken), korean spicy chicken and green tea cake. Complimentary salad was good. Vegetable sushi and korean spicy chicken were okay. We did not like the ramen(Supposed to be Sichuan spicy) as broth was just mild and grilled chicken has no spice in it. We loved the green tea cake..  matcha outer layer with red bean filling(I guess).. it just melts in your mouth and not too sweet! We would go again but just for desserts.

Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

FNW4F5akaHgiIJQ1teOoEg.text: We have frequented this place for ramen and they are typically good however after bringing a take out order issue to the owners attention (their $35 mistake of which we called immediately and notified) we will never return. We literally felt as if we were being interrogated instead of receiving a simply apology. Now we understand why most of her staff looks terrified at work, I think its a toxic work environment.  We will not support a restaurant where good patrons are treated so poorly in a community that supports local, It's very sad but we will not be back, customer service is paramount in a small business and she has none.

QjrPYzZ7Sa5SoYUvu1_xmA.text: Came here twice and both times was pretty disappointed especially because the reviews were really good.   The first time I ate here, I ordered the tan tan ramen. Unfortunately I felt that the broth wasn't very flavorful at all. Also, There was barely any minced pork which I assumed was the main point of the dish. The dish itself was supposed to be spicy and it honestly wasn't.   The second time, I ordered the yaki soba with chicken. I also ordered the rice dish that has the shrimp tempura (can't remember the name of it). The yaki soba noodles seemed different to me, in fact they honestly looked like spaghetti noodles. The flavor was also pretty bland and I was really expecting it to be super flavorful based on all the pictures. The rice bowl was extremely basic with 4 shrimp tempuras on a bed of brown rice. The shrimp tempura was pretty soggy as well.   I typically try and eat at restaurants twice before I give a review. Would I give this place another try? Sure, but I'll try other places around the area first. The service isn't too bad and the employees are nice.

mxOPIR_DRgohcJO5amJlhA.text: Lots of choices for ramen and appetizers. Good vegetarian options. Huge portions. Restaurant is clean and cozy.

_cTvgSHjlapN_Sezz6ZQUQ.text: I've been craving Ramen for months now, and every time my friends and I decided on a place, it was either closed or we would ended up getting something else....But not tonight!! We decided to visit Cherry Blossom and we would not leave at all till we get our fix, not even the 35 minute wait till we got seated scared us off.  Once we were seated and our drinks were ordered it took another 35 minutes for the food to come out.  They were quite busy for a Sunday night.  The food was overall good, we ordered our Ramen and udon soups...the Ramen was average in my opinion, we also ordered a spicy beef noodle dish and some gyozas which was simply delicious, some eggplant with bell peppers dish...the bell peppers were quite good and lastly two orders of mabo sara udon, which wasn't bad at all.  The waiter and waitresses were super friendly and attentive, but the speed of the place is too slow, I almost starved to death this night.  The loo definitely needs a make over, looks like it seen way too many winters.  Overall a decent place the experience was decent, the food was okay as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. More noodles
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eww! The bell peppers weren&#39;t bad.

r_fZOHaDMKJVTsGw-Gtf3w.text: Their smoked salmon ramen is amazingly delicious, It's definitely a must have. Service is great, we didnt have to wait long for a table. Everyone was very friendly.

eTLXHIBG5WoL446gplQNgg.text: My favorite place to eat, I am not as sophisticated as other yelper's so I won't try to impress you with my refined palate - as I have none.  My favorite is the happy hour, a generous and still reasonably priced menu from 3-6pm of Sushi, Calamari, and other dishes/alcoholic beverages.  It's somewhat peculiar to have Asian/Italian influenced meals, but they are well done and fairly fast in turn around.  Don't expect much leniency when it comes to showing up towards the end of happy hour - if you don't have a table before 6, you're out of luck.  I am glad I don't live close - I would eat here daily the food is that good.  Caution should be used driving here; especially during rush-hour.  Parking is cramped, one should not plan to park on the street as there is limited parking and no-parking signs.

68-0P2VMb28dM0uNgOB7zg.text: I like the udon miso noodle bowl! It's what I usually order. The menu is large and has good vegetarian options!

FigyyA69fwglQIovEQnnug.text: Delicious, delicious food here. Last time I visited was on a busy Sunday evening and one of our main dishes got lost which is why I'm giving 4 stars.  But otherwise, everything was absolutely on point. Our table shared the Extremely Spicy Gyoza Pot, Miso Eggplant (i don't even like eggplant, and this was delicious), a Garden Salad that was massive, Katsudon, Yakiniku and a Spaghetti Bolognese. Everything was incredible.
