Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

sIrotTuetyRKvlj9eKDo6g.text: This place was really good! I ordered the ramen and it was amazing! All of my friends loved their food and my friend is Vegan and they had plenty of options for her! My only issue was customer service seemed a bit short with us and like they just wanted us in and out. I will definitely be back for the food though!

0xseruQSa6nojOeTqtQMVg.text: My go to for good authentic japanese!  Ohitashi- chilled spinach salad is amazing. Charsu Ramen soup is the best in the valley! Prices are affordable and there is a lot to choose from !

M0mXkLkHrF5PK9RuzTGw7Q.text: I've been craving ramen and this seemed like a sure bet. I left with utter disappointment.   I ordered the Hakata Ramen and decided against the bowl with more bbq pork (Cha-shu). If I had known the bowl only came with a tiny sliver of pork (literally ONE piece of meat) I'd have ordered differently. My boyfriend did order the Cha-shu but each piece of pork tasted like it was the dried scraps left under a heat lamp.  However,  the service was spectacular and our writer's unique character made our night. He even rushed our forgotten to-go drink as we got to our car. Yep.. our drink was the only thing worth taking to-go because we managed to eat all of the potstickers. Btw it tasted like a frozen brand, "Gyoza," we usually get at the grocery to cook at home..

ge_ICH0UPBUVZkKwR8VxyQ.text: They say third time a charm. Well, let me tell you, it is not in my case. It was a busy Tuesday night in the restaurant but we got our seats pretty quickly. The server came and took our order after roughly 10 minutes later. She didn't write down our orders, same as the other two tables before me and one after me. I was wondering: "how can she remember all those orders if she doesn't even write them down? She must have a good memories." She was in such a hurry. I didn't finish my order and she tried to move on and asked my friend. I ordered Chasu ramen and I asked her if they have soft boiled egg, she said yes so I requested extra egg on my ramen, and I also ordered Green tea Milk; my friend ordered his Chicken Yakisoba and water with no lemons and no ice. The food came out in a very decent time, yet I did not get my egg on the ramen, my green tea milk became just Iced Green Tea and my friend's water came with ice and lemons. Seriously? So I called another waitress to fix my drink and my egg. The lady who took my order came later with a bowl of poached eggs with soup and she dumped everything in my bowl. Let me tell you, I thought all my appetite after seeing one poached egg got broken and one looking like fried egg in my bowl. It was so disgusting. If you're so busy with taking order, at least grab a notepad to write down all those orders, than had the orders wrong like 3 times. Other than the bad serving experience, the food tasted alright. The only thing I like the most was the green tea milk. It is well balanced between sweet and matcha flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chasu ramen, chicken yakisoba and green tea milk

j7mJgF4chYQYLhYVtLykdg.text: Literally my favorite Japanese spot. The waiter I always see on Sundays is great..they have a wide variety of Japanese food including Italian food (per noodles)... sushi,soup, rice plates, hot pots, great apps (get the miso eggplant), and the owner is a baker and always has new goodies for dessert. Must try!

NqIgr11GhpjaaOkpwSmePg.text: I used to visit Cherryblossom quite often in college, but don't frequent it as much.  Not because I had a bad experience or anything, just because I wasn't close by anymore.  However, I have visited it a few times again the past few months and it is still good.  I've enjoyed their happy hour a few times.  Its a great price for sushi rolls, sashimi, gyoza in spicy sauce/broth, and calamari.  I frequently get the Hiyashi Chuka.  The ramen is decent, as well as the chicken katsu.  They have good bread baskets and their banana bread is pretty delicious.

DcBoHImHEyJyZC0Q_wYf0A.text: The wait staff was rude. "Only speaking on the lady that helped me". I asked her about any specials  or what was popular & she just gave me the lunch & dinner menu's. She didn't offer me water or a drink  while waiting on my order I placed to go. I had the Ramon noodles with pork & the California roll lunch special. It was really good! And I definitely want to go back to try other menu options for sure! If the staff was more pleasant I would've giving them 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The wait staff was a little rude. But the food made up for it. I will go back for sure to try other menus options.

XJjplTkiKdBxkYtB8GK-dg.text: I absolutely love this place. AMAZING service and food. Never dissatisfied. My favorite server is Nole. We live in Mesa, and go to Phoenix jus for this place

lV4BiIsf51y7Y5IeBUmZZg.text: I have been going to Cherry Blossom Cafe for years now. They have a wonderful selection of Japanese, Korean and Italian fare. The restaurant has gained popularity over the years and they really need to expand. The place is consistently crowded, even in the heat of summer, but with success has come some disappointments. The loud and rushed atmosphere has lead to less than spectacular service. The cooks also appear to get rushed and their dishes suffer. Take over the space next door and grow into the space that you deserve Cherry Blossom, your faithful customers are tired of waiting!

Deos5GLKM4Zf7-0RndhKuQ.text: The lighting is dim for a restaurant and the sitting are has wooden tables. Soon as I walked in a was greeted and sat. We had a lady come and ask us for our drink orders the left. She didn't ask if we were ready to order or if we have been here before. She just walked away and never came back.  I sat here for 10 mins with multiple people walking back and forth including the owner. I had my menu here and no one stop to notice or ask if I was ready for my to place my order. 10 mins later I got the owners attention and ask if I can take my order she then told our waitress. The waitress came back and I order the katsu. The waitress asked if knew what it was. Well It's written on the menu In clear details( I knew what it was). I dont just pick some random food item. You can look at it as a kind gesture or as if she was irritated I told the manager I want to order.  The food came out separately for my friend and I. I waited while my friend started eating her dinner.    I am not happy with the customer service at all. The food is mediocre and not worth coming back!

Jdkxic3TLF2r77S8PLuuMw.text: On a whim I decided to recommend Cherryblossom to my boyfriend, who happens to love ramen and treated me to a fantastic noodle house in California once upon a time. Since then I've tried another place besides Cherryblossom in the Valley and have been told that Phoenix just doesn't have a good "ramen scene." I'm glad I didn't give up my search before I remembered this place!   Other reviewers are right, this place is definitely buzzing with activity, and with only one cook and what appeared to be one server on a Sunday evening they were doing remarkably well. It did, however, take a little while for the waiter to see us once we were seated, and the table next to us complained about not being given menus. Part of that may have been due to the layout of the restaurant- we were in a side room that seemed cut off from the rest of the place.   Once our orders were placed the food arrived fairly quickly, and our drinks were delivered about the same time. To start we had gyoza, which arrived piping hot.   He had the Tan-Tan Men (spicy ramen,) and I had the Cha-shu (a more traditional-style ramen.) As usually happens when I dine out with my boyfriend, he chose the better dish. The broth was very flavorful and spicy enough to set his nose running, which according to him was one of the more important criteria... I can't really argue with that logic since I treat horshradish similarly.   My ramen dish was excellent, jealousy of my boyfriend's meal aside. The amount of pork in it was plentiful, and the noodles were soft and not too overcooked.  The atmosphere of this place is very friendly and inviting, it would be a great place to grab lunch on a not-so-busy day, but it was still enjoyable even with the wait. It lent itself well to casual conversation.   If you are a little impatient (or your date is) then it might be best to try somewhere a little less hectic. However if you don't mind sitting around a bit and chatting, I highly recommend checking out this local noodle house.

qkHaxF9uJRBWs_enYH-89g.text: I give it 2 stars because food is good however customer service sucks! Wait staff is slow, had to ask for service from host after being seated for 15 minutes. Need to hire more people. I wouldn't come back due to service. Worst I have experience.

xG1thBRTxLGwmMJzma6zww.text: The food here is fantastic and reasonably priced, but the service is average at best.  TanTan-men is hearty and delicious while the Shrimp-shooma (sp) as an app is very tasty.

QArcKpM5fbdTE5sRmciKxw.text: Not very impressive from the outside but don't be fooled walk in and sit down and prepare to be mind blown I had the Korean spicy beef and the milky green tea and I even had a slice of the green tea cake everything was delicious. Even the appetizers were good freshly battered tempura veggies and meats I will be coming back for sure

q_WKP8J2D63tcHKsO4ZmLg.text: I enjoy this place.  It's interesting.  :)  They used to serve a blueberry bread but now its some kinda cinnamon and sugared pumpernickel bread and dinner rolls.  Eh.  The sushi here is perfect.  Just the right amount of rice, fish cut just right and not boxy and thick on one side - pretty much as perfect as you can get around here.    The ramen is ok.  I thought the noodles were kind of lacking.  The broth was decent, though kind of heavy with sesame.  The pork was flavorful and plentiful.    Mostly its the atmosphere and the "little known" quality of the restaurant that is good.  The food is solid and pretty consistent.  The service is always pretty good.

VV5GoCwE0-SmwMkblrOuHw.text: Interesting! I've had this place bookmarked for months but the parking lot is always swamped so I get impatient and leave. I was finally able to make it in.  The restaurant is decorated like an Italian restaurant, and the menu even features a few Italian dishes. The staff are really nice, and our server was super attentive even when the restaurant got full.  We tried the jap chae as an appetizer and it was wonderful. The beef was tender and full of wonderful flavor. The potato noodles were thin and delicious.The yakisoba tofu was slightly sweet, with a big portion and lots of well cooked tofu. It was awesome. Pad thai with chicken was simple but well done.  I definitely want to come back, especially for happy hour. I wish I hadn't taken so long to stop in!

Jfyi0MN4GMg9Ls11eoWS2Q.text: One of the hidden gems of Phoenix.  One of the best noodle joint in the valley.  The selection is outstanding.  Ramen, udon, fettucine, etc.  They also serve sushi.

XvgwjB7hv9jDu4J1F6222Q.text: LOVE THIS PLACE!  ...Excellent food & even better...excellent service!  ...On 10/18/2010, Mon night, we had dinner here. I ordered the Grilled Salmon with Brown Rice.  It was only lukewarm, and I like my food hot.  I told the waiter & his apologized & they cooked me a brand,new one that was fresh & hot. He gave me another salad on the House to eat while I was waiting for the 2nd one. ...But wait, it gets better... He totally took it off the bill!  ...I didn't have to pay for my dinner!  How cool is that?  This is one of our favorite places to eat for sure!  This is a quint little place to eat, decorated very nicely. It can get somewhat noisy in there, but the food & service makes it worth it!   :)

5N9GAXRuxWQZfEHZnCqDqw.text: Spicy thai beef salad!!! 1 of the best salad I've ever had :)  Very Fresh ingredients complemented with a very happy staff :)

WlLbYNp3yOmHc-CWiIXGIQ.text: So let's get this out of the way up front: The food here's pretty good. There I said it. I always enjoy the food, there's not been one thing there that I've eaten that I didn't like. That being said, food isn't going to make me return to a place to eat. We usually get takeout from CB because their service flat out sucks. My wife made me go with her this past weekend, because I've been making her get takeout form Hula Modern Tiki the past few times (Hula's great). So against my will, and because it was on the eve of Valentine's day, I decided to cave against my better judgement. I should be totally ticked, but because they didn't fail my expectations and screwed up my meal/deliviered craptacular service, wifey won't be making me go again. Win, I think.  I always make it a point to order the dinner special from places with the idea that the chefs are sick and tired of cooking the same stuff on the menu, and will be invigorated at cooking something new and exciting. This particular night, I opted for the Miso Marinated Sea Bass. Sounds great, right? I'll never know.....the server never brought it to me. Appetizer arrived, wife's meal arrived, daughter's bowl of steamed rice arrived, beer arrived, sake arrived, check arrived. Not in that order, but you get my drift. So my meal consisted of some of my wife's sushi, some of my daughter's steamed rice, some of the appetizer, beer, sake and table bread. Happy Valentines to you Cherry Blossom!  If anybody's thinking of checking this place out, get takeout. The food's good, but I can get better service at QT. (Yes, the gas station)

Z1UzMA-O6chsjBv85A0Tqg.text: I got take-out from CherryBlossom tonight.  I was getting a pedicure next door and Helen, who does a FABULOUS job on my toesies, told me to try the Pad Thai. I was greeted as soon as I walked in the door.  There were 3 choices:  chicken, shrimp and/or tofu.  I got the shrimp/tofu Pad Thai. As I sat down, I realized I was sitting next to the biggest jerk/douche EVER!  He must have been on a date and I felt *really* sorry for the really pretty girl with the foreign accent sitting with him.  His cell rang AND HE ANSWERED IT!  In a restaurant!  his schnoz rivaled Seinfeld's.  He even got angry that their server came by and left because he was on the phone.  She told them it was policy not to disturb.  Fine enough!   Seriously, if I were sitting to eat next to him and not just waiting for take-out, I would have requested another table.  He bugged me THAT much. It didn't take more than 10 minutes for me to get my food.  Got home, it was still piping hot.  Generous portion of shrimp and TONS of crushed peanuts.  Yummy!  The sauce had a nice sweet/tang to it.  I saved half to eat later.  Or tomorrow, but it was so good, that I will probably eat it later tonight.  It was a little over $10 with tax.  Not bad for two meals!

jeaxuK7SOO2sQoXhkKKFzw.text: This would have gotten 4.5 stars, had our service actually been decent.   So my mom and I ate here last night. We were there for about 10 minutes before our server came to take our drink orders.  For dinner I ordered vegas roll, korean spicy beef and mom ordered the pork and shrimp noodles.   Dinner arrived and the server apologized that the sushi wasn't ready yet. About 20 minutes later after we had finished eating, and never got drink refills, didn't even get checked on we just kinda sat there at the table watching our server go to ever table except ours. Bringing every other table sushi except ours. Then I saw him twice go over to the main area and chit chat with his coworkers. Then he finally comes back over and just kinda stands there with a smile on his face and I said um I think I'll skip the sushi now. He tries to play it off like he had been asking the cooks for it. Whatev. He forgot. Then he brings us to go boxes and leaves for another 10 minutes. He walks by our table yet again and I had to stop him and ask him for the check. After he brings it to us we wait another damn ten minutes and I had to stop him again and say here can you please take this and I asked him if I could keep the receipt and he asks if he could cash out first. I said yeah sure only if you promise to come back. This time it only took him 2 minutes to come back.   Other than the horrible service the food was excellent. I only wish I was able to try the sushi.

bW5mMvZYe-xpXEX22MQb7A.text: The price for happy hour is good, planning to come back again!

CVkL6nygMfxUnQI7cDxKsw.text: Shared a bento box lunch and spicy potstickers.  Lunch was delicious!  Today was Katsu beef, pork cutlet, salad with beef, and sushi roll.  We were both very full and plan to go back.  We were told the bento box is different weekday with tempura and steak on Friday.

Wp54xHEnBfibms61U4zuyg.text: cherry blossom noodle cafe ...   i was pleasantly surprised with the variety CB had to offer... with such friendly staff, there was nothing more to complain about other than the minor lil boo boos. while most would not think it's something to note about, this is my yelp space where i can do whatever i want, but of course in an honest manner where i am notorious in being so detail oriented. i say this because i use yelp as my own personal sourse to flush out to make notes for future visits, that is, if i do plan on visiting...  CB has sushi, salads, pasta (?), italian pasta for that matter, what else? a few thai, chinese, and one korean entree, and oh! like any other japanese joints, udon/saba/ramen and rice plates....prices range from $8 and up for everything...  interior has this contemporary, cozy, and a very inviting feel... which was a huge plus.  now, onto the food we go... we had a dragon roll ($9), which was eel, crab and cucumber... i wasn't quite thrilled with the unagi being cold... tasted as if it was taken right from the fridge... ahi salad and the rice platter we ordered were good, miso soup was funny... who puts sliced up cabbage in your miso? interesting... as much as i wanted to be adventurous and try italian pasta, i refrained from it from some odd reason. the tofu appetizer, which was also served as an entree was super yummy. the sauce was superly uberly yummy with perfection i could have easily mixed in the sauce with rice and be happy for me and more :D a must order ....  definitely a spot i would hit up for happy hours... good food, cheap prices, and friendly service...

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. the tofu appetizer

DeBLFfyxdCVW5wmsm-CT2A.text: Just got some to go action from the CherryBlossom peeps and I'm dripping in soy sauce as I type. YUM! Quick, attentive and friendly service! I can't wait to dive into my wasabi, my spicy tuna roll and my crunch roll. If you read this and I still have some left...ha ha...I might share with you. But, props to the staff for the sake while I was waiting...Strip malls in Phoenix shall not be ignored people!

4KRIMeGRJAhiX3N5sqraXg.text: Wow, really this place is as legit as Hammer in the 90's.  This is a place where I take my parents when they say take us to a nice place.  This is also a place where  I would take a date and dump her if she did not like the food.  I did not venture into the Italian side of the menu but will definitely be coming back as much as possible.   My Plate I normally don't write about what I ate but this place is an exception.  I had the tempera plate and it blew my mind away.  Large shrimp fish good veggies and Crab, What this place out did themselves.  The rice is right on and I'm a picky rich eater. And I won't leave out the blue berry banana bread, another nice touch. So why not Five Stars, Well the service was not crazy five star worthy but was not terrible.   Ok I"m sure the more I eat here the more likely it will earn the fifth star, because I have craved the place every night since I first tried it.

EQg_O9e8xRDT63gAHY4iMw.text: Best Asian (not just Japanese) noodle shop in the Greater Phoenix area! I love their ramen and udon's. The fried udons are excellent. I usually get the seafood udon. Highly recommended!! You can check out their menus here: bit.ly/8S3o98

dfUSnT1uhgnltHQvK8jNbQ.text: Great food and my water glass was always full.  I loved the tofu noodles and I usually don't like that kind of thing.

W-RDhRny-F5VXLYy1pNzsg.text: I have to echo so many other reviewers when I say the food was good but the service is a nightmare.  We waited almost 10 minutes before anyone even acknowledged us.  The table next to us (and I mean within 4 inches of us) was seated after us and received their drinks before anyone even bothered to say 'hi' to us.  The drinks took forever, as did the food, all while practically having my elbow in my neighbor's soup bowl.  I think I'd do this place to-go in the future.  Just not a good experience being surrounded by people and having none of those people being our waiter.

FoWbWgUpVMEBZdegCp5dHQ.text: This is one of my favorite little places. I always feel comfortable here. the atmosphere is quaint and the food is damned good and affordable. It makes a terrific date place. Good for conversation. The desserts always look terrific but I never save room. Best value for Japanese food that I can think of.

2onQMriuJHnFrzPKqGS4Gg.text: This is really more of a 3.75 star rating for CherryBlossom. It's interesting country French motif and variety of Asian and Italian specialities are brought to you by the fine folks who brought the Tokyo Express chain to the Valley. The Hakata ramen is pretty darn legit (tasty broth, decent chashu-style pork, and darn good noodles). I had the lunch ramen combo with my old fave, the inari-zushi. The bloom was off the rose, as it were, with the inari-zushi. It was not quite as sweet as it should be (maybe it's an off shipment from their supplier). Overall, the lunch special was good. Their happy hour is a very good value and I plan to return.

qEOszjs6lJlnhQglQVdAFA.text: One of the best oxymoronic ethnic restaurants in Phoenix. They have some of the most authentic Japanese food but then they're offering Italian food on the same menu?? Don't try to figure this place out. Just go try it and you'll see that good eats, quality and value are all had here.

SN2t0jvX8e7jEAdv-YbQKg.text: First of all their banana bread is amazing. I can't get enough of their moist soft banana bread. I tried their sushi rolls which are o.k., but I go for their champon. The broth combined with seafood and vegetables is flavorful and delicious. The broth is not too spicy or heavy, just enough of both. This isn't a tradional cham-pon, but their version is absolutely delicious. I especially like this place for bringing Japanese ramen, Korean fusion, and overall Asian inspired dishes to Az. It's about time!

-F8AhSc2a9AHgzlUk5ZPHQ.text: Uber yumz fa sho.  Japanese-style Western food!  Last time my gf and I were here, we got the tofu steak and takoyaki (octopus balls) for starters.  The takoyaki came in a set of six and was topped with this oh-so-delicious brown sauce.  We followed that up with a wakame (seaweed) salad and an entree of salmon in cream sauce over pasta (not the exact name. it's on the last page of the menu near the bottom).  OH MAN! SUPER DELICIOUS!  Finished it off with a creme brulee, which surprisingly wasn't too rich.  Oh man, my mouth is watering just thinking of it and it doesn't seem to matter that it's nearly 6am in the morning as I write this.  That alone should be a testament as to how rad the food at Cherry Blossom is.

pqd__WHBCwHpj9TVb1_9Eg.text: This time the family went, because everyone wanted something different and  I said I'd be back to check out the menu. I felt that we'd get to try alot of other things this way. My daughter had Penne and spicy marinara, I had the Nagasaki Sara Udon and my partner had a Curry dish. We shared a dessert despite saying we wouldn't try one again. I got a pineapple cooler despite saying I wasn't going to try the drinks again. Listening to myself next time on both desserts and drinks. Promise. Food: The Penne Marinara was not spicy, but it was good said the daughter. It was $7 and the serving was plenty. She was ok with it. She lamented that we didn't pick Pizza a Metro again. I think I may have spoiled my ability to grab just any old pasta to suit her after eating there. My Nagasaki Udon had some good flavors, but there was a bit of burnt in it, sort of what happens some times at Panda Express with their noodles, but it was nice to have calamari and the shrimps. I added my sushi soy/wasabi sauce to it and the red pickled things from my partners curry dish and that livened it up. The sauce consistency was a bit ew at the end, so I didn't finish. The food was better than my previous visit. My partner did not enjoy the Curry, said it had no heat to it at all, was bland.  Nice service, though. We grabbed two sushi rolls for appetizer, one crunchy roll and a spicy yellow-tail. Both were fine, but again "Spicy" wasn't there. I think this place hedges itself on spice and for those that seek it, may feel disappointed.  Seating was difficult because they had a large party and I had to sit in a walkway in a door-frame on the edge and it was awkward. I upped my rating to a third star because our bread basket was tasty and because we were able to feed three diverse needs in one place, with better service this time.

uXma7ksKR0IMAvo5sGeCag.text: This was a bit of a disappointment. Sushi rice was way too sweet, and the pasta was overcooked. Overall food was ok but worse than I had expected given the 4 star rating and seemingly authentic menu.

mcsO0zEBVOoumFe-PZ8daQ.text: I came to this place every week for some noodle fix. For here you can have a pretty high expectation on the food quality, but please do yourself a favor and don't have any expectations on the service (as otherwise you can be really disappointed). Their ramen is as good as what you will get across the ocean. But my favorite noodle is 'champon' which has seafood and veggies in a lighter broth (comparing to cha-su ramen). Despite it is a noodle cafe they have decent sushi too. And if you are here for lunch their lunch box is really filling and offers a variety of meat, veggies and rice etc. So basically their food consistently satisfy me. However, their service is not on par with their food. Even when they are not very busy, it takes a longer time to get taken care of. Although most of their waiters/waitress are helpful one waiter always serves with an attitude that make you think you owe him money or something lol and the host in front can ignore u for a while until she feels like seating you... Anyway I still suggest to try the place just for the food and you won't regret it!

iIIyKVA0bcgeUfStlwkmoQ.text: So i wasn't to impressed with this place. Personally i think its a little overrated. The place is clean and nice but the food is just... ok.  I ordered the Korean Spicy Beef and thought it was pretty bland. Seriously, I could have made a better dish at YC's Mongolian BBQ.  I don't think i would ever visit this reastaurant again because the menu was weak and uncreative.

I-3pI0DeW3VYJ6mpUyDNSw.text: OH! here are all the Asians in Arizona. Surprisingly food was really good. They don't try and rip you off with a ton of rice on the sushi. Everything on the menu was super cheap.. compared to dining in Honolulu.

uySovOcrTIaWtxifrYuVjA.text: This was 4 star food but with 1 star service.  Since I am feeling nice today, they get rounded up instead of down.  It was a little bit later than normal dining time, 9:45, so it was nice to be able to go and have a nice dinner that didn't involve waiting forever to be seated or fast food.    Once we were seated we were promptly ignored for quite a while.  Probably about ten minutes.  No one even came around to say they would be back in a couple minutes or that they were just busy at the moment.  Then the table next to us was seated, greeted, and got drinks all before anyone took notice of us.  Finally our grumpy server came by, said two words and then held up a finger, telling us to wait, while she talked to someone else.  Seriously?! WTF.    I ordered a water to drink and the Chicken Yakisoba.  I downed my water within 10 seconds of getting it and waited until the end of the meal to get it refilled.  Hmph.  The food was really yummy.  The noodles were firm and the sauce was light and kind of sweet.  I really liked the veggies included, but I thought the chicken was kind of unnecessary.  It just didn't add anything to the meal.   I think I will probably get some food from here again, but only in take out.  I'm not sure I could handle service like that again, especially since I can pretty much touch every end of the room when I stretch out my arms.

h23_JMqMBqrdbJ3j7JVFdQ.text: Oh CherryBlossom, where have you been my whole life!?? Discovered this spot by looking for restaurants nearby my workplace. Checked it out online, seemed decent enough. Loved the feeling upon walking, very "homely" an authentic. I was confused by the italian/asian menu, but intrigued as well. Should I mentioned I've been 3 times since I first went there only 1 week ago? I've ordered their bento box (which changes daily), a steal at only $10! I've had their sushi twice. Everything is very cheap and VERY tasty. Servers are very friendly and pretty quick. In and out in 45 minutes during lunch. I think I will be frequenting this place very often.

niz1fcZU4lU2uarVlH0wDg.text: CherryBlossom is a fun place to dine. The ambience is relaxing. The service is good. Their happy hour is awesome. They make the most amazing spicy Thai beef salad, plus fun desserts and drinks. Their menu is somewhat diverse.   However, I've tried some entrees and haven't always been thrilled. Additionally, the place can be crowded if you happen to have bad timing.  Overall, I will keep going back.

P1NHPA4POCgQ8P5_U1F7Gw.text: Takata ramen is very good! Only place for good ramen in AZ. Service wasn't great though.

Yl7K6FKQCUKn0cKThn6fvw.text: Cute little cafe to hang out in. Food was pretty decent, considering it is Phoenix. x) Service was really good. Took a friend here that came from out of town so it was a nice little place to sit, relax, and catch up.

6Ct7PIjTuDo6hjMhUbHp7g.text: If you have been boycotting Cherry Blossom because of the service, you must give them another chance!!  I know the owner reads the Yelp reviews and they have really taken the feedback on the service seriously.  I went back after a 4 month frustration sabbatical and service staff appears to be new for the most part and the experience was fantastic!  Please take my advice and go there again for dinner!

nSpUuQiy8gBpA5WYjFzzRw.text: Mmmm, Ramen.  Very good ramen.  Good tempura, not greasy at all.  OK Sushi.  Overall, any thing with noodles will be great.  Alway good service.  Usually get the Cha- Shu Ramen, huge bowl with lots of noodles and miso dashi.  Wife likes the Italian Pescatore.    If you are in the area, give Cherry Blossom a try.

Mm5R3Nil0x050fGit_5cSg.text: Always one of my favorite places...the ambiance is great, the service is stellar and the food is RIDICULOUS! Our server, Josh, was especially kind and helpful even though I am a bit of a high maintenance orderer(allergies :-/ ) Cannot say enough good things about Cherry Blossom!!! Love it!

JG3K8y58Ha1wLxvNShN-cg.text: We met some of my wifes co-workers after work here. I just kept dishing out Ramen jokes all day since I wasnt too much of a fan on this is where we would be going.  After getting there my attitude quickly changed. They have a very wide assortment of dishes rather than noodles. Everyone but me got the yaki soba noodles with chicken. I tried something else, but dont remember what it was called. It was basically shrimp tempura in rice with some kind of sweet honey type of sauce over it. It was pretty tasty. I also got a rainbow sushi roll that took a very long time for them to prepare. It came after we were all done eating. It was good, and the price for it was decent. The only complaint I had was that the fish was sliced to thick. It was a little on the chewy side.  Our waitress was kind of hit and miss, but she was a delight when she showed up. I would visit it again and definately skip the ramen jokes the next time!

J7bT5JKBhxVNV_xrcj5vEA.text: Our favorite ramen noodle place, hands down. Even San Francisco ramen can't compare. The Tan Tan Men is superb. Noodles perfectly cooked, with spicy flavorful broth. In fact, every dish here is prepared with an abundance of evenly balanced flavor and comes in generous sized proportions. The best gyoza, ramen, and spicy Korean beef, spicy potsticker hot pot, and pad Thai. The orange roughy is really good as well. Small place but can surprisingly seat a lot of people. The theme is Asian Paris. It's always crowded. Service can be slow but the food here is worth it!! Easily a Phoenix favorite.

rB4w2yxUHKMX08r_tfNiow.text: The only thing that prevents me from giving this place five stars is the inconsistency and slowness of the service. The place has a casual, relaxed atmosphere and the staff is friendly, but it often seems to take forever for the food to arrive, even when the restaurant isn't busy or crowded. I have nothing to complain about regarding the food itself - for me it has consistently been good, the servings ample, and the prices reasonable. And I do like the idea that they serve both Asian and Italian dishes, so that Cherry Blossom is a logical destination for me and my friends when we want to dine out but can't seem to decide on one cuisine to have for the evening. If only the service were a bit faster ...

e_iwRi_tW50VsfVhtlBtyg.text: Gigantic menu...and kind of all over the place.  Everything from noodles to sushi, so it's a great place for the family because everyone can have something different.  Service is ok, but this place is swamped.  Food is very good...and the noodles authentic, so we'll definitely visit again!

hKSv-lwmYjKRmQaxr5zm0A.text: My friend told me about this place a while back and raved about the ramen, and I thought, "wow, I guess this place must be worth trying!" Well, my husband and I went there for dinner last week and we were not disappointed!  I loved the ambiance. I loved that the meal doesn't start out with any old bread basket, but one with a delicious roll, yummy cinnamon-sugar toast, and excellent banana bread! Definitely a shocker, coming to a noodle place, but a pleasant surprise :)  The menu is broad and eclectic, ranging from Italian linguine to curry noodles, from ramen to sushi, and an impressive and surprising selection of rice dishes.  I had asian wheat noodles with chicken (I don't remember the name of the dish), and it was very tasty! While we were there, we heard another customer telling his friend that he's tried many things on the menu, and everything has been delicious. I believe it. They say a large part of taste comes from our sense of smell, and this place was just brimming with incredible aromas! I can't wait to go back and try more yummy dishes!

3FpJVe9txIO-y4xUtJnT-g.text: This place made me wanna start a bad-food-diet! Ok. Maybe I should start a little more positive.  This place has decent ambience. That's about it. The restaurant staff that I encountered was non-friendly, non-welcomy, and probably non-existent!  The biggest offense is the food! I cannot believe so many other reviews were soooo positive. I came in a little late (9:15 p.m.) and that may have rubbed the waiting staff wrong, but there were 2 other parties that came in after me.  Going back to the food. I ordered Miso Ramen and an addition of cha-shu (pork), and a side of Agedashi Tofu.  1. The Miso ramen came with a slice of salmon.  Really? Salmon??? It was not the best combination to say the least. Miso?? There was hardly any miso in the soup. It was so diluted, I almost had to imagine the taste of miso. BTW, the cha-shu was like left-over and an after-thought added to the ramen. I am guessing the owner is trying to pull a fast one.    2. Agedashi Tofu. This is a freaking joke. An insult to the patron of the restaurant. Really!! How lazy can this restaurant get! Essentially a silken tofu deep fried with some dashi-based sauce. What did I get? A re-fried chinese firm tofu which was probably microwaved with a bunch of undercook or recooked vegetable tempura. The sauce? Dilluted straight from the bottle tempura sauce!  3. Iced Green Tea. This one is not as bad as some other Asian fusion restaurant. They actually used a decent roasted green tea with a hint of roast barley.  Unfortunately, it is so very dilluted.  The guy from the next table was complaining that he was drinking water!  I also saw something not very nice; a waiter recycling butter from a table.  I know it is sealed but, really??? in front of customers?  This place really cut corners in terms of food and service.   Benefit of doubt? Maybe, since I tried this place only once, but once is enough for me. I saw 2 sushi rolls ordered by a couple that came in after myself. Not impressed at all.  Bottom-line, lazy effort at best. Worst case scenario, cheap food costing big bucks giving patrons food-poisoning from re-using left-overs!

RurVK_Ks1dlbjfgU7Gao7g.text: Awesome! Pasta and Sushi at the same place, and both are done right. Price matches the quality of food and service. Parking is the only negative.

SbOvb4miVlkY6U90BpWfjQ.text: We had dinner at Cherry Blossom Noodle Cafe on a Thursday night about 7:30 pm.   The strip mall doesn't have any curb appeal and you're surrounded by Domino's, a Barber Shop and a drive-thru liquor store. We were quoted a 45 minute wait by an Asian woman who seemed less than pleased to see us. :( We waited an hour.  However, once seated, our server was pleasant and the menu options were more than we expected. Everything and anything with noodles, including Italian dishes?! The food was good and the atmosphere was cozy and full of obvious regulars.  One interesting(?) tidbit is the Kyoto Bowl next door is owned by the same people. We inquired after noticing there is an incomplete wall dividing the two restaurants.   We will visit again.  Hope my Yelp helped!

pXcyRUqO3TmlXc7yqPhXeA.text: Terrible service and overrated ramen and dessert.   I am well educated in noodles. The soup of its ramen is good but noodle is "random", which means you have 50% to get not well cooked noodles and rest for cooked ones based on my experience of four noodle dishes. The noodle was hard to bite and u can see the white texture raw part that haven't been boiled throughly. I have tried many different noodles from several countries in various levels of restaurants and I know what is good cooked noodle. Dessert was only good looking but tasted so-so. Tough texture and miss all good things in Japanese pastry( high quality cream, fine and smooth cake, no overdose sugar)  For the service. Cannot believe the male server is still there. I was astonished by his terrible service before and this time I was not disappointed. But by another server. Indifference and impatience are the words to describe them. The server neither explained the menu nor gave me any suggestion directly. I had to ask her several times for suggestion but did not get results.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not well cooked noodles and was hard to bite and u can see the white texture raw part that haven&#39;t been boiled throughly.

Tz2YWzZD0bNMh6p2a3GfjQ.text: This is the place I come when I crave for an authentic Japanese noodle dish.  Ika mentai pasta I had tasted just like the one I had in Japan. I don't know any other places that serves tarako (cod fish eggs) in Phoenix.   If this place is closer to my house, I would come here every week!  They also have a great selection of desert. I tried strawberry short cake. It was so moist and the cream was not too sweet, just right amount of sweetness made it so perfect and I ate all... May be it's a good thing that this place is not too close to my house. I may try their cake too often and I have to watch my girly figure if I do :).

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy chocolate cake

mWfhRhX7I5EgjgnEQuqiOw.text: I've been at this location for dinner and lunch. Food and service are good. Today I tried their "lunch box special" It was really good. It had five items and each item was just enough. Who would of thought calamari salad would be good but it was. The grilled salmon was tasty. California roll was fresh. Sweat and sour pork was juicey and the tampura shrimp with brown rice was different I loved it!  On other occasions I have the suchi rolls which are all good, my favorite is the Rainbow roll. The service was ok. The plaza is small and its hard to find parking but it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rainbow, Tootsie, Crunchy California, Vegas and Philly.
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Suchi roll heaven, Rainbow roll, Tootsie roll, Philli roll,  California roll
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch Box Special

8GTLv0R8cPeWQ4SUyYVCyQ.text: Food:  - Tofu Steak with Shiitake Sauce: 4 pieces of fried tofu over some greens topped with green onions and sparse shittake mushroom. The sauce was tasty. I would have liked more mushroom toppings. 3/5  - Pan Fried Gyoza: pork and vegetable dumplings. Your standard gyoza, nothing special. 4/5  - Cha Shu Ramen: noodles, BBQ pork, kikurage mushrooms, and green onions. This dish lacked flavor. I had to add 2 spoonful of hot sauce and soy sauce. 2/5  Service: Quick and polite. 3/5  Final thoughts: I would come back to try other dishes.

Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tofu steak with shiitake sauce
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pan fried gyoza

EFGXVJH8WQwgKS7kVoAhUA.text: Such a cute casual restaurant! Was supposed to have our last meal in AZ at Elote Cafe in Sedona for my birthday dinner but sadly couldn't wait till 5pm when they open so we headed to Phoenix. Of course I Yelped and found CherryBlossom. Was interested in the Japanese/Korean/Italian fusion.  Order 4 plates and banana bread:  BTW- our server who clearly has been there awhile was superb! Super sweet, tentative and took her time to make sure everything was perfect for us.   1. Baja Norte Roll - surprisingly fresh and lite to start as an app. Don't bother with the soy sauce bc the dipping sauce that came with it paired perfectly  2. TanTan Men - Chop chop was what the chopsticks did! Broth and spice level were perfect. If I wasn't sodium conscious, I would have slurped the whole bowl! 3. Spicy Korean beef with egg noodles - After trying my Tantan, I was expecting a lot of flavor in this dish. I was really bummed that the dish lacked any spice or taste. It was....bland! I told bf I was convinced they forgot some special seasoning :( 4. Bolognese - BF is obsessed with bolognese so decided to order it here although clearly this was an "Asian" restaurant.  Very lite in taste and didn't come with that strong spaghetti pow   Dessert - banana bread - very moist and good but I had better   No regrets coming here and would love to come back to try other dishes that look so yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tan Tan Men - Delicious!
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Korean beef with egg noodles - wasn&#39;t spicy at all and a bit bland
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baja Norte - great appetizer!

7053Rj00QkM29DttktHltQ.text: The atmosphere of the restaurant is very nice my server was also very friendly. The food did not meet my expectations but it was still pretty good. They had like an asian italian twist which was new and interesting. I ordered the garden salad and the dressing and the avocado was delicious, the tofu yakisoba was okay... and the tantan men ramen was mediocre... although i really liked the soup!

Y4WYOPvVf7dCaLV5SobujQ.text: It seems like Cherryblossom IS that go-to spot for Asian food with their four star rating. I live so close that Yelp always lists this place when I search for a restaurant and although I have been here multiple times and placed to-go orders, I am always left with a "much-to-be desired" taste.   Since I am Asian, I do have my rice cravings from time to time and recently, I had to get some rice. So I placed an order here for Chicken Katsu and the Spicy Beef Noodles (with the recommendations from a few of you). I say to pass on the Chicken Katsu - they give you the sauce for it, but the sauce taste a little bitter to me. I think they add some type of mustard to it. So since I didn't like the sauce, I was left with the Chicken and the rice - and that combination just lacked any type of good flavor.   The Spicy Beef noodles did have flavor so I was happy about that. I was able to get full, but even after my meal, my thoughts of this establishment is "eh, it was OK."  Two entrees = a little more than $20.

uqwg8csge1OLWuRyHZpOGw.text: Friendly staff! I had the Hakata Ramen and Gyozo . The Ramen was rich and delicious and the gyoza were crunchy and plump! Definitely have to bring my friends !

w61ZVLvLqvYKfnjAEVK2Ig.text: I was craving some thick, homemade Udon noodles so after a Google search ended up at Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe.  Turns out the Yelp Reviews were all pretty spot on! I ordered the Beef Curry Udon Noodles which was absolutely delicious! The rolls were soft and warm and slightly sweet and very good! My husband had the BBQ pork ramen and loved the noodles but the BBQ pork was tasteless and the broth was a bit bland.  I would highly recommend my dish and took a picture to share here!  As for the blueberry BANANA BREAD everyone mentions, we bought a slice to go and it was moist, perfectly sweet and absolutely delicious!! I would go again to try another dish and my husband said he would also even though he wasn't happy with his selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My dish... Beef Curry Udon Noodles - delicious!
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My husband&#39;s BBQ Pork Ramen on the left... and my dish, the Beef Curry Udon Noodles on the right and the yummy rolls!

_71jhtllh8sGPqU-MpkkAQ.text: BRUH.   The fact that there is a Japanese/Italian fusion restaurant is one of the dopest things on planet earth.  The ramen was delish and the chicken parmigiana was A1. Service wasn't bad and atmosphere was decent.  I am definitely coming here every two or three weeks. And it's a really good date night spot.  BB's Rating: MARIO WOULD EAT HERE

dd9tx0EGhXoRNCno06UZfA.text: I've had this little spot bookmarked for months. Had a free lunch hour in the area and I wasn't disappointed.   The menu is a bit to take in since they have Japanese and Italian dishes, what?   I came for Asian soup and went for the udon noodles with veggie tempura and added chicken. I'm not accustomed to having deep fried veggies in my soup but I'll try anything once. It was very tasty broth and who doesn't love deep fried anything? The chicken was delicious and there was a generous amount of everything in this medium sized bowl. My only complaint would be the spoon which I found impossible to fit in my mouth and therefore dribbled my broth with every bite. Good thing I was eating alone.  The service was very good and staff very warm. I loved being greeted with a big bouquet of fresh flowers upon entry. I will be back and bring a friend!

OLIYLZC4VlctJS7i_uAupA.text: We had ramen which was great and good sushi. Their menu seems to be all over the place, but that's not an issue for us, just funny.   We dined in, but it feels uncomfortably tight and cramped. I wanted to hurry, eat and leave. It took awhile for us to get our food.  Now we order take out which still takes a while to get. Our last visit, they didn't get it correctly, but they apologized, Eh.

BON9xgoV0z3UZHzVaGBOdQ.text: I love this restaurant's food and atmosphere! There's something truly special about the way the restaurant is constantly bustling with people and conversations which makes the experience feel private but lively. Of course, their food is delicious with generous servings; especially all of their ramen and sushi. I'm a big fan of their milky Pepsi and various teas. The only downside is the amount of time you have to wait for a table (considering you visit during evening hours) but I believe it's absolutely worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XYT57wA8aVFueniaZCOXaA.text: Have only ordered to go, and the sushi was nice and fresh! Would like to try to dine in to be able to comment on the locale, but as far as the sushi goes, it gets a thumbs up!

bb-H6tdC44UB5XIhnDIGeQ.text: The wait is horrible. If you're going to let your customer know it's a 20 minute wait and we don't get seated until 1 hour later. That's right one hour. I would have not waited at all. Be realist with your eating expectations. Sushi was garbage. Rice was mushy. I ended up leaving to Krachai Thai Kitchen, food and customer service there is always amazing. Cherry Blossoms can learn something from them.

cenPiWpeZukFYZUp9LOJ2g.text: First time here. Nice place tucked away in a small plaza. Parking is limited FYI. Service was good. Our waiter was attentive and brought our food in a timely manner. Place was very clean. I had the ramen and gyoza. Both were very delicious and flavorful. I would recommend.

gedtjlp-HnvvfVfYwy9e8Q.text: This place is more like a 3.5. The food here is good occasionally. My go-to in terms of consistency is the katsu-don. The order is always fresh and the miso soup that comes with(dine in only) is pretty good. The cha-shu is pretty good but the broth doesn't necessarily feel completely authentic. Now the yakisoba noodles are a hit or miss. What I mean is that they over cook the food and leave a overwhelming burnt taste to the dish about 50% of the time. Can't really say I would recommend it. The complimentary bread is cold and bland. The service is what makes this place a 3 and not a 4. Either the staff is rude, forget important parts of the meal(eating utensils), disorganized, or a combination. They are not fans of refunds or remaking dishes.   When it's not so busy and if you can get a spot on the other side of the wall this place is pretty good.

nM5xwibfExQoKh6j72evEQ.text: The Korean Spicy Beef is out of this world!!! The pic doesn't even do it justice! Yum Yum. They also have a fabulous HH from 3 PM - 6 PM, Monday - Friday. An 8 piece California Roll was only $2!!! Beer is $3 and Wine is $4. I found it interesting that they serve Italian dishes as well so I asked my server where that came from. He said that in Japan, they have Italian cafes all over and actually LOVE Italian food!! Fun Fact! :) I will absolutely be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. California Roll --only $2 on Happy Hour!
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Korean Spicy Beef!! To die for!

Q6Pk7kNaUHnNkRv06BOJxA.text: We had a very enjoyable and delicious meal here. I would recommend it if that's what you're in the mood for!

jaP1L30JqkiuWXPaq4alrg.text: It was my first time at cherry blossom noodle cafe and it was definitely a good experience. The environment was quaint (I didn't notice the pictures on the walls until a little later). We were seated in what I felt was a little bit of an awkward spot where people were entering into the dining area.  We started out with drinks and I definitely liked the strawberry punch and the mango tango sake floats. The bread basket was definitely amazing (we ended up ordering two :) ). We also ordered the crispy calamari, pan fried gyoza, the ebi chili (upon waitress recommendation) and the shimeji mushroom and bay scallops pasta. The best was definitely the pasta and pan fried gyoza. Cherry blossom noodle cafe has a well deserved reputation for having amazing noodles. Our least favorite was the ebi chili. We thought that for 6 dollars the ebi chili was not as good as it should have been (especially if an employee recommended it). The sauce tasted almost like ketchup and the ebi itself was bland. The waitress did disappear for a little bit and it took longer for our pasta to come out because of a "mix up". Overall a good food experience (still craving the bread).

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strawberry punch
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The infamous amazing bread basket
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mango tango

aYqdS64gfAb4UgXV2bdmWA.text: This is such a good place to eat. The food is delicious and the vibe is super nice! The ramen was a lot better than what I was expecting it to be, I would highly recommend!

nUDfxQf99eZPt8J4sPd4wg.text: We came here because of the reviews and were deeply disappointed.  We walked in and it took 5 minutes for someone to greet us.  After finally being seated it took 10 minutes to get our beer and wine.  We waited so long the kids had to start asking when our food would be arriving.  Very disappointed with service and sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GYaE8F-1v59GIltUbot4-g.text: Ok this place rocks!  I had heard from a couple of people about it so gave it a try.   I was fully thinking that I'd go ramen but went with spicy Loren beef. Now let me say it was so flipping amazing that I had to go back and get more within days. It was that good.   I've had the udon bowl too and it's very good. I'm going to get stuck on the spicy beef I know it.   The pasta is so good. I'm dying to try the Italian aspect as well. Give this place a shot. Totally worth it.

N1zx9wdJHj5saW6ssdF73Q.text: I've had a difficult time finding tasty ramen place but this is a good cafe to satisfy a craving. I've heard great things about the ramen here and I would go back again.   The service & Restaurant  Our wait time wasn't long at all and our waitress was kind and helpful. Our drinks were kept full and plates cleared right when we were done. The restaurant itself kind of caught me off guard but not in a negative way. Right when you walk in there's baked goods and a desert case with a wide variety of things that look great! The menu itself has what you would expect to find from a noodle house. However, they also have one page in their menu dedicated to Italian food which I found pretty odd.   The food To start we ordered the spicy salmon roll on happy hour. What I liked about it was that it was cut chunks of tuna instead of the usual  pate texture. Other than that I would give the roll a 2 out of 5 and wouldn't ever pay more than the $3.50 it cost. But honestly I can't complain because you don't order sushi from a ramen house. For ramen, I ordered the Shoyu Ramen. It came in a huge, steaming bowl and it smelled great. The miso based broth was pretty good! It was better than most I've tried and the pork belly was cooked really well. Most restaurants will just put a hard boiled egg in as the last step in making it but they cooked the egg in the broth which made it taste even better.   Overall I would come back again but I recommend that people who are new to ramen get a feel for what they like and be open minded. The restaurant has multiple kinds of broth and I only like one of them so it's no surprise if you end up not liking one. I would try a baked good too because they look great!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZUjxOvJL-f1RJddlF27F5A.text: Stopped by to try the ramen and was not disappointed the broth was tasty and fulfilling! We had the shoyu ramen and the Nabeyaki Udon both were excellent! The only complaint is the wait and the hostess! I'm not sure if she was having a bad day but her customer service was disappointing other than that I'm glad we tried. Also a little pricey for ramen but oh well it was good!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Karage appetizer
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nabeyaki udon
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shoyu ramen

nPoD0dBlwu2vp8N7Y4O7lQ.text: I've been here twice now, though years apart. The first time I ate here I ordered Thai food and it was delicious.  More recently I went with friends and tried their "ramen" which wasn't exactly ramen I was informed. It wasn't the best and though I had leftovers, I probably wouldn't order it again. With that said, it's worth going to for other menu items!

HoJ_GhAfjjtMfwgDGp4hZg.text: Came here to have lunch with my bf. We got there at 2.20 (tried to get the lunch special which ends at 2.30), the hostess set us in the other room, but they didn't really pay attention to that room and the server didn't get to us until 2.40, so that means we weren't able to get the lunch special...  We ordered Cha-Shu Ramen, Spicy Salmon Roll and Tempura Shrimp Roll. The food came to us pretty quickly, the Ramen is pretty damn good, the Spicy Salmon Roll wasn't as spicy as I expected, and the Tempura roll wasn't tightly rolled and it fell apart when trying to dip it in the soysauce. But other than those, the flavor was still pretty good.  But then came the main problem. After we got the food, the server came in and checked on us 5 minutes later... After we said it was good, we sat and ate for another 20 minutes. We were done eating but no one was coming in to check on us to see if we wanted anything else, like a new glass of water. My boyfriend ended up having to go to the hostess himself and ask for the take out box and bill. After he asked, they said yes, it will be just a second.... It ended up being almost another 20 minutes... We ended up being there for over an hour because of the slow service.  So I'm not sure if I would come back here because my bf was unhappy about the slow service. It's like they kinda forgot that there were people in the room they put us in.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. CHA-SHU Ramen, it&#39;s delicious!
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tempura Shrimp Roll
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Salmon Roll

QJLFYRlS_VVyOBlRnajPPw.text: I love coming here for the Hakata Ramen, out of all the "Best Ramen" known places we have been told of this is definitely the ONLY one I have LOVED, (personaly)... can't wait to actually go to Japan one day and try the traditional Ramen there ofcourse BUT... I love the Ramen here for sure :). Another Favorite you shoud try is the Mango Tango cocktail as well as the Strawberry punch cocktail. The lemonade here is delici and so the cocktails have their lemonade and it is to die for! Gyoza here is very good as well. Much better than other Gyoza I have tried before. Sushi is yummy too and my personal fav is Double Crunchy roll and my husband's is the Philly roll. Price is good, not cheap but not too pricy like most places.   Now.. about the restaurant and staff.. it is a Very small joint with limited space and  long wait times at times. Dark and almost romantic with dim lighting we really like that.... and staff always seems in a hurry... we have been here atleast 20 times and every single time we come the hostesses are rude to us(when we always try to be nice we do not like trouble)... there is one server who is always rude to us as well but we never complain just wanted to let it out on here... he wears glasses. Just personal experience. But the food is delicious.  We hust always experience bad service but that will not stop us from coming here for a meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mango Tango
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Double Crunchy Rill
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Philly Roll

bfxaINN26is9J8WhXWgPhw.text: Cute atmosphere. Tasty food. So much to choose from. Nice sized portions for the price. Lucy was excellent in making sure we had a pleasurable lunch. Looking forward to going back and trying more of their extensive menu or even on of their yummy looking baked goods.

Tnx6Nyf_6HvNfhAKL9B7kw.text: Great ramen actually the best I have had. Had some in California and Arizona and this place is my favorite. 5 stars from me.

kAw34pdyJSX9c2XUBdMVng.text: Our awesome friends brought us because they really enjoy this place.   We ordered a ton. Tempura jalapenos, tempura shrimp, California roll, rainbow roll, spicy soup with tofu noodles, calamari salad, gyoza, Korean beef noodles, wonton gyoza soup, calamari salad chicken karage, and pasta with meat and red sauce.   The soup was supposed to be spicy and I asked for extra spicy but it was not at all. It was not flavorful. The portions were huge and everyone has plenty to eat but it's not somewhere I'd return to.   My favorite bite of the night was the tempura jalapenos. They were great!    If you're eating. Keto diet like I am, they offer shirataki tofu noodles that I've never seen offered anywhere!  That alone was enough for me.

YkYogd_2sMaYtMBWjzT2Lw.text: I've been here before for happy hour and always had a decent meal. I've been twice now outside of happy hour (once for dinner, once for lunch) and both the service and the food have been average to below average. Most recently for lunch, I came with a party of 5 from work before the lunch rush. We were seated in the back room where the lights were still off (see: pre-lunch rush) and got our orders in. As the back room filled in, we received our food in a very large scattering - a few people got their California rolls that came with the lunch specials first as well as an appetizer, then an entree a few minutes later, a sushi lunch combo a few minutes after that, 2 noodle bowls after that, and then an assurance from the waitress that a coworker's sushi roll would be out shortly. 5 minutes pass and everybody else in the room has their food apart from my one coworker - the waitress says it'll be out in 3 minutes. Those 3 minutes pass by and our table is done with all of the food when the waitress comes once more and says the sushi roll is being made now. Unfortunately we were out of time and our coworker was left unimpressed.  As for the food, I do like the happy hour menu - good bites with good flavor and prices. I most recently had the hakata ramen lunch combo and felt that the ramen was pretty bland and overall left me feeling pretty unsatisfied. Overall, I'd say Cherry Blossom now reminds me of a pan-Asian version of the Cheesecake Factory - good for a wide range of tastes, but there's better out there if you look for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hakata ramen
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. California roll

XbMB_VjWT7YXbg0_ucDUjQ.text: Decent Japanese food spot. I ordered a seafood noodle soup, a sake boiled clam. Both the dishes taste fresh and not MSG.  I knew Phoenix is middle of US. It's hard to find fresh and love clam. As this reason, I can give them 5/5 for the clam. If it's in west coast I would expect much more. The seafood noodle has a nice taste of seaweed and clam. I even found scallop inside which was perfectly not over cooked. The egg inside is also taste good. The restroom is not that clean which might trouble customers some. In all, it's a nice spot. The services are just OK.8/10. But if they are not annoying me, I won't desert from food to services.

Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7mTJ3OAf4OroYXUROimafA.text: One of the better ramen places I've been to in the greater Phoenix area. I got miso ramen (comes with salmon pieces) and added a poached egg and chasu pork. Ramen was perfectly cooked! The soup was a little dense and saltier than I'd like but overall a good meal. I got the matcha pandan cake as a dessert and my only regret was that I was too full from the ramen and couldn't finish it. Service was quick and we were seated immediately on a Monday evening.

Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Matcha pandan cake

v94XCf_van46zDEr525QQQ.text: Came here on a Saturday night, the restaurant has a cozy, casual date night/dim lights feel with fun eclectic decor.  I ordered the spicy beef lomein noodles for my entree, and California roll and  potstickers for my appetizer. I love spicy and the noodles were very much that. The portion was also generous I had enough to take home.   I also love being just a little boujie so when they served my Thai tea In a cute cup I was like OKUR! lol   The waitress was also very nice and helpful when it came to questions on the menu!
