Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fQ8SJFCG8fvr58oFy-u4LQ.text: It's hit or miss here. We've had some really good ramen and we've had not so great ramen.

wwWxT30ZfWR2LeEYmHItAg.text: Had this bookmarked for a while, so on a busy Saturday we decided to drop in and try it out. We were hoping to have a new go-to ramen joint but I'm afraid that we're going to have to keep looking... It wasn't that the food was awful or the service was dreadful, it just wasn't anything that impressed us at all. We ordered the Korean spicy beef and the chicken yakisoba, both were good enough to fill us up , but neither of us were blown away or even excited to come back and try anything else. Normally we will come up with a game plan to try something different on the menu, or come at a different time if we see potential at a restaurant. That's not the case here for us. People eating around us seemed to enjoy it, so it may not be our cup of tea. Sigh.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VmD4WpL1MaMV4d5Mi9oxlg.text: I've been frequenting this restaurant for a few years now.  Of all restaurants in Phoenix, Cherryblossom is probably my favorite.  I've never had a bad experience here.  The staff has always been super nice, the food has always been FANTASTIC, and honestly, I could not recommend this place highly enough.  I've tried just about everything on the menu, and so far there hasn't been anything I DON'T enjoy. Even their Italian dishes are surprisingly good (my favorite is the chicken marsala).  Great food at a fairly good value, ESPECIALLY if you go when they have their lunch specials going on.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Complimentary bread
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Hot Gyoza Pot
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Porkbelly~

FWVZMpqyw9Rk-3h0sbiHPw.text: It's been a while coming back to Cherry Blossom. They seem to be remodeling the outside of the building or giving a new paint job which I think is great. I love getting their katsu-don and add extra sauce. Today we qne for something different.  Vegi-Ten Udon is great besides the soggy tempura, but I think that can be solved if I asked for them to separate it. I think having the tempura in the bowl gave it a good presentation but definitely they got soggy way too fast.  Beef Curry Udon was delicious but a bit too salty for my personal taste. It was a great idea to add a poached egg to get a creamy curry consistency.  Mixed Tempura Dinner is basically a Bento box. Delicious and crispy. The miso soup was definitely a bit too salty as well. We had leftovers in the end of our lunch.  I can't wait to try something else next time I visit. Hopefully it won't be as salty.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mixed tempura dinner, delicious!
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef Curry Udon delicious if you add a poached egg because it gets really creamy.

Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vege-ten udon noodle soup, love the clear soup base, but I think I will ask for them to separate the #tampura AP it doesn&#39;t get as soggy.

8rrXCwAObSkGPDPnl718DA.text: This one of my favorite places for ramen and bento boxes. I love their daily specials and am a bento box super fan. Bento boxes are usually pretty hefty but they really pile everything on here not at all skimping on the rice or salad. They also have large pieces of tempura - today's special included grilled salmon, shrimp tempura, a heaping salad with calamari on top, and a CA roll. Next time I will get pics!

caAazjjBeQvZAZtuHbsNYg.text: I am not a big fan of Asian foods so finding a place that I can find something to eat on the menu while Dave enjoys all the sushi, udon, seafood he can eat in a meal is quite the daunting task.  Cherry Blossom is just the place we have been searching for.   I enjoyed some spicy ramen with chicken while Dave got to have sushi and seafood udon. Perusing the menu I found more than just the ramen that I am interested in trying.  This is definitely a place we can visit again and again.

ySZmuU1hX0UzAYJeRgThYg.text: Great place! Stopped here on a whim with a friend from out of town and really enjoyed it. The food was fantastic and the service was even better! Definitely go to this place if you're in the area:)

kqwgwz5OPYbq88YPcWibEw.text: I grew up in Hawaii and lived in Japan for almost 10 years.  I have been around Japanese food pretty much my whole life.  Cherryblossom is def cherry, good tan tan men, good gyoza.  Best I have had in Phoenix so far.  Cool graffiti shop, art gallery, tattoo shop across the street too.

z05K8X9VOoyXeKC0jA7kbw.text: Thank you so much Nader for telling me about this great place.  As I mentioned in my Pie Hole review I have a list of foods I wanted to find so I could be happy living down town.  Udon was second on that list behind pie.  I ordered the Nabeyaki Udon and some random sushi roll.  The sushi wasn't memorable, the rice was a little crisper than I care for in a sushi roll.  The Udon was amazing however.  Usually when I order Udon I can't finish the whole bowl, it's always so much food.  The Nabeyaki was so good I happily enjoyed the pain from over eating.    Thanks to Cherry Blossom and the Pie Hole my list of foods I need to stay happily downtown is complete.

QNxCJF_3eBcHzkvJYeIM_g.text: This was basically the only ramen place within a 5 mile radius of our apartment so when my wife craved ramen, this was our only choice. With that said, we really liked the experience. The place is small, but well decorated. It's rather noisy and there's a lot of movement but the food was great and the service was friendly. I had the pork katsu curry and it gave me flash backs of my last trip to Japan. My wife had the ramen and loved it. The menu had some of my wife's favorite dishes (she grew up Tokyo) so we'll be returning at least a handful more times to try them all! Definitely worth a try if you want some real Japanese food.

3hY6RHvBFJ7Xd-y8g91F2Q.text: This place gets 5 stars for their entrees. No doubt about it, every meal I have ever ordered from here over the last few years has been delectable and phenomenal. The service is  also top notch. The 1 star deduction is a matter of personal taste for their desserts. They taste very fresh, but I haven't been overly enthused about the choices of flavors.    They have a fantastic happy hour menu too!  On the meal side, I would like to personally recommend any of the following treats:  California Crunchy Roll Spicy Tuna Roll Negi-Hama Roll Tekka Roll Shrimp Tempura Roll Crunch Eel Roll Dragon Roll Typhoon Roll Rainbow Roll  Arrabbiata Italian Pasta w/ Hamaguri (little neck clams) Capellini w/ Tomato and Garlic Primavera Pescatore  Ika Yakisoba Champon (the aroma from this one is nearly orgasmic) Pad Thai Korean Spicy Beef  Cha-shu Ramen Mixed Tempura Dinner ***Orange Roughy w/ Orange Sauce (I can not overstate that this is my FAVORITE of their dishes so far)*** Yakiniku  Have I mentioned that I love this place? There are still so many other items to try!

w-7yLHnNOBpIQVWXlB-Rmg.text: I had the beef udon soup lunch special. Food was ok for the price. Lunch special came with typical cali roll, and the udon soup was ok in portion, the broth is pretty flavorful.   I was not totally happy with the service my waiter provided. Not once did he stop by to ask if my food turned out ok or if I need anything else.   When I finished my meal, he asked if I wanted dessert, so I asked what they have, he pointed a few items out in the display case and walked away. I had decided to try one of them, but instead of asking what I have decided for dessert, he came back with the check.   I was turned off by his lack of service, and decided not to get the dessert and just pay and leave.  There are so many items on the menu, it was hard to pick. So, I think I will give it another try. But probably will make sure I am not seated to the same waiter again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. California roll that came with my lunch special. Pretty good size.
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef Udon Soup lunch special. Flavorful broth. Good value for the price.

z0yK8NgM6x9QaSVLjrql6g.text: Been desperately (desperately!) searching for a ramen place in Phx after discovering the deliciousness that is ramen in San Diego, and I was pleasantly surprised when I drove by the "Noodles" sign on my way to a hair appointment down the street at Shampoo Ink.  Made a mental note to stop in afterwards for lunch. I am SO glad I did!  Service was stellar - really some of the best service I've had in a LONG time.  Super friendly and attentive.  The ramen dishes were all pork per the menu, but they were nice enough to sub chicken for me instead of the pork.  DELISH!  SO good.  No veggies like the place I love in Oceanside, CA, but still, the flavor was there and it was awesome.  This will be my new lunch place EVERY time I get my hair done.

vxuhyzZAJmZJqeUrtq751g.text: I've been coming here for 20 years and they never disappoint!! My favorite is the TanTanmen ramen. It's the best and I am never disappointed. Restaurants always have their off days, compared to how many reviews this place has and how many stars? You'll get the 1 star once in awhile. So don't worry! Come on in!! Delicious authentic food!

26GVZW1b8_Gsd6SrIwbmAw.text: Wow.  Just wow.  I really enjoyed the ambiance, food, and energy of this place.  A must visit for any local or traveler alike.

BZp6Agtr_DOeZsUuYnxPQA.text: Not sure if it's the food. Lately I get a stomach upset after I leave the restaurant. Food is tasty and affordable but not sure of the quality. Have had the vongole, California rolls, happy hour specials, beef nanban and Korean beef.

Kd9ECQNLy08b5BHrllZMHg.text: I'm a long-time customer. This is of my favorite restaurants of all time. Try Baja Norte rolls, banbanji, ohitashi, ramen, udon, draft Asahi beer. There aren't many places for ramen or udon in Phoenix. Locally-owned, not too trendy.

pEnnOLGL0g2DlW-FxoY21w.text: Honestly,  I can't give a fair assessment on this restaurant because I had eaten prior to meeting friends at this restaurant.  If I am ever at Phoenix again, I will try it again.

i5gKU3kTy6q7LXX0b2unqw.text: Very rude Service. Walked in at 4:40pm. The place was totally empty. The only other customer in the place was leaving. I was then led to a small table in the back. I asked if I could move to a larger table in the front next to the wall. I was told NO! I have to sit in the back where I could smell the bathrooms. Unbelievable over 50 empty tables and I was told I have to sit there.  I then immediately walked out! Don't have to spend my $$ at a place that is so unfriendly towards it's customers.

YaHjfw0L_gh_SRInFXdPvg.text: The food is always good when I come here! I usually don't come very often unless I'm having ramen cravings, but the chashu ramen is always the way to go! So much flavor in the broth and the sushi is just as good! Usually you can tell when sushi is old or pre-made because the seaweed inside will be soggy and stringy, however I've never had a problem with that with the sushi here, it has always tasted fresh. I wish I knew the servers name who always waits on me, he's very very attentive and friendly and was always there with refills. I will always come in here whenever I'm in the area

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chashu, miso, and the Sichuan style spicy ramen with shredded pork
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rDH04d1h3RShm2x2ZTfXfQ.text: I kept reading about this amazing Thai Beef Salad, so I had to try it and went in for the first time in two years (there's a reason I haven't been back).  Let's just say that I've never had such an Americanized version of a Thai dish before. Will not order again.  Don't bother going here for anything other than low-end sushi, udon, or ramen. Seriously, I don't get the fuss about this place, unless everyone is having udon/ramen/sushi and I don't know about it....  The service is good. The ambiance is nice. The food is average.  The menu is a strange fusion combination, but I applaud their efforts at trying to meld such different cuisines (Japanese, Italian fusion).  I want to give this place three stars because I do enjoy the ambiance, but the Thai Salad was so amazingly bad and bland that I can't bring myself to add that extra star.

XhCizqxowzDCwSTLl7yzug.text: Cute interior! We came during a pretty busy time, only had to wait about 10 minutes to be seated. Unlike those others who reviewed about bad customer service, ours was great! No complaints at all. My boyfriend and I had previously decided we wanted ramen, so that's what we ended up getting (chashu ramen, for those interested), but there were so many things on the menu that sounded good! They start you with some warm bread, which was nice because we were so hungry. Our ramen came within minutes, and it was good. We really liked their chashu, and my boyfriend drank just about every drop of his soup. Basically we were in and out pretty quick, happy and full! We'll be back so I can try some of their Italian pastas!

76ju9re8GS3vQGPI15bDsw.text: Hidden gem! The food is authentic, delicious, and well priced. The staff are friendly and the environment is quirky and eclectic. Take out is good as well!

73BDUU4yD08d1XBpDP_CkA.text: I came in for lunch - when I asked the waitress about a whether something was different between the lunch and dinner menus - she snatched our menus out of our hands and said "forget it you don't know what you want get out."?!  Maybe the food is fine but obvious problems with the service.

dmoogXu9tl-WUqlxX3ry4A.text: Big sushi rolls... the place is cozy & welcoming ... they have specials... I almost want no one to know about it... keep it a secret!!  Oh and try the desserts!!

bwpuLrxwZWYn6nctkO-0mA.text: Quaint little noodle cafe that can become crowded as there is a steady flow of patrons going in. Sit at a table or the counter, which overlooks the grilling area. The menu is somewhat distinct in that it provides Asian selections as well as Italian pastas. I started with some very tasty spring rolls and went in the Italian direction for my entree. I ordered the spaghetti with olive oil and grilled chicken. Except for the bland, unseasoned chicken the dish was quite flavorful with a bit of kick provided by crushed red pepper.  The server accidently knocked my glass of water over in my direction but he cleaned it up quickly and was very embarrassed about his mistake. Overall the service was great and I expect I will return soon to try the Tempura, which comes highly recommended. I dig the wooden floors too.

67uCcLCPz2ZAkMIySJXlow.text: First time at cherry blossom cafe, the food is very good 4 stars, however my server in particular very very rude and not helpful with menu questions, took him 20 minutes to bring the bread and appetizer, we ask for a side of rice in the middle of our food, we had to ask other servers for it, he just forgot, very bad attitude, I say to those guys if you don't like your job, do something else, don't serve people

KpbXPTIonKZ1cazlWcjwQA.text: Always enjoy the food here. Portions are great, food quality is excellent.  Also, enjoy bantering with Kenny (He's the guy that sounds like Napoleon Dynamite!) I could eat here 3 times a week!! (and sometimes do!!)

Kh77ayDV2Trr3tAvHDIRnA.text: After reading the reviews, I just had to check out the Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe.  I was not disappointed...  What a crazy little place!  I went with my brother and a friend.  I had the yakisoba (noodles with vegetable and sauce), my brother had the Udon noodle soup with tofu, and his friend has the tuna.  All three were such different dishes yet were all wonderful.  We couldn't stop raving about the flavor.  Who knew noodles could be so magical or tofu so flavorful?!?  The service was actually quite wonderful.  Our waitress helped guide us to the meals we would like.  She also brought us the cool appetizer bread basket...banana bread, little cinnamon toasts, and rolls.  She also helped up each pick a desert :)  Just an odd little place, Japanese and Italian noodles in a restaurant with plenty an Eiffel Tower decoration and a bright red British phone booth???  Check it out :)

DiWPYlsOIjpPHlGApCDWYg.text: One of my all time favs!!! Its always good, but the service always lacks desire. This is one place that requires a good 2 hour serving for dinner, so be prepared. For lunch you can be out in an hour, but you will have to keep on top of the server for your check and then begg them to take payment! They slack big time in this sense, not sure why.   But the food is always fresh and very delicious, not to mention very affordable. I love the sushi, although not a big variety, they always have fresh stuff and very tasty. I have a few favorite rolls and love the penne al arrabiatta. I used to make homemade arrabiatta all the time, but haven't in years because theirs tastes soooooo yummmy! This place is great for dates, long converstaions and those who need to stretch their time together. Everything is wonderful and you will be pleasantly surprised with the beautiful decor in a strip mall..... you'll feel like you have entered another land, once you walk thru thems doors, because its so cute and quaint, not what you'd expect. Go try this place you'll love it!!!

wXO-8Z1llfWlyI8Uyypouw.text: It had been a while since I've been to Cherry Blossom, so I didn't feel good about reviewing it until I tried it again recently.  It was just as good as I remembered.  The service is a tad slow and it is pretty smoky inside, so you run the risk of smelling like garlic and wok oil all day if you eat in.  But take out is always an option.    I had a noodle soup with "mountain vegetables" and fatty udon noodles.  Mountain vegetables?  WTF?  The server didn't even know what the were but they tasted good.    Two thumbs up.

T0FSyuUY2WqpEGIxm78nGw.text: I don't know what to say.......I have only been here for lunch and I can't stop thinking about it!  I have passed this Cafe numerous times over the years and never thought to stop in.  I'm glad I did!  The staff is amazing and the food is 5 star!!  What also makes this place great is the price.  You get SOOOO much food for a steal.  I hear the happy hour is great too, hope to try it in the very near future!

pH5GWN3HwBTF90JTl1tn8A.text: My Udon Sukiyaki consisted of a fair amount of napa cabbage, lots of meat, and noodles. mmm... Proper. And of perfect proportions if you ask me.   The soup broth was thicker than I prefer... I wish we could specify the soup base like at Shin Sem Gumi in LA . Oh well. Beggars can't be choosers.   The soup was so hot I had to take a break for 5 minutes. That's a good thing though.   The ladle... I wasn't sure how to use a ladle, so I stuck with chopsticks, and slurped some soup directly from the bowl. I felt so primative, that I couldn't/ wouldn't do that again. I probably should've asked for a soup spoon..   I will try this place again very soon w/o my time constraints. I had to rush home to kill nazi zombies.   For now, b/c of the pretty satisfying food, 4 stars.  Out of 10 (10 being the best, 5 average) Decor: 7 Food: 7 Service: 7

UtHp-YPiZIgoihqcZuA7hg.text: A friend suggested this place for lunch the other day and since I had never heard of it I said sure.  We walked in and he walked us over to the bar and we sat ourselves there.  We were warmly greeted by a smiling asian lady, and given menus.  We both decided on the Cha-shu (ramen soup with BBQ Pork)  I told her that I was allergic to Sesame, and she was very responsive to my needs and immedeatly told the cooks about my allergy.  Great food...great service and she even gave me a to-go cup for my iced tea....what service....I will be going back here a lot in the future.

luEtqWYJIl47LMq-Wd4PfQ.text: This place is really cool.  The parking is plentiful and the interior is very contemporary/kawaii.  We totally expected a place similar to Spoon House in Torrence, CA but it is more Italian than Japanese atmosphere wise.  The banana bread was not as good as everyone raved to be but it was good.    We first tried the tataki and a salmon roll.  Tataki was beautifully presented on the plate and both tasted pretty good.  Hiyashi Chuka was ok...not my fav and the portion was pretty small.  Champon was full of seafood and thick noodles which was a total plus :)    The dessert...oh my, that was the best part of dinner...well, at least to me.  My bf's fav was the tiramisu.  I tried the flan and it was GREAT.  It's kinda hard to explain but it was like a mix of custard and cheesecake with a sauce that has a hint of bitterness to go with the sweet fran.  I was lucky enough to get the last piece of the night...you must try it if they have it available.  Oh and our waitress was really really nice.  She likes yelp too so we discussed how great this website is haha*  *Atmosphere = cute, lovely *Food = good.  if you like both Italian and Japanese, this place has it all. *Service = very nice.   *Price = great*  a blended drink + one appetizer + one roll + 2 entree + 2 desserts = check turned out to be around $60!

HgVJvlQRqkCoTvendWWhPg.text: Nice little surprise!  Truly enjoyed the Sushi and noodles.  The staff were also very warm and welcoming.

TjEbJuHK1VTxeJJAl_xv1A.text: This place was outrageously delicious, great service and good atmosphere.  It's the kind of place I would want to be a regular at but still have not found in San Francisco.  The food and presentation was nothing short of upscale at sweet prices.  The waiter was professional, he was at our table when we wanted something and not hanging around when we didn't.  It was candle-lit and romantic but had a relaxed atmosphere.    In fact, this is my favorite restaurant I have ever been to in my life.

WjsADxkTg-KZXTzVacR8Nw.text: I heard it was Chinese food and felt a little hesitant to check it out, being I'm not a huge fan of Chinese. But it's not just some Chinese food...Try TAICHIJAPALIAN!!!!   We were greeted by a very nice server. She was older with a short bob and way cool! We were a little loud and hyper and she totally embraced us! She started us off with some rolls and banana nut bread. Totally makes you feel like you're in a country cabin kind of restaurant. THEN, you check out the menu to see summer rolls, tuna tataki, sushi, crab wontons, and italian dishes!! You may think....eh not sure if you can pull this off Cherry. But you order whatever on the menu, and it's great! We tried A LOT of dishes and all were very good!  The green tea with milk is very yummy! Kinda like Thai tea but green tea. I don't remember what it's called but they had this fried chicken that you dipped in some soy/ mustard sauce and was fantastic!!  I'm super picky about sushi being I'm from New Orleans and am spoiled to fresh fish. ALSO! I haven't found the Crunchy roll anywhere outside of New Orleans and found it here. SO EXCITED! Definitely try the crunchy roll! Between this restaurant and Hana's sushi, I'm completely satisfied!

wqsGGNa8hluuV_9xZf2cCw.text: Ordered the pork ramen and a rainbow roll. Both were great, sushi was like every other good sushi place and pork ramen was tasty and spicey. Good service from waiter but the hostesses weren't able to keep up with everyone and forgot we were there and had us wait awhile. Other than that, experience was good and would come back.

ORPxElJ9Ui3IaUo07lWhTg.text: Hakata ramen...steal my heart with your delicious broth, nice pieces of pork, mushroom, scallion, noodles, topped with spicy pickled ginger.    Summer Roll with crab mix, rice noodle, romaine, avocado and spicy ginger peanut dressing...I love you, too.     Seafood Yakisoba with your seafood medley, veggie and tasty noodles, my husband says "hello".

KISwkoCMY5OCtrpLqAo3WQ.text: This is my first time here for lunch. I am a little disappointed at the Alaskan roll here. I think Kabuki has really good sushi. But I really like the Cha Shu Ramen here compare to Kabuki. The soup of the ramen tastes delicious, creamy, and you just want to finish drinking the whole bowl of the soup.   The waiters here are fantastic and they are really friendly. One of the waiters recommended me white wines with a patience and kind face. She knows a lot of about wines.   Love this place! Definitely come back for the ramen! For the ramen soup!

e05vPD2WqK0NhfOtyqMc0g.text: The place is setup very nicely and has a nice ambiance.  The hakata ramen is fantastic.  It is extremely flavorful.  The only issue and why I only gave it 4 stars has to do with quantity.  I found the amount of noodles in the bowl to be a bit on the small side.  The bowl was pretty cheap but if that's all you get I wish they would have some option to add a couple bucks to get more noodles.  Other than that, no complaints.  Service was great.  Food was delicious.

vXVrJcwIxSgbV1eBWTWUdg.text: I wish I could give this place more stars because the food is delicious, but the service is terrible!  I brought several people to this establishment to have lunch or dinner  over the last few months and the service is typically a 5. Never once has the server been attentive! One time, on a late business lunch, we watched our server sit at a few tables away and completely ignore our stares for the check. We literally waited half an hour as she chatted with other patrons. It was quite annoying to say the least, tips are earned not required! I mean come on! To this day she eyes me down when I come in for pick-up.  The Chicken Katsu is the best item on the menu! I would definitely order take-out, at least you can rely on that service. Very nice lady at the front!

9P8-9EUP-aEnuisqUYt5jQ.text: Yes!  This place was soooo good.  Several veggie options... delicious Yakisoba.  I'm looking forward to trying out their sister-restaurant, Eastwind.  Went on a Saturday night and it was VERY busy.  I can't wait to go back, just not during peak hours.

geUSL25rtK3GLbNrhwxcrw.text: Best authentic Japanese restaurant in town for udon and katsu! Does not get better than this in Arizona!

x0tmiY8LZJmwISomZnpgXA.text: Food is hit or miss, but always packed and crowded. I've had the smoked salmon ramen and the udon stir fry. Neither were very good. Ramen was too salty and the udon was bland. The calamari salad is good after the first few bites, but the pieces of squid are huge and overly battered. The portion is huge, but you are left not wanting to eat the entire thing. The little scallop pasta appetizer was pretty good, and so is the bread they served complimentary when you are there at dinner (not happy hour). The sushi is about par with the grocery stores. Desserts look good in the dessert case, but I've never tried any. My biggest gripe is the terribly slow service! I've been there twice. Once on a Saturday around 3:30pm, once on a Friday night at 5:30pm. Both times, it took over 40-45 minutes to get our food. The last time I went, which will also be the last time I go, we waited close to 45 minutes and when I inquired with a waiter, he threw his hands up and in a joking tone,and said "it's happy hour, there's always a wait." He didn't bother to check on the status of our food. His attitude was, "Hey, we've got more business than we can handle...suck it up!"  If you have time to wait for mediocre food -- be my guest!

2dLHhzrCAz1vbsh7kbjHsQ.text: I had avoided this place for a while because, on the outside, it seems like a (probably terrible) teriyaki joint. Maybe it's the sign. Wow, was I wrong.  The interior is homey, and comes off as a cross between a sushi bar and an italian bistro in terms of decor.  The first thing I ordered was the Nabeyaki Udon (in the iron pot), and I was blown away. The noodles they use are excellent, and they make their own broth (which, I was told, was simmered with seaweed--it certainly was addictive and delicious!) Since then I have been back many times, and the quality remains consistent.   I've also never had a problem with the wait staff, and one japanese lady whose name escapes me is a total sweetheart. She accidentally brought me "the big boss's" pint glass instead of the standard happy hour $2.80 glass, and apologized (I did get to keep it, so I'm not sure why!).  Their sushi is mediocre, but far from terrible. I suggest trying some of the more difficult to find items on their menu, like their delicious udon or (my favorite) the Kake Soba (buckwheat noodles in broth with spinach and spring onions).  The italian stuff scares me a little bit, although I'm sure it's fine. Maybe I'll try it some day. Itadakimasu!

kRXDXFtUfnZtR80iqPipLw.text: Wonderful place! If you come around 4:30/5 you shouldn't have trouble finding a table. All the desserts are excellent. I don't have anything bad to say!

i8PrlFQNDXDGp8BGPGK2lA.text: **WARNING: REVIEW PARTIALLY BASED ON BITTER GIRL SYNDROME** (you've been warned)  See, I don't really like this place.  Ok, maybe it's because the meal was planned around a gruesome and undue breakup, during which I cried into my soup and everything became tasteless, but THAT IS NOT MY FAULT. It's not my fault I can be simply too awesome for some to comprehend.  Moving on.  I tried it again sans ridiculous relationship errors (that's you, Isaac*!) and I, quite frankly, remain unimpressed. The pad thai is eh, and the soup I revisited was simply as bland as I remember, but without the enduring emotional frustration this time.  *names have been changed to protect your stupid identity. Maybe not. Haha.

3nPhioBBGaLKCBVK5h9IXg.text: Loved the feel of this place. I had Suki Udon and was blown away! So good and so much food. My son had a just OK pasta dish and spent most of the time eating my soup. Even with both of us chowing down, we still took some leftovers home. The dumplings were good, but not great. We'll be back for sure to try more dishes. A!

oe4KDuERWYBGnbDIuDj_eQ.text: Love this place! Definitely get one of their amazing soups! The Korean beef is also a great dish here.

qHCqD2rIiIQ9BK8wfTjVvg.text: This place was pretty interesting. I never thought of japanese and italian being a fusion combo, but here it is.   The italian food was different, but not worth it. My fiance ordered the TanTan-Men and Gyoza and wow, you definitely get what you paid for. So much food and large pot of ramen. The prices are reasonable, approx $10 per person, maybe a little more if you order drinks and/or dessert.

sqhYTL__-JYcwqxr44zkBw.text: *Sigh* Sushi makes me happy! Did you know?! It TOTALLY does!   Me and the queens made plans to have dinner somewhere - you know... like normal civilized people. All we knew was that I wanted sushi and that we wanted something awesome! After looking around on Yelp I chose to take the queens to CBNC...   "So where is this place?" "ummm... between 7th street & 10th street off of Camel" "Okaaay? The left or right side of the road?" "I unno" "What do you MEAN you don't know? Haven't you been here before?!" "Ummm... no." "oh HELL to the no!" *the car then becomes filled with laughter*  We passed right by it and then flipped a bitch out of no where and it made us fear for our lives! and then screams filled the car. Soon we were parked infront of a soon to be Domino's Pizza and headed to the cafe of my lil yelp dreams... Only to be met with a 20 minute wait. We were then outside and I was left to fight off the queens who seriously considered going to Tokyo express instead! And then FINALLY our names were called and we were seated.  Our waitress was very nice. I want to say that it's the little touches that make CBNC great. The fresh  thick lemon wedge and fresh sprig of mint in the water pitchers. The way the servers are so friendly. She even complimented on my Japanese pronunciation! :) I didn't want to tell her the origin of my great accent...  watching Kill Bill a thousand times.   She helped us order sushi. I wanted nigiri and they didn't have it. I was disappointed but still went with her suggested crispy rolls and alaskan rolls. They were AMAZING! I loved the crunch and the flavor. With the soy sauce was scrumptious. We wanted to cancel our orders and just get more sushi! The alaskan was great as well. I loved it. Even the queen who never had sushi before liked it.   After devouring the sushi our food came. I ordered the beef soba noodle soup with tempura. It came with chicken instead. (boo!) but the tempura was perfect! (yay!) and I never had soba noodles, I usually get udon or chinese noodles. but I really liked the flavor and the fresh spniach that was wilting more and more as time went on. The slight flavor of the sliced green onions really made the dish something special. I loved it. I am just so sad that I couldn't finish it all! :(  One queen devoured the beef yakisoba noodles at once! I was able to sneak my chopsticks inbetween his bites and I got a taste. it was CRAZY yummy! each of the veggies had a great difinitive flavor and yet melded together amazingly. I loved it.   The other queen was pleasantly surprised at the taste of his Spicy beef rice plate. He couldn't finish his eaither but it was really. A lil too spicy for my tastes, but it was still awesome.   We then ordered a bottle of wine and a sip here and a sip there and we were all in heaven! Talking to our waitress about the Navajo sushi chef behind the sushi bar who she was trying to hook up with one of us... but we couldn't tell WHO she was trying to hook him up with! One of the queens or me?! Said chef never made it to our table - and it's just as well... we were in food heaven savoring our delights and wishing we had bigger stomachs to take it all in! I'm a big fan of this place now and am VOWING to take several people with me next time! :)

ExOPfYpgoCjZ_RUvLFKNTg.text: Fantastic ramen and awsome service!  Will be going back for sure!

ooaA2bbyPliLIiiqXPEuKg.text: I was fooled.  The unassuming strip mall exterior and the fact that it shares a wall partition with a blech sister restaurant (Tokyo Express) had me fooled.  Even the overwhelmingly positive reviews didn't inspire me to go.  But make no mistake, this place is fantastic.   I am embarrassed to say that I only ended up here because Lola and Padres (Oregano's was too long of a wait) were both closed on Sunday night -- and I pass by this place all the time.  Really good noodles and pasta done Asian Fusion style and totally cheap.  The noodle dishes here are eight or nine dollars and have huge portions.  I ordered the haruki yakisoba noodle stirfry with pork and shrimp - which came to me in a large bowl and steaming with soy and ginger flavors.  The Korean spicy noodle bowl also outdid itself with sliced beef strips and a wonderfully hot hot hot taste.  If that's not your thang, they have rice bowls, sushi, salads, about 20 Italian/Med dishes and several vegetarian and tofu dishes.  You'll find that they have an open kitchen so if you're close to it you can spy and  salivate over everyone else's food.  The servers were all very prompt and courteous after a slow start.  A solo diner next to us was raving about the place and how much he loves it.   My favorite part of the food was definitely the complimentary cinammon bread crisps and bread basket that came with BANANA BREAD?!?  Wtf, whew, that came out of left field.  An awesome and delicious surprise that was.  They had a small wine list that was half off for that night -- as a nightly special.  Did you hear that?  HALF OFF!!  All the sudden that $30 bottle of pinot looked pretty damn good.  So for $15 we had four glasses of wine on the cheap.  The owners know the one way to my heart -- wine specials!!  Yes, it's official.  I'm easy.  When I got the tab did I realize that dinner here (with the wine) was CHEAPER than breakfast earlier that day at Orange Table.  Only then, did everything in life make sense.  Lesson:  Sketchy looking strip mall restaurant does not equal dump.   P.S.  The tiny parking lot gets crowded very quickly and street parking with Oregano's next door can be problematic.

ryS3vV3k2hu7JbymNV6M_A.text: it is our first time here, I was amazed! the food is soooo good! we had California rolls, tempera shrimp rolls, katatu ramen, and katuzi chicken curry, everything is delicious! we will definitely go there again.

M965_MIIJqzFw7uNja3TCQ.text: I've gone here around 10 times in the last 2 years, and it is so consistently good and reasonable. Great for groups or just a party of two. Although waiter service needs improvement hence the 4 stars, that is the one thing that is inconsistent.  What I love: Green Tea's Happy Hour Deals Awesome Banana Bread Udon Sukiyaki Soup when your feeling sick Pescatore if your feeling italian Curry dish w/ Chicken

T4iRW2zWkW5aeEBFxV5iuQ.text: This place was awesome! We ordered 5 different things and loved them all except one! Great atmosphere, awesome service and friendly people. We had the hot pot, lettuce wraps, some short ribs (dont remember the dish title) ramen and marsala (this is the one we didnt care for) Interesting unique flavors. Also, very inexpensive! We ate like kings and only spent about $30

9c9Z2HGRTCuUUuC6y-23uQ.text: I'm confused! We went for the sushi and ramen, however, the people next to us were having spaghetti and italian! Needless to say, they have a wide variety menu.  The sushi was ok and the ramen was decent.  It was just weird to get served warm rolls and butter before my spicy tuna roll came out.  I've had better sushi and ramen (not in Phoenix yet but this was my first shot) in so cal so I'll have to update when I venture to another sushi place in town.  Service was good.

LcMlgx8KLSS00a4ZneLpPg.text: I love good ramen.  I fell in love with ramen at Santouka Ramen in San Diego and Los Angeles.  When I heard about Cherry Blossom I was hoping to finally have a place to go to in Phoenix that would give me my ramen fix without having to drive to California.  My wife and I visited Cherry Blossom and I was disappointed in their lack of selection for ramen.  Cherry Blossom serves asian dishes of all sorts and even Italian dishes.  It is a very odd concept to me but it all revolves around noodles.  They have five choices for ramen.  I'm used to getting pork miso ramen at other ramen houses.  Cherry Blossom didn't exactly have that. They had miso ramen with salmon slices.  I relented and got the miso ramen with salmon slices.  When I was served I was immediately encouraged by the color of the broth which was a light brown and not transparent, just as it should be.  I could tell there was less oil in this ramen broth than at Santouka.  The broth was pretty good, but a hair on the salty side.  Don't get me wrong, I expect the broth to be very high in sodium and cause me to gain several pounds of water weight, but this was saltier than I am used to.  The fish was done properly but I hadn't looked forward to that as much as the noodles.  The noodles weren't bad.  The noodles were good but not quite the quality as places I visited in California and Las Vegas.  I expected to have more vegetables and/or seaweed in the dish.  Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed my dish and it was priced appropriately at $8.60 plus tax, but it didn't wow me.  If you compare Cherry Blossom to Republic Ramen in Tempe, AZ, Cherry Blossom wins hands down.  The noodles and broth have so much going on and is far superior to Republic Ramen.        Cherry Blossom has Japanese beer on tap and good house saki.  Both were reasonably priced.  The cocktail recipes didn't appeal to me at all.  I have been to Japanese bars before and they had some complex recipes that showed allot of thought and passion for bar tending at those other places but these Cherry Blossom recipes looked uninspired and like they were written by someone that wasn't used to making cocktails professionally.          All in all, I would go to Cherry Blossom if it is near you or if you are just dying to get your ramen fix and you don't have a lot of options living in Phoenix but I prefer other ramen houses I have been to in Vegas and California much more than Cherry Blossom.

Y7ERTBZXO85XdnUf1RI-Cg.text: Coming from LA where you could throw a penny and hit at least 10 different great Asian restaurants, Phoenix is the complete opposite. With little options for a great dining experience with delicious food, it's great that this place exists. Traditional Japanese ramen, Yakisoba and udon dishes. Great sushi rolls and more. And if Japanese is not your thing, then try their Italian dishes. This is a noodle shop, so of course you can't leave out Italian dishes. Their customer service is excellent too!

1WE2j-75tsod4LoRFNgSbw.text: Cute place in a plaza. The bread sampler is cool. : )  I had the udon + tasted my friend's ramen. It was really GOOD! I like the homey feel of the place.

uvL6umSf33RvgMyoAeJVLA.text: We probably should not have waited as long as we did, for what we were served.   It's not bad, I guess... if you feel it is adventurous to try flavors fused with one another. I'm down with the fusion, only if it's done tastefully. I mean, after all, you are there for the taste.   Seared tuna... was far from seared. They just let the flimsy slivers of tuna saturate in the acid for a bit to give it a seared look. But uh, it was missing the crisp in the sear, and all I could taste was the acidity and pepper sprinkled on top.  Takoyaki... supposedly had some octopus bits in it. Luckily, I found 1/4 of a tentacle in these things. However, this was sabotaged by the sauce these little balls were drowning in. Too much basil in the hoisin or something.  The caterpillar... haha. Cute, but was searching for some significant pieces of eel in here. Sushi rice was a bit soggy too.   Ebi-ten, basically udon/soba (opted udon) with two shrimp tempura, was okay. I've whipped this up myself before, so...  Wow, unfortunately not very memorable. Good job, presentation... but not so much a sensation.

vq2eSB_fZY8UfwzsrtZMyA.text: I'm thinking that the normal staff was off yesterday.   I went to Cherry Blossom with very high hopes thanks all the positive yelp reports and was very disappointed. This onetime experience won't stop me from coming back to give the Cafe another chance...as I think I might have been transported to a parallel universe for this meal.   First off... cute little place, there is no doubt that this is not a chain. The interior of the restaurant is simple and looks more like your dining at an authentic Asian bistro in Vancouver rather then in a central Phoenix strip mall. Our server was a little slow getting to us, again, this is not a chain, so that was overlooked.   I ordered a Summer Roll (per menu - Shrimp, lettuce, avocado, cucumber and rice noodles) and a Shrimp tempera roll. When the orders arrived the summer roll looked great, but was stuffed with a "bonus" of that weird crab lookalike stuff made from fish heads and fins.. YUK! Not a problem, I'll just scoop it out onto the appetizer plate...   so when I counted, the Summer roll with shrimp, did have shrimp.. 2 of them, and I kid you not, 1/2 cup of that crab stuff.   When my "shrimp" tempura roll arrived, guess what?? its a fake crab tempura roll with one shrimp... lol... The rice...VERY sticky... By the time the meal was over, my app plate was mounded with about a cup of this crab scented stuff... such a waste...   My friend's pasta ( Marsala Chicken) was great... the chicken was all breast meat, with a really good Marsala sauce...it was impressive! ... So overall... weird experience... will it keep me away??... no, well not unless it happens again...  The strangest thing about this whole ordeal is the fact  the main ingredient of my appetizer and sushi roll was not even on the menu.

V4SYAfY4VCDTwBTcApGvpA.text: This is nothing disparaging about the food. The food is quite tasty and exceptional. However, the service was less than stellar. I waited 10 minutes for my dessert and another 15-20 for my check, and my water was not refilled once. It was impossible to get anyone's attention to get service which is enough to put me off and not want to come back. Personally, I don't pay good money to wait on a server, I pay to get waited on. That may make me a snot but it's what I expect when I go to a restaurant.

TbRN8-07C7tQvB-wt00odA.text: I came with a friend on a weekday lunch hour. The restaurant is pretty small but a nice space. I decided to try the daily lunch box special, which was NY strip, 4 piece California roll, salad with ginger dressing, rice, tempura and an orange sliced all fancy. I thought everything tasted good except there was 1 item in the tempura that I wasn't sure what it was and it was really hard to bite so I decided to skip eating it. The meal also came with miso soup and bread.  The only complaint with this restaurant is our server wasn't that great and overall service was really slow. If you're on an hour lunch break from work, this place probably isn't the best unless you work around the corner.   Otherwise, I would totally come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Daily lunch special box

ti0fiCuoWf4TLAN9MoN21A.text: Currently waiting for my check and I just had to leave a review for the great service and food I received from my waitress Alexandra. I was craving udon soup. I usually go to take-out place to get my udon fix, but they weren't open. So I decided to come to Cherry Blossom by myself and sit in. Thankfully I did, because I was greeted by Alexandra's kind heart and warm smile. Her gentle soul made me feel comfortable and welcomed. Thank you Alexandra!  As for the food, I asked for the udon soup and veggie tempura for my vegan cravings. It was exactly what I wanted, made perfectly and hit the spot.  Thank Cherry Blossom!

SN6TIeTW5G8GDaJC2lFiaw.text: This is the place for the best ramen. I always order the hakata. If you go for lunch, check out their lunch specials. Such a gem!

sedz6Zh-EcVIyj8kZH3p3w.text: Have been wanting to try this place out for a while and finally got to. Was not sure what to expect but absolutely happy with my experience. We will be back again and again to try something new! Price is very reasonable and we had four people. Place is limited in seating but worth the wait and super cute!!

qMg11m2oWTwwrQH24X-0uA.text: My 300th review!  I had been to Cherryblossom a few times many years ago and enjoyed it but it was never really in my path so I hadn't gone back. Today I got the chance to go again and it was as good if not better than I remember. I have been trying to take it easy on carbs so noodles aren't generally the smartest idea. I also tend to go for Asian noodles when I'm out since I'm so picky about Italian anyplace but home. I saw on the menu that they offered low-carb tofu noodles and got it with the chicken parmesan. Also tasted some of the ramen and had some calamari. Everything was excellent including our server and it really hit the spot after going a while without any kind of pasta/noodle. I think I'll start making them a more regular stop.

flBsxs_QDrjhHfJLwf9uXQ.text: Cherryblossom is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in AZ. I've been coming here for years and have stuck to my "usual" dishes :) I often crave the Beef Udon Sukiyaki! It is AMAZING. I do not know how else to describe it. The broth is so flavorful, the egg adds the perfect touch, and you can't go wrong with udon noodles. Another go-to dish would have to be the Tan Tan Men and Cha Sieu Ramen. Hands down delicious. I miss the cinnamon toast bread that used to come in the baskets, but their regular bread is like a warm pillow. That's the best way to describe it. The chicken katsu is another winner as well. Each time I come I always have to add at least one sushi roll to compliment my meal and satisfy all of my cravings. I miss living down the street from here! Small spot but definitely worth the wait, everyone :)

cg7CRWjPf0uuYVYP4IFGaQ.text: We have been coming here for over a decade.  Consistently great food and good service. Big fans of the udon noodles. Usually a line later in the evening, Looking around you will notice a large Japanese clientele. Seems to be a good sign.

MCnebrh2noh_4lwuOaCCgQ.text: Been to cherry blossom more times than I can count and it's always excellent food and service. Josh is the man.   I always tell everyone that Its some of the best sushi, saki clams, gyosa pot, ramen and Italian noodle dishes. No one believes me till we take them and then their hooked. Trust me, it's worth a try.   My go to is the tan tan men or the chashu. The hot pot is great as well or the Katsu bowl.   The girlfriend loves their chicken Marsala and the chicken park is good too.   If you want rolls you have to get there early but they are great. Plus their wine is great as well as their saki.   Cherry blossom is one of the best kept secrets in Arizona and can't go wrong no matter what you get.

7PKnkUW56i5F1ficWe8opQ.text: Why do people come here for such bad service? It is such a mystery to me.  It is always the same bad service. Yes, the food is good but the service is just awful. You would think they would get it together by now. Weird they place is always packed maybe people do not care that they are treated so badly? I have eaten here many times and it is always the same. I think I'm done with this place.   Update for 12/31/15 and 1/1/16  Early in day NYE Me- on Phone- "Hi are you open tomorrow on the holiday? I have out of town guests who want to revisit your place." Man who answered phone- I don't know. ( really?) hold on (Does not put me on hold and screams in my ear and across the restaurant apparently to get an answer) " Yes, we are open." Dead air space continues.  Me- "Ummmm, are you sure? What time?" Man- Repeat of above scene. By now I am deaf and wanting to drive down to show him where the hold button is located on a phone set.   Me- "Anything special going on?" Man- No. End call.   I call back and reconfirm they are open. Nothing is said about needing a reservation or a special menu either time.   Fast forward to 10pm-strangely my phone rings and the number is not one I recognize. i call back and it is Noodle Cafe   Me- Umm you called me? Are you calling to tell me you are closed. ( I never left my phone number. I thought maybe they were just using Caller Id. )  Lady- No, who is this? Me- Well someone called and I was just wanting to make sure you are still open tomorrow. lady- I can't imagine who would have called you. ( three seconds later) Me- in my mind I am thinking it is probably a phone glitch." Are you calling me back from your Caller Ids from the day?  Lady- No, do you have a reservation for tomorrow? Is that why you are calling?  Me- Sighs loudly. "No you called me. Do I need a reservation for tomorrow? I have never had one here before and we are coming in around noon.   Lady- No Me- Are you sure you are open? ( Skeptical) lady -Yes see you tomorrow.   Okay, you see where this is going right? Fast forward to New Year's Day. I enter the restaurant and see a sign for their special menu.  Ummm, what special menu?  Me- Hi we are a party of five for noon. I am a bit early. May you put down my name?  Lady- Do you have a reservation Me- No Lady- Sorry we are having a New Year's special and you need a reservation.   I am a most forgiving person with these things but every single time i visit this eatery there is an issue.  When everyone arrived We left and went to Grassroots, which was fabulous by the way! I will not be returning any time soon to Noodle Cafe, if at all.

9EVKiBMYZ2hMPdi51rW8EA.text: Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe came highly recommended by several Yelp friends, so maybe my expectations were too high or I ordered the wrong thing. Nonetheless, I left not all that impressed with the food.   The service was good and the restaurant was clean. I just wouldn't drive across town in Phoenix to visit again.   The vegetable tempura was not all that tasty, and some pieces were over fried leaving them hard and crunchy rather than light and crispy. Sadly, the sauce for the tempura was also flavorless.   I had the Grilled Tuna over Rice which came with a side salad and miso soup. I ate the soup and salad, took one bite of the tuna and left the tuna and rice behind. I love taking home leftovers so you know it was a sad dining experience when I leave a whole plate of food behind!  Oh, well! I had a fun time at the restaurant with some of my favorite Yelpers and got to meet Nadine who was visiting all the way from Hawaii.   I suggest trying some of the other offerings at the restaurant. I think the mixed reviews for the restaurant has to do with the mixed quality in the dishes. Hopefully the restaurant will revamp some of their dishes so we all leave happy. :)

9IryA5nibThiGtSaNPCNIw.text: Decided to see what "Japanese, Italian, Asian Fusion" was all about, and my summary is as follows:  It's an asian restaurant that also serves pasta.   Our group of friends ordered various items:  Miso Ramen: This was probably the best dish out of everything, but not up to bay area ramen standards  Yakiniku: This was the most disappointing dish of the night. Dry pieces of beef sauteed with some veggies. Meh at best.  Korean Spicy beef with noodles: If you've ever had Mongolian beef with noodles from a mall food court, you get this Korean Spicy Beef dish.  I must say, however, that the waitstaff was very attentive and got our food fairly quickly, so +1 to them for that. Otherwise, this place is all hype.

CBbVu5wiRuGnIFJS3tmlhQ.text: I travel 30 miles to eat here the food is excellent and the service is great . The dumplings are amazing

gOVMQCyCqEYsuzsVROnVvA.text: Delicious! The location is very cute and cozy. Service was great. I went around New Years and was seated very promptly. Was happy with the experience, will definitely be back!

q0PT3242dbYmn2HWoEBsVw.text: Can't even tell you how much we love this place! What a gem of a find!!! Josh - our waiter...the best.  Service was outstanding.  Food...superb.  Atmosphere...busy, eclectic, Asian industrial decor. Cool and comfy.  We ordered the Shrimp Tempura Udon Soup with high hopes and we were not disappointed.  Udon noodles (with just the right chew) in a beautiful broth with spinach and green onions and 3 pieces of shrimp tempura.  Some of the best crunchy California rolls we've ever eaten.  And a little surprise treat of banana bread to finish our meal. The complete yum.  Happy to say we are new regulars here.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. First timers. Very, very busy.  Really looking forward to trying this food.

pbZBa3Cr8_Lj66OcizT5OA.text: Best ramen I've ever had! Every time we go, there is a wait but it's so worth it! The service staff is always welcoming and accomadating. The sushi is also excellent.

7IJqQplKHtTQPixtWkjQsw.text: This restaurant has great ambiance very friendly staff and of course delicious food. Had the korean spicy noodles and they were amazing. Prices are average and the food quality is excellent! Definitely a must try.

48GO-f6oukRIvx3l5K83hQ.text: Cosy setting, value for money, Tanaka ramen was delicious. And who doesn't love complimentary salad ? Server was so sweet. Must go for a casual evening.

FtJ8d8E6HTu0x1dkpeU1dA.text: I'm not too familiar the a variety of noodles so I wanted to try something new. I personally did not enjoy what I ordered but it could  be that it's just not for me rather than a reflection of the quality of food. Since I did not enjoy it, I just pushed my noodles to the side while I enjoyed some of my boyfriends salad that had fried shrimp and mango chutney. The server was soooo amazing. I believe his name was Andrew. He took his time explaining every little thing to me. When he noticed I didn't eat my food he took it off the bill without me asking. I thought that was so sweet on honorable so that's why I'm giving them 4 stars all together.

oRlyPSgSxmXfTOW59xifAA.text: With 900+ reviews and four stars, you can't go wrong. Quite possibly the best Japanese restaurant in Arizona. This is my second time here to try out the Shoyu Raman. It was very good and very traditional. If you are a ramen fan, this place is a must. Also their appetizers are devilish and good. The pork belly are like drugs, don't try them because you can get hooked.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shoyu ramen

mxS6asLfoHHMHG4ntauYfg.text: Tried their char su ramen!!Love it sooooo much!!!And it's  under 10 bucks! Let me tell you! It's way batter than a lot of ramen palces in Seattle, and that will cost you  15 bucks per bowl(tips and tax not included :/).  Also, the beef curry udon is great, great  curry flavor and the broth is fantastic!

jTMXRN0_XKInts37wU_m9Q.text: Yes, I would love to come back in this place. And why not? Their food are just exceptionally delicious. I've been to different places that serves ramen and sushi and this one serves delicious one too! I ordered their shoyu ramen with california crunchy roll and green tea milk as my drink.  All were served timely, I just waited a little to 5 minutes for the sushi and ramen to be served. I personally don't have any idea how the ramen is made but this one that thick deliciously flavored broth that according to my research, having that delicious broth you must simmer the pork/beef bones for hours to get the flavor that you wanted. And you must also have the correct ingredients so that you can have the best result you wanted. My sushi was also freshly made and tasted heavenly flavorful. I am well filled during the visit and I am sure to be back here and gain more weight. Thumbs up.

uPjIuPhr4UfWcwFBLgiUcw.text: This place is a little restaurant that sells ramen, pasta, other entrees and dessert. I went in for a simple dinner with my boyfriend and we ordered the cha-shu (ramen with bbq pork), yakiniku (korean sliced beef), and crispy calamari with wasabi mayo sauce.   I've been to a lot of ramen restaurants, and for a lot of them, I wasn't really too impressed. With Cherryblossom, they have the right saltiness in their broth that wouldn't really warrant me to drink two glasses of water after eating it.  As for the korean beef, it was pretty good as well! For the price though, I don't think the serving was that much. Lastly, the calamari was one of my favorites. The wasabi mayo was a great touch!   Their employees are super friendly too, so that was definitely a plus!

Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. yakiniku
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. calamari

O0EDMzaYXeoP4eO5wcA8vg.text: We found the great restaurant hidden in a strip mall We live in Sedona and every time we travel to Phoenix we make sure to stop in for the great food Good prices Fast service Fresh food Great service again and again Great job  Thank you

4sxI9b2vIrRlaGzTwhimlg.text: Noodles were good enough. Nothing special. But we really like their set of sushi. It was $16 something but it had a variety of different sushi. It was delicious. CKDry1h9C75znUM9-5rFlg.text: Definitely have to give a review after being so excited about their amazing bowls ! I'd been looking all over for a good rice bowl after another favorite place closed and so many places had either bland or dried out meat . The Katsu-don rice bowl here is delicious !! It has some tender pork , steamed egg , onions , and some kind of delicious sauce . Seriously have ordered it as take out weekly since my first experience ! Have tried a few other things like their yakisoba and a few sushi rolls but still loving this bowl the most !!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Katsu-don bowl togo, deliciousness!!

Q0bW5YnlXsnDumFB4O9yrQ.text: Came here with a friend as we took a last minute trip to AZ and discovered one of the best hidden little restaurants in Phoenix!   Primavera Pasta: Japanese-style Italian pasta is definitely a league of its own. They cook it in a way where the starchiness of the noodles help to enhance the entire dish, and each bite is full of flavor. This was a great vegetarian dish with various vegetables (eggplant, tomatoes, onions, and bellpeppers), and while a lot of vegetarian dishes fall flat on flavor, this definitely does not! Highly recommend this!  Hot Sansai Udon: Solid Udon with your classic sansai veggies. The udon noodles are from vacuumed sealed udon noodles, but the broth was flavorful with a generous amount of veggies. For a udon place in Phoenix, AZ, I didn't think I would fine sansai udon, and I am pleased.

VMhbRpeNUPziIvvkSNVSPw.text: With all the hype surrounding Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe, maybe I went in with unrealistic expectations and well, it fell flat. We waited about 25 minutes for a table and in the cramped little restaurant, constantly felt in the way of the hustle and bustle of the restaurant. The food looked good, and the menu was varied - you have ramen, udon, rice, and even pasta but when it came down to it, it was just okay.  The service was alright, the space a little cramped, and the food, just alright. I had the beef curry udon which I had hoped was udon in curry but it was udon, in broth, with a scoop of beef curry up top. When you're expecting a thick bowl of curry, this was rather underwhelming. The tantan men was spicy, which was what I was hoping for, but the noodles weren't anything special, a little reminiscent of my college staple - cup ramen. We even ordered the pork belly appetizer, which was just five little pieces, not quite melt in your mouth or tasty, as I had hoped.  With thousands of reviews and a 4.5 star rating, maybe I'm way off base, walking in with unrealistic expectations but I don't think I'll be stopping by here of my own accord anytime soon. Maybe you'll have better luck than I did.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef curry udon - I was expecting a full curry broth but it was normal broth with a scoop of beef curry
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tantan men - spicy noodle broth with minced pork

yDQq_5Pkpow-BSBLcxRGiQ.text: This review has long been forthcoming.  We've eaten at Cherryblossom countless times now, but neglected to post a review of this marvelous place.  Tucked in a small strip mall, just east of 7th street on Camelback Road, is this gem of an eatery.  It bills itself as featuring mouth-watering dishes from all over the world. That's a bit of a stretch, but their current offerings are wonderful.  During this particular visit, my wife had the Pork Katsudon.  I had the Chasu with Egg.  Both dishes were a marvel to the eyes, and even better to our palates. The flavors were distinctive, but not too overwhelmingly spicy. Too much spice can often be used to mask the inherent lack of True flavor of the dish or the meats. Not so here at Cherryblossom.  The Miso soup was the only underwhelming aspect of our current visit. It was about as bland as I could've gotten next door at Tokyo Express.  We like the decor of this place. It's cozy, comfortable, inviting, and the lighting is subdued, but not too dark.   The spacing between tables are a little bit tight, and loud conversationalists can easily overwhelm your own quiet conversation. However, this should not detract from the overall experience of this establishment.

cN-h_Zb6DpRJUoyaMGHxYA.text: This a decent place in Phoenix for Japanese cuisine. The menu is a mix of Japanese and Italian options.   The service here can be hit or miss. The staff is friendly but they can be a bit slow. We waited almost 20 minutes for the check before we decided to just walk up to the cashier. The restaurant can be busy at times so it's understandable.   We ordered the vege-ten udon, beef curry udon, and mixed tempura dinner. Both udon bowls were delicious with generous portions. The tempura dinner was served with miso soup which was a bit on the salty side. The tempura itself was great; again the portions are very big . I enjoyed the tempura dinner and would order it again.   Overall We had a pleasant experience here. The food was great. Hopefully next time the service  will be better. I would recommend checking this place out when it's not as packed.

wTaeDfHV9hg7jmg-mmy1QA.text: It's been a few years since I've eaten here and I was excited to try again based on the good reviews.  The restaurant had a nice ambiance of Japan and Europe combine.  They had a good selection on their menu and their lunch combos were a good deal.  Our server was not very nice and the food took forever to come out.  I got the ramen combo with California rolls for $11.  The ramen was a good portion but very bland.  The California rolls were decent.  Overall, it was still a good deal.  My husband has the beef udon bowl for $11 and that bowl was so tiny and bland.  Definitely not worth it.  I guess we won't be back for another while.

rqB49x_B7wKxepRJpua79g.text: I can only rate Cherryblossom on the quality of my take-out. Decent spicy salmon roll and gyoza. I would definitely return to dine in as it feels like a cozy and friendly place. Prices were reasonable, too.

Pch5rZDp9ehCWgO6jGpu7g.text: Came here for my husband's birthday dinner. I thought it was just ok. The flavors are really good but the udon noodle dish I had was so off-putting. The noodles were slimy because of the amount of oil they used in the dish. But everyone else liked their dish. Since the restaurant is a drive and there are so many other options in the area, probably won't be back

dZcrxKWu2yTxgsVKAR8-4A.text: Okay seriously I have to say this is my most favorite restaurant ever. EVER! Everything is perfect. The prices are amazing for what you get and the food is amazing. We had the Nigiri assortment and beef soup. Tempura shrimp as appetizer. It's my second time here and love this place. The service is awesome and the ambiance is my favorite part. Love love love this place. Definitely my favorite of all!!!

leP2afyUwf0M45HgwcloTw.text: Original review 6/10/2013 was 2 stars Today 7/14/2017 I'm editing and making it five stars.  Yes. the customer service was bad, but I'm willing to go back for the food.   The truth is that it is amazing they take the time to make something that is traditional and time-consuming. True ramen is not the crunchy stuff in the plastic rapper and the real thing is found in only a few places in the valley.  I have made TONKATSU ramen and the egg based ramen noodles from scratch myself many times. I have also gone out of my way to try ramen from any place I could find it.   I went back to Cherryblossom again and again because I think their ramen is the only one which tastes authentic and is priced very well for the large bowl you recieve. I even told them my family member needed gluten free and the accommodated us by using their tasty broth with flat rice noodles as a substitute. I tasted mine and the one done with rice noodles and they were both great!  Unfortunately I have not been back in a few years because of the unfortunate incidents listed below in my original review but I am ready to go and give it another try!   Original Review with added notes: The RAMEN is excellent.  The owners are sweet and the ambiance is pleasant.  I gave it a low rating for the customer service. My first visit I was seated in the back and had to wait for service a lot, for long periods of time.  I didn't mind due to the gracious hospitality. (ADDED NOTE: THE CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS GREAT CONSIDERING I TOOK MY WHOLE FAMILY WHICH MADE US A PARTY OF SEVEN. WE ORDERED LIKE 4 SOUPS AND 1 SUSHI PLATE WHICH FILLED EVERYONE UP. WE ALL LEFT HAPPY AND OUR SERVER WAS NICE. SHE EVEN HAD A HELPER WITH HER.)  My second visit, was terrible. They saw me walk in and didn't offer me a menu or greet me. A second customer walked in after me and they helped that person first, instead of me.  Finally someone asked if I had a question. I said no, I'm waiting for a menu. He turned to the hostess and said "oh, why did you tell me she had a question?" and then he just walked away leaving me to wait longer.  (ONE ADDED NOTE: I had applied for a job some time before so maybe the woman thought I had just come in to check on the job but this does NOT explain why things did not improve once I told them I was actually there as a customer. NO THEY WERE NOT BUSY)  When I finally got a waiter, I already knew what I wanted, I didn't waste the waiters time. I waited a LONG (TIME) for my food until I ran out of time to eat it. THE WAITER DIDN'T CHECK ON ME AGAIN UNTIL I STOOD UP TO LEAVE. He had the nerve to ask if I needed anything. I told him I ran out of time to eat and had to leave. He didn't apologize, he just put the check on the table and left again.   I do not know if this is a place where you have to wait for them to come grab the check or if you are supposed to take it up to the hostess but he never came back so I took it up to the hostess. She just stood there, IN FRONT OF ME, drying wet cups.  I was just there for a lunch break soup. Why did it take an hour? (ADDED NOTE: I HAVE GONE BACK 1 TIME FOR TAKE OUT AND SOMEONE PICKED UP RAMEN FOR ME 1 TIME AS TAKE OUT BEFORE I STOPPED GOING FOR GOOD.)

1sCqSpRRUNNFAmzNPXTOLw.text: Happy Hour is a great Value - Good Selection and quality.  Try sitting at the bar overlooking the cooks.  Fun to watch your meal being assembled.  Also a problem when you see all the gret dishes going by....  Don't Snoh a few door down

U_DVb_qeLwgpz7fOejqJNQ.text: So far this is my favorite place to enjoy good ramen in Arizona. It was so good that I even took my mom here! (She is very hard to impress when it comes to food) She actually expected the ramen to taste like the Korean Shin Ramyum noodle packs. Surprisingly, she was very please with how well their ramen was cooked along with their fresh broth. My favorite time to go is for lunch! Their combo lunch included the ramen with a whole California roll, and the complementary bread rolls! This is way more than enough for one person. The best part is that the combo was about $8.00!

Fj9jXEjFLA24ia2uVnTlGg.text: Love CherryBlossom.  I've tried their ramen and udon dishes and have never been disappointed.  I really want to try their Italian dishes but have always been hesitant since they are considered a Japanese restaurant, but after seeing some of the pictures on here, they definitely look worth trying.  Their daily special bento boxes are always great, too, and are inexpensive.  It's definitely a smaller restaurant but they do take reservations.  Service is pretty consistent in that it is good - except for this one caucasian guy that we've had twice that never seemed into his job, never had recommendations, never refilled our drinks unless we asked and was pretty slow, but other than that, the other female servers we had were always friendly and knowledgeable.  I wish this place was closer to my house, as I would frequent it much more often.

f66gf3T0pmOEMPaM4lWr1g.text: I went to CherryBlossom about a month ago and it was a very memorable experience. It is very small, but the atmosphere was excellent, as was the service.    I had the Hot Soba Noodle Soup with Sansai Mixed Mountain Vegetables.  This was delicious!  I find myself craving this soup very frequently.    The restaurant was also very classy, and I would be happy to take family, friends, and even my boyfriend's business associates to this location.  They have happy hour prices, too.  Some good happy hour specials are a $3 draft beer, $2 California roll, $3 crunchy roll, and a $5 summer roll.  I plan to go back ASAP!

aSMHShKsTe9SgYpi11VhYQ.text: I decided to stop in for lunch since I now work in the area. Once walking in one of the servers seated me and I sat up at the counter that they have by the cooking area. I enjoyed sitting there because I got to see all the many different dishes. As I am sitting down my server (Kenny - I asked another waiter his name) asked me what I would like to drink and I just said a water. I sit down and start looking over the menu and as I am doing this Kenny is waiting on a young lady RIGHT behind me. She is asking some questions about the menu and he rudely cuts her off and rattles off some options on the bento box and she asked another question (as you could tell it was her first time there and wasn't familiar with the menu) and he rudely states "Like I just said, I told you the options." She then was trying to speak to him and he states that same sentence not once, not twice but four times in less than a minute. I was so shocked I actually turned around in my seat and looked at him! I have NEVER heard a waiter with such attitude! Maybe he was having a bad day...who knows...he proceeds to come to me to take my order and I try ordering and he CUTS ME OFF mid-order!!!! I would have like to have asked a question but I knew better!! Two more people were sat in his section and he proceeded to run to the back (as I can see from where I am sitting) and yells right in a female co-workers face about why people are sitting in his section! Why would you treat someone like this!!! I mean he was RIGHT in her face. I was so embarrassed for her even though she didn't see me noticing this. I was in utter shock at this point and one of the chefs could see this and asked me what was wrong. I told him that I have never seen a ruder employee than that and pointed to Kenny. He apologized and tried to make it better. I could tell the chef was very embarrassed as he took pride in his workstation, the customers and his service and this one employee was ruining it for everyone working around him. I tried not to let this A-hole of a waiter ruin my lunch. My soup came and that was very, very good! then about 10 minutes after my soup came he said my california roll will be ready soon. As I am done with my meal I am waiting for Kenny to come back to get me some to go containers. He walks over to get them and I noticed that two bowls stuck together when he went to get one and he threw the other one on the lower counter like he was VERY annoyed! I just was speechless at this point. Again, I talked to the chef who was amazing and made my lunch as he was very sorry for his co-workers actions.   I eat out a lot and I have never experienced this kind of service EVER! I will be actually calling and filing a formal complaint as this was unacceptable.   I will be back but refuse to sit in his section...EVER!

wMhOGk4EK2NbobsyKoa6Dg.text: Disappointing. I've been coming to here for years now and the food never failed me.  I loved it there. However,  the most recent time I've came here the service I received was absolutely horrid! What's even worst is I was so happy to show my friends this place I loved to eat at. The waiter we had was a tall white male with a naploenian dynamite blonde hair. He was so rude, disrespectful, and obviously does not care for his job. I hope management corrects this immediately or I will find another place to eat. Overall, awesome food but shitty service.

wn7Erfb86LC5kvMW5QB1Lg.text: If I could give it a 3.5 star I would. We were seated quickly, and the server was nice and prompt. My rating is more or so less based off the food experience. The bread was soft and sweet--Oh so good. The Tofu Steak came with a sauce and mushrooms which was a good starter with just the right amount of flavor. The pad thai tofu and tan tan men -vegetarian style was less desired with no variances in spice and little to no kick. I was disappointed, but it was decent it just lacked flavor which I hoped it had

RcVb7FJuN07KHfnunEw5TA.text: We go here once a week because we just can't get enough! The menu is extremely Japanese--so even the Italian dishes are going to seem a little off kilter. The food and drinks are both fantastic. I haven't tried an entree I haven't liked!  However, it is not a sushi restaurant, despite having a wide-variety on the menu. There's no open sushi bar, and the quality can be hit or miss on the rolls. I recommend going for the main entrees.

fzawzMUvvbSicEI2qSSh2g.text: Amazing. Hands down, favorite place to go all the time forever. Amazing food! Authentic and the service is wonderful. This is me and my girlfriends favorite, go-to place for dinner. Our date place. She loves the udon suki and the sushi. We've been here so many times in the past two years and the staff knows us by name. It looks creepy from the outside plaza but you walk in and it's like you're in a completely different place. Words can't describe how much we love this place, if I had a last meal before I died, it would be here. 100%

myrUMw4kT9iE0QO_5Gr5Hw.text: We needed a break from St.Patties festivities, and some food, and one of my fav yelpers Nader suggested CherryBlossom. You can't beat this happy hour.  A beer for under $3, various appetizers for $2, $3, and $4.  Nader raved about the spicy gyoza hot pot, so freaking good. I got the tantan-men, spicy noodles with minced pork.  I like pork in all it's forms, and this was good.  I'm a sucker for ramen, and this is a great place for a fix! The sushi, was ok, not show stopping. Great place for happy hour!

frlALbW0Qb8xn0XWBuLrlg.text: I came here with a friend for Happy Hour and I must say I was impressed with the food.  We had a hot pot, soba with tempura and a couple of rolls.  All were very good.  The soba stood out as "I must come back for this!"  I think the only miss was that the waitress didn't check in on us to see if we would have liked another drink before happy hour ended.  Parking can be kind of tight so I'd get here early if you can.
