Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

aVPuuj_YJa9bDNoBsMi_tg.text: Had the Tekka Don and Korean Spicy Beef Noodles. The Tekka don was a bowl of rice, cucumbers, and fresh tuna. Cost 8 bucks, but great contrast to the the noodles. The noodles were stir fried with bell plenty of bell pepper, onions, and sliced ribeye (i believe); for 10 bucks you get just the right amount of heat.

JEG0ZYK2FLBr9nAJRLNdrw.text: As a Japanese, I am very critical for Japanese food in US. However, this place is super authentic and it makes me feel like I am back in Japan! Their ramen noodle is the best! green tea cake is so delicious!! Also, I had a Valentine's day dinner course here before and it was so romantic and tasteful. This is the one of two Japanese restaurants in Arizona that I can enjoy authentic Japanese food!

UNbnIir6cTq6Ktn-qmH6FA.text: This place is amazing. You wouldn't even know it's there when you are driving by. It's in a very unassuming location, tucked back in the corner of a little strip mall. It's very small, but has huge charm. Their Pad Thai is so good. Also, though it seems like an Asian restaurant,  they also serve Italian food.  Best chicken marsala I have ever had. And they have a great happy hour. Try the potstickers, they are to die for.

XhBtAMx_aLAWwp63o5Tz4w.text: This is a hidden gem. Tucked away in a plaza, this place has very authentic food. The best part is-- they serve chinese and italian food! The pastas are delicious. They also have a sushi bar!  Near midtown Phoenix, this place is great before a show or sports event.

A8pou9C8ML69VMpl8B5Jkg.text: I'm only reviewing the pork ramen.  IT'S AWESOME!!!!  I should try something else, but can't move past the ramen.  I lurves it so much.  Fantastic flavor, yummy mushrooms and tons of noodles.

-dcPGIwtnZ2uMm15SCGkMg.text: I was craving some Japanese cuisine. Came after a long day of shopping and wanted some ramen, but ended up getting the chicken katsu curry which was surprisingly delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nom nom nom

I3h0krGbEXRMb6z3FTZUeg.text: I really like this place but today it was packed for lunch and needless to say, I was a little disappointed with the service.   We waited for a table, had to grab our own menus, waited for drinks, etc. We got our salad and sushi appetizers but no place settings.  The sushi was good, we had a Sun Roll which was on the specials board. My Hakata Ramen was tasty and my tea refills were prompt.  Good food and value. Hopefully they'll up the lunch coverage in the future.

270gQnentRS0eiKdJZk7OA.text: Been here a handful of times throughout  the years.Last night was my most recent visit. I was in the mood for noodles something..we started off with the app of potstickers in an extremely spicy broth. Holy crap this is extremely spicy hence the name of the dish.   I ordered a beef udon dish with veggies and udon.. it was okay. husband had chicken parm. Shocker! prob wont be back for awhile spent $40 bux and had better at YC's Mongolian today : )

H7pc48gXSFZ-T_4xO4DX4w.text: We saw great reviews on Yelp and decided to try this place out. It looked a little iffy with its strip mall location but we decided to throw caution to the wind.   After sitting down our drink order was promptly taken and filled. After waiting a while (a bit too long), our order was taken. While we were exact in our order, the waiter fumbled and made mistake. We called the mistake to the waiter's attention and he said that this would be taken off the bill. It was not.   The sushi was C grade. Passable but not anything I would return for.   Our order came with a green salad that resembled bagged salad. The miso soup had iceberg lettuce in it. Quite surprising and added nothing spectacular to the dish.   My ramen was poorly executed, with undercooked noodles and only a few pieces of meat floating in it. I was really disappointed as I have had really great ramen at a handful of other restaurants around the country. I was looking forward to this japanese staple, but sadly left most of it in my bowl.   I find it odd that this restaurant serves both italian and japanese food, Maybe if they focused on one type of food the flavor and presentation would improve.   We will not be returning.

g7m42t_Nbs4pK8TGOTlu3Q.text: We have been to this restaurant multiple times. The restaurant serves both Asian and Italian dishes. This is my hubby's favorite place for ramen noodles and he told me the broth is pretty close to the flavors you'd find in ramen houses in Tokyo. According to one of the employees, the broth cooks for at least 6 to 8 hours to develop its rich flavor. The pasta with squid and cod roe is also a favorite. Too bad we live so far from it, otherwise we would go much more frequently.  Be sure after dinner to stop by Snoh Creamery a few doors down. The shaved ice is creamy and delicious.

7aEAu6s_kd_730NK8mOwwQ.text: amazing passion fruit tea, and udon soup!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Udon noodle with seafood 12.40 but worth it

QKHE2QmUXZy5gZja18_Iqg.text: Love this place, discovered it by accident and have been in love since then....sushi is great, and their goyza spicy soup is the best!!!  I keep going back since is one of my favorites!!

psK9chC3ig0TsZLCr7AkYA.text: The food here is wonderful and the price is amazing! They have a beautiful atmosphere and the staff here are really nice! It's great for get togethers and parties! What I love most is their dessert! Their cakes are lightly sweet and not bland! Not to mention that their desserts are so light! If you can also order take out! Cherry blossom is truly amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kata udon and miso soup!

nRnJYfaBnlQQ2WxLJ2cK5Q.text: I first came to this restaurant with my dad and his wife a few years ago. She is from Japan and my dad works with a lot of Japanese executives and they both said that whenever friends come from Japan, this is where they go. Cherry Blossom is a very different and authentic restaurant. If you haven't tried it I definitely reccommend it. I have had noodles before and most recently tried the curry and both were great. My husband had the pad thai and enjoyed it as well. They also have some italian noodle dishes if you have picky eaters with you!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken curry
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pad thai

RCkR8uwSSFyOv9XsqDygVg.text: We just had a birthday party last night at the restaurant. It was a great experience. The services is very good and the waiters are really nice. It's a cozy place to have party with 20+ people. We pretty much take over 80% of the space.   The sushi is just as good as any other good Japanese restaurant. However, the sea food noodle soup I ordered is a little too salty. They also offer diner roll and Thai foods, which is unusual in the Japanese restaurant.   I can tell they work really hard to fill up 20+ hungry party animals. I was too full to have the dessert. Their frozen chocolate cake looks very delicious. I will visit again without the entire party.

qfFbvyREZYNQY1689TMffg.text: This place is local favorite!  Such a random menu from sushi to Italian food yet nothing disappoints!

gx4NvI8OUEozjjfCvW1V1A.text: I am so glad I found this place, the cha shu ramen was what I got, I added an egg, it was amazing. I've had better pork but the broth and noodles made up for it big time! Phoenix doesn't have a really big Asian community esp in comparison to LA and MN so I was happy to find a place with proper good noodles. I'm a noodles freak! One of the best ramens I've had.

IfXDEDVMI_LBoG3qWWz1BQ.text: No question, the few times I've eaten here the food was good - good flavor and well done. My complaint is the service is so haphazard. If you can get there when it's not busy, it's great. If you get there when it's busy, it gets a little out of control. As someone else said, there's really no place to wait. I went there this evening, got my name on the list and was told 45 minutes. It was very busy. After about 45 minutes of waiting, I go inside to check how I'm doing on the list. While waiting to check, they sat several couples who just walked in and put their names on the list (I was standing there watching). Then she suggested I would still have quite a wait left. It appeared they were just taking groups as they came in and would only bother to get people outside waiting when there wasn't a line. At an hour, I decided to go elsewhere. This is not the first time it's happened.   It doesn't really matter how good the food is if you can't get to it.

GszeqbyT6YIjLGTQZxvnNQ.text: Second time here and I just have to write a review! The service was alright, great but they were pretty busy! The food came out fast and it was pretty delicious. I love the Udon noodle soup and the shrimp tempura. It's kind of expensive but the food was really good so it was worth it. The lunch specials was still a little on the expensive side but my friend got a chicken katsu and it looked really good. I would come back again (:

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nabayeki Udon Noodles soup, shrimp tempura, and sushi lunch combo.

jVLCacOCtzAu3AD1A8l6mg.text: Hole in the wall Asian fusion noodle house that packs quite the foodie punch!   If you love noodles & tempura you'll fall head over heels for this place.   [ Must Try's ]   * Korean Beef Spicy Noodles   * Sichuan Style Spicy Tan Tan-Men     w Minced Pork  * Gyoza (simple but so good & freshly made)  * Yakiniku Beef

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried Calamari
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Korean BBQ Noodles
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tan Tan-Meh Spicy with Minced Pork

61XcrZ1blLpI6c-64aVUZw.text: High quality food in a friendly atmosphere. Step inside and it seems you have left Phoenix and arrived in Japan -- okay, not entirely, but the atmosphere is more Asian than American or European. they have a large menu with both Italian and Japanese noodle dishes, as well as sushi and other Asian dishes. The bento boxes were not on the regular menu, rather posted on a sign around the corner from the entry.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Note the maneki-niko, the &#34;beckoning cat.&#34; has both arms raised, rather unusual.
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood udon
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. California crunchy roll

KQiD0fuKkV6AmTXWMP7q7Q.text: Cherry blossom noodle cafe is a Asian fusion based restaurant, but surprised me it's kinda themed off of Little Italy and has a European vibe inside. Which makes it even surprising they also serve your favorite Italian dishes, spaghetti etc. It is also a small quiet place, very intimate so bring a date, catch up with a friend you name it! Menu is simple and to the point, lots of specials when it is happy hour time and lunch/ dinner time. I've been to happy hour a couple times, sushi and small appetizers were amazing, the special cocktail drinks were superb as well. Cherry blossom cafe will for a fact when your heart if you love rice, noodles and tempura chicken. Hey it's the simple things right? But they're done well, the restaurant also is in a good location for other options as well, but if you're in the camelback area definitely don't miss your opportunity! As always stay hungry Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Katsu Lunch Special 8.00

_ZFt9HV7ugDyWrbP4JEKDg.text: I had an ok experience here. They were not very welcoming and not happy when asked to have a couple more minutes to look through the menu. It was my first time there and they forgot the bread they offered. My friend got her Ramen first and they forgot mine. Then they tried to offer the bread again. I think the service can be better. The Ramen was ok, the chicken in it had a nice flavor to it which made it better. They have a policy of not outside drinks, which sign we did not see, we almost get kicked out by walking in with a coffee. They can be a little bit more welcoming.

pEmXfjO18VNEGDA9Qx04pg.text: Had dinner here while visiting my daughter after strong recommendation from my future son-in-law who has lived in Japan. He said it was the most authentic food he's had since living there.   Started with Gyoza appetizer, very good.  Daughter had Korean Spicy Beef and really liked it. I had Tuna Sushimi over sushi rice bowl. Very tasty, tuna was super fresh.  No complaints. Great presentation, very friendly staff, really great service. Don't remember server's name but we sat on the left side of the restaurant, front table on the left, young man. He was very attentive without being obtrusive.   Will definitely be back. Great job restaurant owner!

ZPAx721Pc_GydcMh_hu8_Q.text: This place is great! I got the ramen and my boyfriend got the pad Thai. The ramen broth was to die for!! Also, the owner (???) offered us some freshly baked bread before our meal, which we gladly accepted. The bread was delicious! Definitely coming back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My ramen! I got the Cho Shu ramen.

0P0BkurqCR0CxgmJUAhsog.text: Lots of menu items to choose from. Got shrimp pad Thai and California crunch roll, both good. Always had friendly service, though the place gets busy and parking is rough. Japanese Italian cuisine, there's something for everyone. Love their bread.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp pad Thai and California crunchy roll

8sT2kNsulipl-SDE-dHDMw.text: At last I've finally tried the beloved Cherry Blossom Cafe, and now I wonder what took me so long and when can I return! I asked for suggestions from my friends who are frequent customers, and everything came with rave reviews. In the mood for late night spice I chose the Tan-tan Men, a spicy noodle soup made with minced pork, delicious! Of course when offered more chili I dropped a spoonful or two in but only to add to the heat, the flavor was pure perfection! The prices were reasonable, the service was prompt and friendly and the menu offers so many choices, ramen, sushi, udon, miso, salads, and wait for it....Italian yes you read correctly bit unique but is that ever a bad thing..? Variety is the spice of life, when done well and Cherry Blossom has done just that and more!

QnPvnX9L-7SvAszfpP3Pew.text: This was our first visit.  Found the place located in the corner of a small strip mall.  We we're welcomed with the most delicious smell of food as soon as we entered the door!!  The place was packed on a Saturday afternoon.  We enjoyed everything we ordered...  Hakada Ramen, Miso Seasoned Eggplant, Korean Steak Iron Plate, Spicy Gyoza Soup and finished with traditional Japanese Mochi dessert.  We were told that this is a locally owned and operated restaurant.  We were very pleased to have discovered Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe for a late lunch!  I would highly recommend this place

8rKBfHBV6yXyTp65YVRpCQ.text: Small and intimate restaurant. I don't like the fact that I can hear the person next table slurping his ramen. I only come here for the ramen. It's not the best but it's decent and hits the spot.

sllHm6SVHz-zsd3KyohjLA.text: Myself and four others sat down for a tearful farewell dinner.  I had recommended coming to this place since everyone wanted to dress up in Japanese street fashion.  So viola~  Back to the good old Cherry Blossom Noodle Cafe!  I had started off with the Calpico Beer.  I don't know why I had such high expectations because it tasted EXACTLY like it sounds.  If you want to add some yogurt drink to your Kirin's, this drink is for you!  Anyways, I had ordered the Unagi rice plate.  I love sitting down to a bento full of succulent grilled eel on top of a bed of brown rice --- that's exactly what I got!    Service was mediocre on a night when it wasn't too busy!

WckHWoH9drlhYfkFK78__w.text: Great food!!! Service hit or miss but considering the small space it is understandable overall one of my new go to places!!

oSIyAyagnbIkgCog1qv-JA.text: Small restaurant tucked in a tiny shopping plaza with limited parking. Actually I believe they are part of the Tokyo Express people which is next door. Always pretty busy, but they generally get you seated shortly.   Highly recommend the champon noodles definitely one of our favorites. the cinnamon bread is awesome. Of course you can go with the Teriyaki Chicken or the New York Steak Rice Plate.  The Champon is one of my favorite soup Noodle Bowls in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Champon Seafood Noodles

wkaeOswSlZeTIe_P5VEs2A.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix. The Asian cuisine is fabulous and fresh.  The seafood is high quality and the dessert, so yummy.  He Italian dishes look authentic, although I can't help but returning for the Asian food.  The decor is quirky but the service is fabulous. Best to go early in the day as the wait-time can be considerable.

TZxN7OjCHV7ei1f_8RKFKw.text: Very nice place! It does not look like that from the outside but the atmosphere inside is warm and cozy. A small resturant but got class. A very good place to take a date. I loved the food. Service was very good.  They had some yummy desserts as well. Overall it was a good visit and I'm looking forward to going there again.

rRZmeZFgQ5Jng6w8GSAXsw.text: Amazing love their ramen, it's unappreciated. Celebrated my birthday here with friends and their chocolate cake was fantastic. Have been going here for about a year now, great for a cozy date night or to have dinner with friends. Staff is always super friendly and helpful. The pot stickers are great starters. Only thing is they run out of Italian soda flavors fast, but their that great!!

rTnO0RO5mTJSR32dl51eCw.text: This is my go to place for dessert. I only get the strawberry shortcake. I don't know what they put in there but it is simply heaven on earth. The cake is light as the clouds and the strawberries float amidst the layers in angelic bursts of freshness, not to mention that the whipped cream is well worthy to bathe in. I will say my last trip, I managed to take two slices (you can never have one) and tried the green tea cake. This may have just become the next contender for my affection. If you want indulgence without guilt, try it! I promise you will be smiling from ear to ear :)

fdiCkrwnYcj5nHuTCI5EcA.text: Came to this place on a random yelp find for lunch.  The first thing to mention is if you don't get here before noon good luck finding a parking spot.  You will need to park in the neighborhood and take a nice walk.    Walking in the front door it's a very small and quaint place with a few tables and some booth seating.    We were seated by the door and it was definitely a little warm like some of the tips said.    I ordered the Korean spicy beef.  The portion size was perfect and the flavors were on point.  Just enough spice to make you sweat a little but not burn your mouth off.  The beef was tender and had a good mix of veggies.  Over all great price and portion size for the dish.   I also ordered one of slices of blueberry banana bread which was a perfect finish to the meal.   All in all great place and I will be back for sure.

8tM0E5UciXDTym_qOHuvGA.text: Oh how I love this place! They serve everything from ramen and noodle bowls to truly fresh and inventive sushi and sashimi. You get your money's worth too! Servings are abundant and I almost always have leftovers! Service is good, and the environment is small and quaint. This spot is a regular for me. I'm getting a noodle craving just writing this review!

971PqrfDRygUJu9rjeozlQ.text: It still confounds me that an Asian and Italian combo restaurant would be so successful, but it somehow truly is. Cherryblossom is where my bf and I go when we know we want to go out but we can't decide where to go. I always get something from the asian side of the menu, and he gets something from the Italian side.  Food: I'm not sure if this is only a lunch thing, but I love that we always get bread with butter and a ginger soy salad. I love both of these things, and I rarely get them at the same time at the same place, so it's a nice little treat. As far as the Italian options go, the Arrabiatta is solid, but the real star is the pepperoncino. The spice level varies from day to day, but it's still always good. A great kick, but simple otherwise. It's a new favorite, and I can never get the bf to try anything else since we found it. I'm still exploring the Asian side of the menu--I've gotten the beef nanban (a bit sweet), nabesaki udon (standard) gomoku yakiudon (my favorite so far), and a variety of ramens. Highly reccomend.   Service: The waitresses I've had have always been so sweet! They're a little slow on the service, but they're nice and always stop by to check on us to make sure our meal is going well.  Ambience: the place is a little dark, and sometimes I worry that other patrons are forced to listen to my conversations because the space is so cramped, but in general it's a very casual, warm place.  Parking: I've never had a problem finding parking for lunch on a weekday or weekend; sometimes I have to park a little further, but it's still in the same lot! It's definitely not as tough as some other reviews paint it out to be.

rvBtRznay7oHTTJuL14meg.text: Lyrics - Modern Talking - Cheri Cheri Lady)  Oh I cannot explain Every time that I sing Or when I Yelp it's for real Take my heart  I've been hungry too long Oh I can't be for long Take a chance for ramen Take a star You need it so There's no place I'll ever go......  Cherry Cherry Blossom It's a Noodle Cafe Phoenix's where you'll find it Listen to your belly Cherry Cherry Blossom Yakisoba Noodles Always like the first time Let me take a bite  Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe has been a love of mines for all times! Ever since my move to Phoenix, I've heard of this place. As time pass and new places started to pop up; Cherryblossom was able to stand it's own ground and still pump out great dishes with consistency!  When I'm in need of a good warm noodle dish I come here. Their Ramen is pretty solid in general, but I'm more of a fan of their fried Yakisobas and my new favorite Nabeyaki Udon hot pot! Packed with a variety of seafood from shrimp, scallops, calamari, hamaguri, white fish, and vegetables; this hot pot is steaming with flavors that mom used to make, if you lived in an Asian household! This dish is definitely recommended on a cold winters day in Phoenix....like 70 or below haha!  Overall, Cherryblossom delivers when it comes to good o noodle dishes. They even serve pasta which I've ever tried. The ambiance is cozy and cute and service is quick for sure, but I can't say they're super friendly at times haha! - Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

n_tN6-_u7OUPOowDCHh4dA.text: I really love this spot. It's small and intimate. I had the Ramin with bbq pork. The flovor of the broth was amazing. There was a decent amount of pork and it was shaved so thinly it practically melted in your mouth!! There will be a wait during high time so go at off times if you want no wait times.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gpmTvUWA49BbmluMV7YMAA.text: I've been missing out. Why have I waited so long to try Cherryblossom? Really I have no idea. I have been missing out, that is all I know. In search for a great bowl of Ramen I had bookmarked Cherryblossom over a year ago. When my husband said he was craving Ramen he other night, I knew I waned to give it a go. This is a small cafe. Gives you the feel of one of those old houses, made in to restaurant kind of vibes. There was a wait when we got there, but since there were only 2 of us we were able to sit up at the small counter they had. It was attached to the kitchen so we were able to watch the cooks go nut's and make magic in their small kitchen. It also gave us a chance to see everything that came out of the kitchen as well. One of the things I saw come out o the kitchen window was pasta with red sauce. And boy was it popular. It was so popular that I almost changed my mind. But I decided I'll save that for my next visit.   We talked to a regular that was at the counter as well, he talked my husband in to the Undo Saki: Beef Sukiyaki in Undo soup in a clay pot. Ended up being a great choice. I tried a few bites. It was rich and full of velvety flavors. The noodles were a thicker type noodle. He added an egg on top winch gave it an even more rich flavor after breaking the yoke.  I went for the more traditional kind of Ramen. The Hakata: Green onion, Kikurage, and BBQ Pork. Every thing you want in a good Ramen. Lot's of warm silky broth, tons of noodles, and the BBQ pork had a nice flavor, both a touch of sweet and smoky. I also got an egg. I recommend it.   I had no idea that I would feel like I was eating out of someone's grandmother's kitchen. Like you could feel the love and put in to the food with the whole feeling like your in someone house. When you leave here you feel so content. All warm, cozy, and full from the hearty soup you just had. It was a very surprising yet completely enjoyable experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Hakata added egg. Yum.

e9a8pi-kjOPtWJmv0qpO0g.text: I had miso ramen and mango lemonade.  This was my first time with REAL ramen so I don't know how to measure it.  The soup itself was kinda weird, but the noodles had the perfect consistency.  The mango lemonade was so good... I had TWO.  The secret?  Soda water!  So good!

FG7zzoW1xKDqLToH89oW0A.text: We love this restaurant! It's the best noodles in the valley. Plus their customer service is always nice and welcoming. This is a great family restaurant and also date night spot. We'll be back for sure!

-EeGyzpyTPY08bnA-EhC2g.text: This is the best place in town for ramen! I've travelled near and far for ramen and no one else has broth like they do.   PROS: The prices are great and they serve fairly large portions of all their meals. My husband and I have been here at least a million times and we have always left full and satisfied with our meals. The best part is when you find something you like here you know it will be delicious and exactly what you were craving on the drive over. I always get the Hakata ramen. The broth is amazing. I've tried similar ramen at many other establishments around the valley and none of them come close to theirs. Their sushi is also pretty good but if you're wanting to eat the sushi before you get ramen, order the sushi first and then place your ramen order when your sushi arrives. The ramen comes out extremely fast and is best enjoyed hot (obviously)   CONS: This place is busy on the weekends so expect to wait! As long as your hunger can withstand at least 30 minutes for a party of 2-4 you should be okay! The wait staff can be slow but remember they're also very busy on weekends so it's expected. Other than that, in the last 5 years we've been coming here we've always had nothing but great food.   Overall, I'd highly recommend this place to anyone!

Oq0dyJb8v-Zf_Nv4A3uABw.text: This place was pretty good! Will definitely come back here again. Decor was that of a mix of Italian brick and Asian wood. They have an open kitchen concept so you can see the cooks behind the counter. I ordered a grilled pork belly appetizer. It came with 5 thick pieces of pork belly with a sauce and some vegetable garnishes. It was served with rolls and butter. I made a little sandwich out of the pork belly, roll and vegetable garnish.  For dinner, I got the Tan Tan Men because most of the yelp reviews talked about it. It was delicious and spicy. It was spicy soup ramen with minced pork, bok choy and bean sprouts. My sister ordered the Shoyu ramen. It was more of a traditional looking ramen with fish cakes, bamboo, slices of pork, green onions and seaweed. It had a dark earthy broth.  Service was good. Our food came out promptly. We were offered dessert even though our waiter was pulled from every direction by the time we left.  There was plenty on the menu to want to come back for more! I saw a sizzling meat plate being served before we left. I might try that next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shoyu Ramen
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tan Tan Men

cyrfEcWU2MdU7NupW_1dng.text: Just moved from Chicago to the Phoenix area and wanted Japanese. Tried this place because I was in the area and I must say I was pretty impressed. I had Pork Katsu and it was very good comparing to what I'd find in Chicago.  It was very different to see Italian on the menu as well. LOL.

v1LQGzYg5bWInyE5J6r56g.text: Staff is great and food is even better, my husbands and I's favorite dinner date place

tWgSimBiaqCKcUJ0HFEipw.text: Round up from 3.5 stars to be a solid low key dinner spot when you and hubs can't decide what to eat, don't want to go too far or spend too much money. We rolled in around 9pm, which is apparently the perfect time to go on a Saturday night according to our nice server. They ran out of bread, which was fine since this was already going to be a carb-fest. On our server's recommendation, we got the seafood udon and napolitan pasta. I had pretty low expectations based on prior reviews, but both dishes were solid winners, especially the udon. The napolitan pasta was the restaurant's vibe on a plate - a mash-up of Italian and Asian flavors which was confusing at first, but admittedly delicious.   This wouldn't be my first choice for date night, but something tells me we'll be coming here a lot. For two entrees our total was $26. Parking can be awful in this tiny lot but it was only half full at 9pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Napolitan - looked prettier before I took a bite! A little sweet and savory

Sof__mEqmC8DjW-s5WbO_Q.text: Quite possibly my favorite place to eat in the valley! The combination of delicious food, reasonable prices and relaxed vibe makes this place a must go. I do recommend avoiding at busy times because it can get quite hectic in there.    Their noodle dishes are like nowhere else..perfection. Last time in had pork Parmesan and the Korean spicy beef. Their Fried Calamari is out of this world. I have had many things on the menu and cannot decide what is my favorite. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Korean Spicy Beef!!! The best!

mo8e-S_uisuud-3GNbDONw.text: This is my favorite Japanese noodle place!  Ordered the katsu pork curry this time.  As you can see from my picture, I ate it all!   Reminded me of when my mom used to make this.  Awesome!   Also had a spicy tuna roll.  It was ok but the rice was kinda mushy.   The service was great as usual and the wait time was shorter than expected.

lMX6QuzOiAuW6hVbeB3jmg.text: We are also part of the "Why did it take so long to try Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe?" club. Well, when the weather finally broke (ish) we headed down for some ramen bowls. Both the Tan Tan and Char Shu ramens were excellent. Service was good and, while the space was a little tight, credit to the staff always being aware of the tables.   We'll definitely be going back as Phoenix sets in to winter and I look forward to checking out the happy hour.

6BNPsO9Tyi1Z-THbPQDY_A.text: Had a great lunch today...Katsu Don, California Roll and Miso Soup. All delicious.  I'll drive a long ways for good Katsu Don and this place is really good.

ahYP97OysDtaFkG54QDGWQ.text: Great food but service sucks just a little unorganized this place is good during the week when it's slow  but not a Friday night

iNpcdUwGlDbdSfARC2JO1g.text: I feel like I'm in Japan. Japanese quality. I had a dinner here last night and back for lunch today. Today I had a ramen combo. Again they "Wow" me.

WOlJ0qRlzrPOHpW7L0OGpw.text: My Korean spicy beef with Asian noodles was really great. The noodles were perfect and the beef was lean and spicy . I loved it along with the warm saki it was a great meal.
