OzI264siyyj_231BfTV4Dg.text: Cherry Blossom Cafe  I'm sure the French have a good word for it, I know I don't other than the expression, "mom-and-pop". This place is a real find!  A real one-of-kind mom-and-pop! I didn't meet the owner/operator but I bet my last nickel there is one.   How did we find this joint?  Well, every time we drive east past the area of Camelback and say, Central through 7th St., you pass Oregano's, whose consistently, quality and service are days gone by -- long gone.  (This last time I visited Oregano's, about three weeks ago, the three-card-Monty-like bartender gave me the willies.  And it took 40 minutes to get a roast beef sandwich--that's a serve-up item, bing-bang-boom,dine!  No, 40 minutes!  I mean what the fudge? They weren't cooking the beef while I was waiting!)  And every time I pass the little shopping center, same north side of the street as Oregano's, probably 3rd Street (there's a Domino's there), I always notice the Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe and think, "I gotta try that place". Well, we did, that was Christmas Eve.   The menu is Asian and Italian. Now, sometimes that's the kiss of death - two cuisines - but sometimes it's just a fork in the culinary road. It was so good I cannot wait to try other things!  We ordered 1) penne with a spicy marinara that was served perfectly hot, perfectly sauteed. Funny, it seems so obvious and so simple and yet it's been 100 years since anybody prepared me a simple dish so well.   I can tell you this: read my review of DeFalco's Italian Deli  -- it's stellar. I love DeFalco's!  But I've had spaghetti at DeFalco's 30 times and if you combined the heat of all 30 dishes it wouldn't equal how steaming and wonderfully hot this pasta was. Incredible flavor and preparation.   We took a chance and ordered the Chicken Marsala. I say take a chance because I've really had some bad representations of Chicken marsala lately, most notably Olive Garden (horrible flavor, chicken quality, too was sub -par. Flavor was just amateurish. I know, I know, it's Olive Garden!  But Olive Garden isn't giving anything away!  That Marsala was $16 bucks!)  See The Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe's very accurate description of the Marsala: "chicken breast, fresh spinach and spinach pasta with a creamy Marsala wine sauce".  Now, imagine that dish arriving at your table steaming hot, so delicious, so very fresh. While more "creamy" than "Marsala", definitely more creamy than I imagined...it wasn't at all what I imagined -- and still it was freaking DELICIOUS. And the menu description was -- IS  -- quite accurate.   If not "elegant", a word that comes to mind, I would add "professional".  The folks here know what they're doing.   They offer great food, priced right, gracious service, are there 6 stars?

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gKW_HuzNwCmFBXHc1bRmIg.text: Love ordering from this place! I like to order their salmon pasta and the chicken popcorn appetizers ! So yummy!

i32LvardpeRugxc0Gs_GCw.text: Great place to go if you're with a group and no one can decide what they want. Cute intimate setting, which serves alcohol and has an expansive menu spanning multiple cuisines.   I've been multiple times and sampled quite a few of their food options but I'll say, without a doubt, I'll be sticking with the sushi.   Not because the sushi itself is anything spectacular, just that the rest of the menu is severely lacking. Still a great place to bring picky eaters or an indecisive date! In fact thats how I ended up trying this place in the first place, and don't let the strip mall appearance fool you, this place can get packed!

B2rjQ3tirAM2z_815ft46g.text: My boyfriend and I went here a couple months ago and it was delicious. I had plum wine and a Fiji apple sake. Both were great. We decided to both get a roll of sushi. I got the double shrimp tempura roll and it was so good. After we had our sushi we ordered some ramen to share. Ended up being so stuffed we couldn't have dessert but we took some home with us. I got the double dark chocolate cake roll which was the best I've ever had. Not too sweet but also not bitter. Just perfect. They have a huge selection of fresh baked goods they make in house every day. We were simply blown away with the quality of food. There were so many choices of drinks, great food, and desserts. If you love finding hidden gems, this place definitely meets and exceeds on all accounts. You won't leave dissatisfied, I promise.

WaEoDuBTKlzh77evcp1nJQ.text: We were a little disappointed. Everything was more "average " than "great."  First we were seated in a narrow side room which was too cold and no ambiance at all. We were able to move to the main dining room tho so that was nice. The service was very good but the food did not impress us. The tempura was greasy and soggy. The seafood yakisoba was boring, flavorless, and had very little seafood - the cabbage in it was bitter and the dish did not seem fresh. The matcha tea was quite good. All in all we will check out other Japanese restaurants before we go back to Cherryblossum.

ssQfy5hlfe_152j3cponsQ.text: Yes, I'm a fan! I've been here 5 or 6 times now & really enjoy the fast service, affordable prices & of course, the food! It has deceivingly more seating than you'd think so I've never had to wait for a table. They have a decent happy hour with a good mix of sushi, appetizers & other options. I usually get sushi & some kind of noodle dish or soup. On my most recent visit I got a Philly Roll & Spicy Gyoza Hotpot. It was delicious & filling! So much so, I had to take some of the Gyoza home. The waiter was kind & very attentive. I remember one time service being slow, & they were very apologetic about it. They gave my friend & I each a free dessert to thank us for our patience. I'll never forget being very pleasantly surprised because even though it was slow going, we weren't impatient & didn't complain about it. It was nice they took the initiative to try to make it right!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Philly Roll
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Gyoza Hotpot

zHhb3kn5JVl512LQ7Ywzzg.text: I was so excited to try this place based off of all the good reviews, and I was very disappointed. My husband and I had the Shoyu Ramen, and the flavor was not like any ramen I have had. It tasted and smelled so grotesque that we only had a couple of bites each and tossed it. I will not be going back.

bHs3IE__5OVcHqJX-rPVVQ.text: My friend and I came here and sat at the bar, (best seat in the house) we where able to check out all the food that came out for new options when we come back. If you're craving good ramen , go here! ordered the Cha-su ramen , the pork was delicious . Definitely coming back

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

v96pEH-HABQXaXffxU_iHQ.text: Busy place, classy decor, quality food, great flavors, reasonable prices for what you get for your money. The sushi, which I don't eat any more as a vegetarian was always satisfying. Now that I am a vegetarian they have a sizeable menu for options, which I appreciate. Also the tofu dish I ordered last Night which was cooked in mushroom sauce was cooked perfect. The only thing that would make this place better is if it were a little quieter, perfect place for going out with friends on a weeknight and solid food for celebration dinners though.

HfI2Yy3K0afATpEz3CHqyw.text: I understand that over time cultures fuse and create new foods. However, my mapo tofu sauce tasted like an arrabiata sauce which honestly makes no sense together. They put avocado into the Vietnamese spring rolls which isn't bad. My friend was pretty happy with her ramen. That mapo tofu sauce just really threw me off.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hKE-zToSJ8lmwt0eQ8dr3g.text: My meal was delicious. I ordered ramen with an egg. Half egg for $1 extra? The restaurant was very busy. The staff is friendly and hard working. Cherry blossom noodle is definitely one of the better ramen restaurants in the valley. I'd definitely come back

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wxGRiFX6FJx4Z9Boq8rKwQ.text: I've heard a lot about how good the ramen is here but unfortunately, the ramen was more hype than what I was expecting. I ordered the cha shu ramen. While the broth had a lot of flavor, the noodles had some parts that were undercooked, which I find hard to believe for a place with noodle in the name. The cha shu was decent, but an egg is an add on, its not even an ajitama. I would be willing to give a different bowl another chance, but for now I will stick to another ramen place.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cha Shu Ramen

Y8P3v4yX49xQDLq50ES7kw.text: I was a bit confused at the beginning, I thought it was a noodle house, but the waiter served us rolls and butter while we were waiting for our food. Then I looked at the menu again and I found out that this restaurant is Asian/Japanese/Italian, hmm.  I had the lunch special noodle soup combo with sushi roll, but I change it from sushi to rice seasoned instead it was ok! The soup was  good but not wow.  My friend also had noodle soup in red sauce (forgot the name), she liked it.  We also had tofu for appetizer and was average.   Although the waiter was super nice, he brought us a strawberry shortcake as a compliment because I mentioned it was my friend's bday.  Food=average  Service =good

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strawberry shortcake was good.
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tofu appetizer
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Another noodle soup forgot the name

NsLM4QDJFZEkjpbQVhvKzQ.text: I have been waiting to bring my fiance here to try the ramen. I had been here one time before and had the tempura Udon. We arrived on a Wednesday night and this place was packed. Luckily we got in just on time before a line started to form. When you walk in the place it's pretty small and cramped but the atmosphere is great. You can see the chefs cooking up a storm and everyone enjoying their food.   As we were seated it took a little bit for us to be greeted, by the time the waitress arrived we were ready to order. My fiance and I were a little thrown off by the full menu of Italian food. I ordered the bbq pork ramen (I forgot the name) and my fiance ordered the bbq chicken ramen. After ordering, it took us a while to get our water, but we just enjoyed our time together and didn't complain. We could see the waitress was a little overwhelmed with the full house.   As we received our food, to our delight it was absolutely amazing. The ramen was cooked perfect and the broth was defiantly on point. This has to be some of the best ramen I have ever tried! I gave four starts because the service can be a little better, but the food was so great we looked past that.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Uiv9BpdhsPWuj98p-4TXkA.text: This place is always packed! To be honest, I was highly suspicious of a place that serves two different cuisines on its menu especially since I do not like fusion restaurants. This place keeps the two separate and provides consistent, good food. My favorites are the Nabeyaki Udon and Enagyu don. I will keep trying more dishes and will continue to come back.

UnYnkzDENzvo-YOdU-DykA.text: I love this place!  It is a small, unassuming restaurant but the food is top-notch. Beware of waits and busy times as it can get crazy. Service has never let me down here.  I usually get the Tekka-don, which is sashimi tuna, cucumber, avocado, and rice in a cute box. It is amazing and simple, especially if you get a side of eel sauce. My boyfriend usually tries It different ramen/udon bowl each time.  I love coming to this place and hopping next door to Snoh for a tasty milk tea after lunch/dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tekka-don

EI_AnvcW6AyeQWhvqJgWmQ.text: These idiots put fish sauce in ALL their soups and meat in everything for no good reason.  NOT vegetarian friendly!!!!

shqmRZKiK44Vtbda9_svlg.text: Very small place, small tables and tight space food was decent and pretty close to authentic Japanese food. It even smells like your actually in japan when you come in lol ramen was ok but gyoza was bland.

ilJaZXad8WBrvzPNfaX5Tw.text: Honestly everything I've had here is delicious. I'm gluten free and they found ways for me to have most of the dishes, which I appreciate.   The ramen was rich. I had a small bite of the fat Ramen noodles - not GF... but holy smokes - AH-maaaaazing!

v7xQqruPlKBhR5X-EqArjw.text: I order the chicken Marsala every time I come here and it is to die for. It never gets old to me. CHICKEN MARSALA, CHICKEN MARSALA CHICKEN MARSALA ISSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS SO DAM GOOD!!!   I dine here once in a great moon but much rather order take out and eat at home, because the seating sucks and it's always to crammed to the point you can hear the next table's convo.  I don't like to order any alcohol beverages because you don't get that much of it.  When l leave this place I smell like food. But that chicken Marsala is worth it I guess..   Parking sucks as well. This place is great tho!!

rbcewVDZ51RN4ts29cqTjw.text: We love the diverse cuisine and clientele here.  Whether you are craving Sushi, Italian, Thai, Korean, Chinese or even delectable pastries, they have a little bit of everything!  We enjoy that it is a small intimate space and the wait staff that hums about efficiently.  I was introduced to Cherryblossom by my good friend Dhargya, a former tibetan monk, who now travels the world doing massage and healing energy work.  We've been here a few times together and knocked back some sake over dinner.    This little plaza right beside Rosie McCaffrey's Irish Pub has a Nail Spa & Salon, Snoh Ice Shavery, Beer & Wine Store, Vape Store, Domino's Pizza and a Cellular Phone store, a little something for everyone.  Cherryblossom is almost always busy.  We've often had to park on the side street in the neighborhood.  Do yourself a favor and visit soon!

FwqlzXi9KsrnqflMSNBfnQ.text: They have a great sushi and Italian food menu. Their service is great. This is a great restaurant for date night or meeting associates for lunch.

mpsK8kGe0IaQXiXnBLsSow.text: The people are really nice and helpful in explaining their food. The udon was good but I wanted a bit more meat. Nice to take a banana bread for the road.

ZEa2RTBPqXeZLAS1law0Kg.text: What a great place. The place is small, so it is so cozy and comfortable. The waiters and waitresses were very polite and had a (sometimes fake looking) smile on their faces always. The menu was also very expansive.   So, about the setting, it's nice and modern and cozy. It has somewhat of a home feeling to it. Very clean and does not smell like food, which is good or bad depending on the place. This place not smelling like food is a good thing because it fits with the setting of the restaurant. A place like In N Out Burger would be great for smelling cooking burgers.   After sitting, the waiter shiuld give you some rolls and this small crunchy bread thing and butter. They were super delcious, for bread. For the food that made me full, I ordered the Udon with chicken. It was typical udon and had spinach and other small veges and chicken chunks in it. It was delicious.   I would definitely come back here because it's very very good. You should come here if you have not or come back often if you've been here before. Seriously, so great!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tempura bowl with brown rice.
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Complimentary bread
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Udon with chicken.

QQXrLjPFjgRQgMQ42MEheQ.text: This place is awesome! Definitely one of the best noodle joints in Phx metro area.  Had the spicy Korean beef noodles and the hakata ramen (salmon replaced the pork). Their eggplant appetizer was unique and delicious but was tempted to ask if they had a side of rice with it. Definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Korean beef noodles

0lU1choutIHDKWFXGT3CIw.text: Disappointing char siu ramen, not really BBQ pork, and the broth was milky and just bland. The noodles also tasted like they came out of a package. Had a side order of unagi and though the fish was tasty, it had way too much sauce and drowned out the fish. Not coming back especially after going to Harumi the next day.

zNgl5tQShkUj1zT2XHSnSA.text: We came here for the first time with our 4 year old son. We loved everything! We all shared the cha-shu ramen and a katstu-bowl. Uhhhmazing! Topped it off with the chocolate mouse with strawberries for dessert. Delish. We will be back.

Xry_LeztmUjxZnrAp5ERRQ.text: I love Cherryblossom.  The menu has Japanese and Italian dishes, ramen, sushi, alfredo, cute desserts, yummy drinks.  The pork katsu curry is delicious, their spicy ramens are good, the portions are huge! Noodles are cooked right, not over done. We've come here just to have dessert and coffee, they have a case of the prettiest cakes, mousses, and other pretty confections. Try making it down during happy hour, they have a happy hour menu with different rolls, Korean beef short ribs, beers, and other tasty things.  One of my favorite things here is the green tea mousse, but they don't always have it, so get it if you can.  Their green tea frappe is really good too, not overly sweet and fake tasting like some other places. This place is not quick, so come here when you can take your time.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4Egxzh0VfNnIO2gRApqKfQ.text: This place awkwardly offers both Italian and Asian cuisine which is pretty questionable. The food is mediocre. I ordered the shrimp friend rice to-go and it had 3 shrimp in it which was pretty annoying.

p1kAAUFMQ1uPWKN-QhVtQA.text: Really excellent service on this Sunday night.  Very cramped seating though.  I had a nice parking spot outside, which can be hard to find in this plaza.  I didn't care for how a thin hot mustard looking sauce was pooled in the middle of the shrimp shumai I ordered, but a good wipe with my cloth napkin fixed them.  They were sweeter, more fishy, VERY onion-y, and not as savory as the pork with shrimp and mushroom shumai I usually have at dimsum places.  I heard an Asian woman at another table add an egg to her ramen (secret menu!), so i emulated her, adding one to my hakata ramen and hoping for the best.  I was not disappointed!  Finally, a place that serves the egg soft boiled/poached with a liquid yolk perfect for adding richness to the noodles.  I do wish they had a shoyu or bonito-type broth besides the pork broth they use, but that's just me preferring saimin.  I do feel that service has improved over the past couple years (they had a blonde waiter a couple years back who was pretty rude).  The one time that there was an issue with my food (cooking twine from the pork) the server apologized and my meal was comped.  Their baked goods including their table bread and flan are really good.  Their ebi fry and inari are standard issue but solid.  The katsu is quite good, though not mind blowing.  Being used to Hawaiian portions means I find it a little small, but I am sure hats healthier!  I definitely recommend this restaurant.  Sometimes the wait will be long, but the food is solid.

kCjRLZ_rViZMEvy0PE1KwQ.text: I live right across the street and finally decided to try this place. I ordered the miso ramen and it was FIRE! Will be back to try more noodle soups.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Miso ramen was FIRE!

KP8NjZ1KR6b_5ER0d0hhXg.text: Been here a couple times and each time I remember why I love this place.  The atmosphere is casual and comfortable.  The staff is always friendly and prompt, even during peak busy times.  And the food is awesome.

r361uQBFDGM2Ip1PRRTaQQ.text: The bbq pork ramen is amazing! Great atmosphere and quick service. In and out in time to get back to work

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ramne

XzuAvJ9k2_id2n9LtEccbw.text: Stopped in here because I needed my ramen fix while on the road. I ordered the miso ramen which came with smoked salmon slices. It was great for the area but I've definitely had better (in Chicago and NYC) but that being said it still hit the spot. Late lunch is an insane time to go so come early (noon) and you should have a great time!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The perfect bite is crucial! (Miso ramen)

i-Dt-dPRk1-mCcDHuEazhQ.text: Decent ambience with decent service. Nothing too special. I ordered the spicy olive oil pasta with calamari and my dad ordered the pork katsu with curry. The spicy olive oil pasta was bland... had no flavor whatsoever. Literally felt like I was eating a bowl of carbs..  The pork katsu with curry was better. The curry was a tad bit sour for my liking but the pork was pretty good! My dad kept complimenting the rice, so I'll take his word for it. Overall I don't think I would come back due to the long drive but I wouldn't tell anyone not to check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interior
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bread basket
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side salad

oPlZLZ6iFiGwnE9j0xubhA.text: I was a bit skeptical given the Asian and Italian combo but everyone said this place was great and they weren't wrong. We got the seafood iron pot and the spicy beef noodles and both were awesome. We will definitely go back and will recommend it to others. It helps that it's next to Snoh too.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy beef noodles
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood iron pot

mXWOc27As5Hz-drD6p5VtA.text: This is by far the best Japanese food I've had in Phoenix. I came in assuming there wouldn't be a vegan low carb option- didn't want to bug the server but asked if she could recommend something- she was very knowledgeable about the menu and advised me on some great options. My mom and her boyfriend were extremely satisfied too.

ob8L6GNfZpCKdKlsrUjYbw.text: I ordered cha shu rame, it was okay not too special.  Maybe because I expected too much by reading the review, I feel so disappointed  with the taste especially their broth.

5_CMhXXxV2KUiN8qnXRmBg.text: I love this place. The selection of noodle dishes is amazing. A global experience for sure! First visit with my adult children. We ordered a roll, raman, a couple of fried noodle dishes, and a rice plate. The wait staff was so patient while we waited for my youngest child to arrive.  I wish our table was a little larger, we passed samples to each other, "try this!"  We will visit again soon.

_hZRgpcwm61K9-5u8F8FJA.text: Finally came to this cafe after hearing about it from my friends for so long~  Rolls were a highlight as the Negiyama Roll was a well crafted mix of green onion/yellow tail and the Ebi Roll was full of tempura goodness.   The three noodle dishes we tried were pretty good in comparison to place like mido and sushi ken but not on the five star level of eateries in Little Tokyo in LA and Japantown in SF.  Only con was that it was freezing in our corner of the restaurant but getting a hot soup can easily remedy that -  can't wait to come back and try the other things here.  Good prices, excellent food! (Also appreciate the diversity of their menu ^^)

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Negiyama Roll
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ebi Roll
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Free Bread

SICQdVChzkDbien9z2rgUw.text: This place is a cozy, humble eatery with delicious food and a friendly staff. If you live near Phenoix, or just visiting I recommend it for all ages and families.

5fpiQL92XgDcig8ky2S-gw.text: After a 10mins wait, I got to sit at the bar which was totally awesome. The food is good. I got the beef iron cast and the curry beef udon. Both were delicious and came in big bowls. The only down side was the appetizer and how they put in our food. When I ordered, I chose an appetizer which the server said it was shrimp dumplings, however, what we got were shrimp shuimai. If I knew it was shrimp shuimai, I wouldn't have ordered it because of the obvious differences between the two. This is the probably just the Asian side in me but that bothered me because they are two different dishes. As for the food order, it took us 45mins to get our actual dinner because the server didn't put the order in until 10mins after we finished our appetizer. We spent almost two hours there for dinner so that's a big drawback for me. Other than that, I do think it's a good place to eat since it is very delicious with a cozy feeling.

A1bgI8dHyG066XYKRCO6tA.text: Amazing that a cafe like this can do great sushi, Italian pasta, and ramen!  Try the low carb soy noodles in your Italian dish.  Good stuff.

ElcwWEmItqLDUPAxQm-3HQ.text: I came here for lunch on 9/13 with some girlfriends and report the following: Atmosphere - We were there for lunch and arrived around 11:45 a.m. - JUST in time to beat the rush. However, I must say that they do a great job of getting people seated in a timely fashion considering the lunch rush. Noise level was pretty average for that time of day and I can say I've been in louder places. The seating was comfortable, we were at a table right near the door so we had some good people watching. I liked the decor and lighting as well. Appetizers - We got the fried/breaded veggies (forget what they're called) and Kioza (sp?)(pot stickers) They both were really good and not too heavy. It was perfect for three people. Entree - I got the Chicken Parmesan and I must say, it is one of the best Chicken Parms I've ever had in my life. The chicken was breaded and baked to perfection; the noodles had the right consistency and although they could have done with a little more sauce and cheese, I can't say anything bad about it! Can't comment on beverages because we all had water, but some of the drinks being served throughout the place looked quite tasty. If you're looking for Italian or Asian Noodle dishes, come check this place out and if you're in the mood DEFF TRY THE CHICKEN PARM!

fP2TuK7J_sj7gom26w8QEQ.text: We went on a Friday night at 6:30pm and it was busy.  We were told there would be a 30 minute wait.  We were seated in about 20 minutes which was nice.  Our waiter was awesome.  Attentive, intuitive, and friendly overall.    The food was also delicious.  The Pad Thai definitely had some citrusy undertones to it.  It wasn't very spicy but they have a very tasty five spice chili pepper shaker on the tables that boosted the heat substantially.  The Korean Spicy Beef was very good as well.  It had decent heat and a well balanced, full flavor.   We also order some sushi as an appetizer and I admit I was a bit biased against it being any good.  Mostly because a restaurant that bills itself as  Japanese, Italian, Asian Fusion is usually not likely to have decent sushi.  I was wrong.  My wife wanted the Vegas roll.  That is a roll that I generally dislike.  It is usually over breaded, or has too much cream cheese, or various other things wrong with it.  I vastly prefer nigiri or sashimi to rolls.  In this case I was pleasantly surprised.  It had a light tempura battering and the roll itself was extremely well balanced.  I would definitely order it again.

sSfsTrsjsCNswSDoosW3_w.text: this place is wonderful! everything me and my husband have had here is absolutely delicious! everything is fresh and very tasty. great menu and a good happy hour on fridays! check out the cherry blossom noodle cafe!

rQ4VsUf2tXHfD8W_po3dDQ.text: I must say an absolute gem. Love the assorted menu, from Japanese to Italian.  The waitress was very attentive and friendly.   I definitely recommend the shrimp tempura for appetizer. Crispy and tender, the sauce to accompany, exquisite.  I would recommend this to anyone who loves great tasting international cuisine.

LdvJ8tku_yCr5C8VxWko6A.text: Ordered the tempura plate and the Katsura curry with a green tea .Everything was amazing will be coming back!

1d9cUc2VipKfogkPxdpffA.text: This place never disappoints!  With a mix of Italian and Asian cuisine there are always lots of choices.  My boyfriend and I couldn't decide so we chose one Italian dish and one Asian dish: Seafood Yakisoba and Cajun Shrimp.  They definitely did not skimp on the seafood!  Both dishes had plenty of shrimp!  I love the warm bread they serve prior to bringing out your meals as well.  CherryBlossom also always has a great assortment of desserts.  This time we had the peach cheesecake which was amazing, and highly recommended. I feel like a lot of small restaurants have slow service, but that is not the case here!  Great food and great service make this a place I will definitely be visiting again!

D8_lPpht_eKridRX2yBNgw.text: Our server Fumihiko, is such a sweet guy. He carefully explained the lunch dishes to me. I love the window table table they gave me. With the cute lil lamp. The dish I had Korean spicy Beef. Dilish..... & Green tea. It's a cute place. Gets packed at lunch, but it's worth the wait. Lunch prices so reasonable ... Bon Pettit . Saaaaaarap (Filipino 4 Yummmm) ..... I know I will be back. It's next door to my addiction Snoh Ice Savery, my summer hang out.... ^_^

HTZh177BJlaMBcrkLMM0xw.text: It was extremely cold tonight, so Jason B. and I wanted to eat something warm. So we decided to go back to Cherry Blossom for the second time, because we really enjoyed it the first time around.  The second go around confirmed it! This is a great restaurant!  We started with the Extremely Spicy Gyoza Pot. Which consists of gyoza in an extremely spicy broth! That kind of spicy that makes you talk funny! But the combination of tasty gyoza and the spicy broth was absolutely scrumptious!   For dinner I ordered the Nabeyaki Udon, Iron Pot. A well flavored broth with seafood such as, calamari, fish, clams, scallops, and the wonderful thick Udon noddles! I like my Noodles thick!   If you like Ramen, Sushi or other types of Noodles, CherryBlossom is a great choice, there is something for just about everyone.

AfDgNg7yPqy5AczOA4J-mg.text: More than the food, the place is cute. What it looks like from the outside does no justice for the inside.  Very Americanized Asian food so if you're looking for authentic... don't come here.

oLKyI9g9nUGuXLATvJPxdw.text: Ive been going here over the years.   The food is always spot on. I can't think of a visit where I left dissatisfied.   I love that I can order Italian or Asian or a little bit of both.   Last night I ordered the Orange Zest chicken and hubs got the seafood Au gratin. Both were fresh and very tasty. We also had the spicy shrimp lettuce wraps to start.They are spicy but have a great flavor.   I must echo the other reviewers about the service. GOOD LORD. Seriously slowest.service.ever. Last night we waited a good 15 minutes for our server to come back with the bill and the hubs credit card. Not cool. We've decided that when we go next time to ask for our bill the second our food comes out.

ZngEZTNt9899cwmzpHpl9Q.text: Can't beat their happy hour! Food comes out fast and fresh. Sometimes I do find that I'm looking around for my server to bring refills/the check but for $3 sushi rolls I really can't complain! The decor is not what you'd expect to find inside but who cares when the food is this good?

B18Z4yS7XcGPuOF9AvpreQ.text: It was ok. The food was pretty tasty, the service however was EXTREMELY slow, and things forgotten and duplicated that weren't supposed to be. Not sure I'll be back.

ZYbKF-TyvIVrI3Y0jL4esQ.text: I love Cherry Blossom. Love it. That being said it does have some problems. Here are the pros and cons:  Pros:  The Food. The food is absolutely fantastic. Everything is good here. I've had sushi, salads, Italian pasta, udon soup, desserts, all of it. I've never had something that was less than good and most of it is delicious. I've brought many friends and family and they agree the food is good.  The Prices. The prices are very reasonable and despite many visits we are often surprised with how low our bill is considering the quantity and quality of food.  Cons:  The Service. The service isn't exactly bad but it is frequently very slow. The servers are polite but it can be hard to flag them down and difficult to get refills especially during busy times. Also, beware because ordering sushi here is an extremely slow process. I've had friends get full meals from appetizer through dessert before I even get my sushi.  The Bathrooms. The bathrooms are shared with another restaurant and are usually quite filthy. They are also single stall bathrooms which I hate in a restaurant.  I do recommend you eat here though. The food is most definitely worth it. The cons really aren't enough to stop me. Just plan for some extra time.

qLsoEWn9X9kJf-Eq83Ih_w.text: I have been coming here for years and the food has been consistently excellent, which is a hard feat for most restaurants. I particularly love the Chicken parmesan (best in Phoenix), and Yuka is my favorite server.

P9OCdqDUhazJG-CRdQNnZQ.text: Love the prices at this place!   We had the Tofu Sukiyaki, Pan Fried Gyoza,  Banbanji, Yakiniku and Shrimp Curry. My favorite was the Banbanji appetizer. Although the flavor of all the dishes weren't out of this world, they were still good.   The portions were just right, 2 appetizers and 2 main dishes perfectly satisfy a dinner for 2. The service was very good and timely. Next time I go back , it will probably be one of the ramen bowls on the table.

og9b0t4-F5W_AzTsIq_J-g.text: I used to think they had the best tonkotsu ramen in Arizona but lately something changed. It's not as good as before. The soup tastes weaker and the meat is harder and tastes different. Also, miso soup should never come out by its self for Japanese food.

SJ_8GpFFW5PaUHXxk2b6iA.text: Cherry Blossom is my go to takeout restaurant in Central Phoenix.  Their noodle soups are cheap (~$7) and have great flavor.  I usually get the Cha Shu, which is a ramen soup with pork and a cloudy tonkatsu broth.  The "Extra Spicy Gyoza Pot" soup appetizer is also good, although it's definitely only for people who like their food REALLY spicy (believe me on this one - I have a pretty high heat tolerance)!  Other menu items are hit and miss - the Shrimp Shumai had a bizarre breaded consistency and I was lukewarm on the sukiyaki, but I liked the miso eggplant and the spicy tuna roll.  The restaurant itself is cute, and the woman who works the hostess stand is really friendly, so overall I think Cherry Blossom deserves 4 stars.

5cjLL4s39TAOYNTuYpUHqg.text: Yesterday was the first meal that I liked  at the restaurant.  All other times were marginal. I had their upon noodles.  The broth was good and lots of noodles.  The California  rolls were moist and much better .the combination  was 10 dollars. My friends liked their Ramen noodles

biD6Q9WV4MjZnn8ABEv2xg.text: The best Asian restaurant in phoenix. Perfect in any sense.  The taste of everything is just magnificent and even better when you go for happy hour. Their waiters are very nice too!

FGzp1KlHnuVCYRbmyr2jWg.text: Truly authentic Japanese cuisine!! And super cute restaurant! Service was awesome- they were busy, but you could tell that our waiter really cared, and was hustling between tables. I highly recommend this place, and we will most certainly be back soon. Oh- and also a shaved ice store is next door!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cha Shu Ramen- yum!

uJJ0nxBMPUKcTS2nS3bfkA.text: When I ate here, the food was very meh. I ordered the salmon and ramen and was pretty disappointed, didn't bother to finish it. It would've tasted better to just make my own cheap ramen at home. Maybe it was just the salmon combo that was not good. Might be worth trying something else on the menu though.

QmEvhFKelGKhir3EN76C6A.text: If half of you want Italian & the other half  wants Japanese, then this Japanese Sushi chef trained in Italy!  Randomly awesome!  Pad Thai shrimp was moist & fantastic; the Ramen noodle dishes were full of flavor & the chicken Udon was Hit with my son.  A glass of wine is only $6 (haven't seen that in years).   Comfortable, warm atmosphere.

iA6_wsrxxeipwglJJgCmSg.text: My friend John and I ate here this afternoon and we both had a pleasant experience. Our server Yuka recognized my friend John and gave him a hug. I guess John used to eat at Kirin Wok in downtown phoenix where she used to work.  She said the place closed down, but the owners still works as food vendors at events and festivals as well as private catering.  She was very attentive and gave us exceptional service. We started off with Tofu steaks with shitake mushrooms and vegetable tempura appetizers. Both were pretty good and then John got the Kitsune Udon Japanese Noodle for lunch and I ordered the Cappellini with tomato and garlic. Both were savory and delicious.  I really like this place and I wish the other reviewers would try them more than once. They have amazing dishes, a relaxed atmosphere and offer great service with a smile.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pad Thai Togu
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tofu Steaks with Mushroom Shitake
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tofu Steak

1Xhkas-gZwVwL3TzT1Xlbw.text: Probably one of the fewest Japanese restaurants that are decent in AZ.  Nothing phenomenal but it is as good as it gets out here. The prices are good but the restaurant is tight and crowded when it's busy.  It's not a relaxing atmosphere for dinner. A great spot to eat out with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caterpillar and spicy tuna rolls with side miso, salad and buns.
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork ramen, not bad
Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork katsu currey

L8wMsHBFsX3VwmEcd0i4pA.text: I've been to cherry blossom before and didn't have a good experience with it. After hearing rave reviews about their ramen, I decided to give it another try.  I was pleasantly surprised with how much I enjoyed their ramen. My husband ordered the spicy Tan-Tan with a side order of sliced pork and I ordered the Cha-shu. I liked them both and would order them again.  I really liked the broth and noodles of both bowls.   Will be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cherryblossom Noodle Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy ramen and Cha-shu ramen. Loved it!

hrp5kYht9jlJeggc_zEurQ.text: Go for the happy hour deals, come back for the great food. The happy hour menu has many choices, and selections rotate. The regular menu is huge. They do a great job at noodle dishes, sushi and entrees.

9rtItgn3-MyORc2qqsF7NQ.text: This place is one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix! I love the cute quaint atmosphere and their delicious food! Their tantan-men Ramen is the best! It's a little bit spicy, but not overpowering at all. I've also tried their tempura, gyoza, and sushi and it's all been delicious.

fhZiC2Nx7w3pjN0j3Yz7Jg.text: Cherry is wonderful for many reasons. They have a wonderful diverse selection of things one can order. The issue every time I come here is that I can't decide on what I want! Everything is truly very good, I love the sushi and the ramen especially! The place is very affordable as well. The staff is friendly for the most part but they do get quite busy. When it's busy sometimes the server won't check on the table for a significant amount of time. Food-wise this place is a must but they should strive to have better service.

8olniH90Ppi2Z7YG1ogz2A.text: My favorite place for good food in Phoenix. Good parking, great service, excellent menu choices and every bit of it well prepared and irresistibly tasty. This time we added some cold unfiltered Sake to go with a vegetarian roll, seared Pork Belly and spinach pasta with spinach and salmon in a cream sauce. Finished with chocolate, chocolate, raspberry cake...waddled out to the car and smiled all the way back to the hotel. Our server never stopped smiling...we had to ask him to turn up the lights so we could read the menus. He did and when we were finished, turned them back down. There are a number of reasons this place is a favorite but most of all, the food and service are outstanding.

hL0NF6hj09pBwZ7QfvSo0g.text: Best noodles in all of town, HANDS DOWN. Whether you're looking for a traditional Italian cuisine or classic Asian style, this is the place to go. It's a cozy, hole in the wall type of restaurant that has yet to disappoint us. My go to is the Shoyu Ramen, but have tried many others on the menu, Korean beef plate is also to die for!

umTfIiSPaHk2LicrqA0z1g.text: I love this place!! Best food always!! I had the shrimp with penne and melted mozzerela... OMG.... The sauce was amazing!! Our service was excellent .... Young brunette with Dreads....Oh! And I love my food steaming hot!! It was hot till the end!!

eBG7OVAHfvaYEUz2C3hHzw.text: This place was once a favorite...  Disappointed with our experience once again. It seems like the food is becoming more bland and the service is nothing to write about. I don't suggest getting the pan fried pot stickers, Pad Thai, or the chicken salad.   Go for happy hour, go for lunch. The price matches the quality during that time.

ASAjHQXktp6omQ2EfzHsVA.text: We have been to cherry blossoms a couple of times and it's been ok. This time, the waitress was completely inattentive. I asked for a tofu substitute in my miso soup (first time trying it). The waitress said no problem.  The soup wasn't that great to begin with but when I get the bill, they added a surcharge  of $2.00. For what I know, salmon which is included in the soup is a lot more expensive than tofu! It wasn't the money, it was the fact that I wasn't informed. I certainly wouldn't have paid $12 for ok soup. When I told the waitress, she said that's our policy. Won't be coming back. From reading other reviews, it seems like the restaurants ego is getting out of hand. They think they are better than their customers.

tMXciAeTH9hgOZa4_PTQWg.text: I came here with a group of 5 friends tonight - we were all floored!  Everything we ordered was absolutely fabulous :)  I personally had the salmon spinach pasta - highly recommend it.  This place seems to be very popular on Friday nights so be prepared for a long wait (both to be seated and for your food).  But don't worry, the food is worth the wait!

PwN9TAJbmnJV46GgRhpCBw.text: I'm always so pleased with this restaurant. I've been coming here for 10 years now but never reviewed. My favorite items are the ramen and udon noodles/ sushi is delicious too!! I even like the warm bread that's complimentary. We ok always be a fan of this place, come check it out!

6oqCcCBvfg22UV6_-i0h4A.text: Took my kids  We had the Negi-Hama, Spider, Alaska, and Rainbow rolls  The size of the rolls was perfect, and the flavor was amazing  A very good value, would certainly go again

ja8MC10tGDOGHtXgHcSY8w.text: Best Ramen in Phoenix so far..we come here often and the food is legit delicious Japanese cuisine. Gyoza are delicious too.

vIjvsUnsnZuAyCCTiGY5Rw.text: I've been meaning to review this place for a while. We stumbled upon this joint by accident and I'm so glad that we did! We haven't been here that the place wasn't bustling with people, even at 9 at night.  They do a great job of getting you seated with tables tucked into every place possible.  Everything is fresh and full of flavor. We try something new each time and it has never disappointed.

FTDzOq8p-VkvJveewzJmjQ.text: The food is spectacular! The only thing is because it is such a small place, it's takes a while to get the food out. Another thing is the seating. It is very small so every table is really close together. Other than those two things, cherry blossom is so good! The food is great, the atmosphere is great, and the service is great as well!

2Rq99rWUNugmj1A76n8CSg.text: My favorite Sushi place. Especially great for first timers since they do have a broad menu outside of sushi. The ambiance is great as well. Perfect for dates or just passing time with friends.

FyvWMjFG84Li6ysntdpqlw.text: I would have never eaten here if not for my boss!  Best udon soup ever.  My only complaint is their service is extremely slow 90% of the time.  One Tuesday night we were there for 2 hours for dinner.  Unacceptable even if you are busy...

V-25DXAOLm2hJtd2cVEGoQ.text: When a waiter takes an order by memory, his accuracy must be 100% or he opens himself up to criticism.  Guess what?  He forgot an entree.   There were just 2 of us and 4 dishes between us.  He apologized after delivering the dish about 20 mins after the others came, telling us the kitchen was backed up. If that was the case, why were the other dishes on time and why did he act surprised when we reminded him of our missing dish? Just own up to it! Btw, he ended up comping the dish.  Portions were not huge, so take advantage of the low prices and double up on your orders!

-h8SDG1X7uC6ctLYCrMv6w.text: I'll perhaps never understand the popularity of this restaurant. Not impressed with the ambience or menu. It always seems packed and loud, with tables squished into every odd space, even into the entryway! I was shocked to find as many mixed-cuisine items as I did. Seems as if interesting or authentic items were pushed aside in favor of more "American-friendly" options. Not only was the sushi mediocre, overpowered with sauce, and timid in its use of fish, but overpriced for its quality, some of the most disappointing in memory. I can't speak for the noodle dishes, however, though a friend ordered some and was satisfied. Perhaps it's the noodles I'm missing in this equation, but I'm unsure if it's worth another try.

Zig2nOkWGOrLJRDEX15hug.text: I recently came since people I know have been raving about this place for awhile. It certainly did not disappoint either. The ambiance is very authentic and mellow that seriously sets the mood when you eat. The place is a hidden gem among the crazy traffic that goes on Camelback and crazy parking with Oreganos restaurant filling up the spots aside. The food was amazing and this is my first time trying ramen from a restaurant. I had the gyoza as an appetizer and hakata ramen as my main plate. Both live up to the rave of this place and definitely will have me back soon enough.

kgp8PMkWRO3QlSksGNXWFA.text: So...I love this place. The Extremely Spicy Gyoza Hot Pot sold me on this place the first time I went and I return over and over again just to have it. That said, I've tried relatively few things.   The sushi is fine, not amazing. I like it enough to order it most times I go but I wouldn't go there just for sushi. The lettuce wraps with shrimp and vegetables are good but messy to eat since they are served with thinnish romaine leaves rather than the round butter lettuce leaves most places use.  My husband gets the pasta every once in a while and loves it.  I've tried his plates a couple times and I think it's good, not great, but that could be because he drowns it in shredded parmesan and I can't taste the real flavor it came out of the kitchen with.   Next time I will get Tan Tan Men. Other Yelpers have raved about the Ramen and, although I've never tried it, I expect it to be delicious because it's made with the same soup as the Extremely Gyoza Hot Pot which, as I already mentioned, I LOVE.   Now for the not so good...(but not so bad either)... The last time we went we sat at the bar for the first time. Like other reviewers, I definitely recommend sitting at the bar if you can for two reasons: 1) when the place is busy, which it often is, the food takes a while to make it to your table and being able to watch the cooks provides a bit of entertainment to make the time pass quicker; 2) there's more space at the bar than at the 2-person tables. We usually feel pretty cramped at the 2-tops once we have drinks and an appetizer on the table but there's a little more elbow room and room for plates and drinks at the bar.   However, sitting at the bar has a downside also...when you can see the cooks putting all the plates together, though it's entertaining, you can also see all the things they touch without wearing gloves.  I've never been sick after eating here and I will continue to eat here frequently despite having seen all this, but it does make me pause to think a bit when I watch a cook dip his bare hand into some seafood (which he throws into a pan presumably hot enough to cook off any germs) and then wipe his hand on a repeatedly-used wet towel as he grabs a bunch of lettuce leaves for a salad plate (without any heat to cook off germs) that goes directly out to the customer. Admittedly, I don't know much about proper food handling and what's ok and what's not, but bare handed food touching always weirds me out a little.    That said, the food is delicious. It does take a while to get from ordering to eating but the cooks are hustling so I can't complain. Try the Gyoza Hot Pot. It's awesome. 5 stars without the wait and bare (but potentially clean-ish??) hands on food.

r8izPc83hf4Idp3y_wtSUQ.text: Excellent food! Sushi is perfection, the different selections in noodles is spectacular! Not to mention the staff are super friendly! I come in at least once a month if not more. Make it a must eat place in central Phoenix!

u_zH65hoNu3HHMfyaVP6eg.text: I'm in love. This cute little cafe is hidden in an equally small shopping strip mall. Parking is hard to come by if visiting at peek eating times.  My husband brought me here for the Ramen. Noodles are a comfort food to me and I was stressed out about an interview. The food was fantastic! The waitstaff was friendly and bustling everywhere.   The ramen is perfect! I'm pretty sure that the only way to get better ramen is to be in Japan. My husband had a traditional bowl and I went for a spicier version with wider noodles. We also added a spicy tuna roll (large enough for two) and a plate of pot stickers. Everything came out fresh and hot, there was both silverware and chopsticks available (for which I'm grateful....I'm still learning to handle chopsticks), and even with the snug seating arrangement (I could have reached over and snag food off my neighbors table) it never felt rushed or uncomfortable.   Also, this cafe is one of those strange combination fusion restaurants. They've combined Japanese with Italian. We didn't try any of the Italian food, being there strictly for the ramen, but the place was bursting with people ordering huge plates of noodles with red sauce.   If this place were closer to my home, I'd have to make a special budget item for eating there regularly.

XnH6OTiEBqMzIsTKf864Dg.text: I loved it.  I am obsessed with soups.  Especially anything Asian, noodle and "pho-like."  I got the salmon miso ramen soup.  It was fantastic.  I had them add some spinach to eat.  Very healthy and yummy.  I am telling everyone about this place.

YBePHYZ_m6c1iAFnPOHexA.text: I go through phases where I eat nothing but CherryBlossom. Which would be concerning (and maybe a little sad) if they weren't so good. They're also fantastic for casual date nights, and several of our friends have gotten hooked after we brought them here.  Absolute Must-Tries:  Baja Norte Roll - Super-refreshing jalapeno with cool dipping sauce. Extremely Spicy Gyoza Pot - Listed as an appetizer, but big enough for a meal.  Cha-shu Ramen - Anything with BBQ pork here is a winner. Ditto with anything ramen. Tekka-don - Slightly sweet and citrusy tuna bowl. My friends always steal mine. Yakiniku - Perfectly tender Korean beef on a sizzling plate.  Iron Pot Udon - Seafood and beef are both fantastic. Spaghetti Bolognese - My partner sees me check in at lunch, starts craving this, and drags me back for dinner. Dessert - Look at that cake and tell me you don't have room.  Banana Bread - The answer to every question about hidden gems in Phoenix.  For a noodle place, I'm never super impressed with their yakisoba. I still order it sometimes, and you should try it, but it isn't the absolute best thing on the menu.  The owner and waitstaff are super friendly, but service can be slow, especially when it comes time for the check. If you have a show to catch, definitely ask for the check with your meal.

0s90bLXRaiRVAXT-NBReMg.text: An unusual combination of Asian and seafood/Italian pasta, but it works!  Small, cramped restaurant which apparently is always busy - which I can understand. This is a small neighborhood restaurant, which has been around for quite a while. But the service was pretty good considering the crowd. I did have to ask a few times for water, and one person in our group had to wait longer for her entree than the rest of us.   But, oh my, the food was DELICIOUS!  I had the Cajun soft shell crab appetizer, and the Calamari/Garlic/Anchovy/Marinara pasta, both were yummy. I also had a taste of my friend's Nabeyaki Udon noodle soup - full flavored, full of mixed seafood.  I finished with the blueberry cheesecake - not your typical cheesecake, it was a baked cake with layers of cheese, graham crackers, and blueberries, topped with a bit of whipped cream.  I will DEFINITELY be going back.

jWL5tMZ3liDJDkNowFvzmg.text: Amazing food and service. Sushi was fresh and dishes had so much flavor. Will definitely come back again. Came here because of yelp, and wasn't disappointed :)

E-8nII0FoOQIqcWVGXZlQQ.text: Thank you to Becca and Dave H. for getting me to go to this restaurant. Yes, it had been on my bookmark list for over a year. Yes, every time I went by I said 'I want to go there!' And, yes, I did browse their menu online on several occasions and yet...I never went here. Well, when I got a text from Dave inviting us there, I knew it was time. Boy was I happy! The food here was great. They brought out bread at the beginning of the meal (which is very strange for an Asian noodle place), but the bread was good, especially the cinnamon toast..yum. I ordered the spicy gyoza soup on happy hour for only 5$. It was large enough for two meals and had tons of flavor. The gyoza was nothing special, but the broth was amazing! So spicy and flavorful...it was awesome. I got to try Becca's Tantan noodles (or something) which was spicy noodle soup with ground pork.....ohhhhh definitely what I would get if it weren't happy hour. It was so delicious, similar to the gyoza soup, but with more smokey flavor. It was wonderful. The two guys got the beef curry noodle soup which was odd, but in a good way. It had a middle eastern flavor that was really delicious and something I had never tasted before. It wouldn't be something I would order, but it was very good. The prices were also reasonable, about 10$ pp. Needless to say, I will be back without hesitation!

t-9sxBKm8j81slvgH5Jtwg.text: Had the Korean spicy beef and a rainbow roll.  The rainbow roll was very good and the Korean spicy beef was ok at best. Ate here a couple years ago for lunch and remember the food was a lot better then this week.

FASgYuXg6qTXBVCAKSswCw.text: Every times I went to Cherry Blossom, I always had rice or pasta plates. Then last weekend, I went there again for noodle soup. Now I can say that all the menus there are delicious.  The atmosphere is cozy and the staff are so friendly.  Beware of the leg on the front door during the haloween...heeheehee...

hRn8F0CJWM_O3hXadVj5bA.text: I went here with some friends a couple weeks ago at about 830 pm. It was great. I asked the server what he would recommend to me and he said the Pad Thai with chicken. I ordered the Pad Thai and it was delicious. The server was very friendly and helpful.  We came back a few days ago at about 430 pm and I was not as impressed. I ordered the Pad Thai again, but I was not happy with the server we had. She took forever to get our drinks and was not the friendliest. She also took my husbands soda while we were eating to refill it and took forever to bring it back. It was not even empty yet. I like the Pad Thai, but there is nothing else very appetizing on the menu for me. I would come back for the Pad Thai.

aO1CcXmfmCdChao-xm55cQ.text: We had our first visit at the recommendation of a friend who had the foresight to get reservations.  Good call because the line was out the door.   We were seated quickly, and we ordered soon after since we had previewed the menu online.   The food took quite a long time to come out which was disappointing because our reservation was at 7:00 pm, so dinner was already late.  They offer a bowl of bread, but we had to remind our waitress several times to bring some for our table. Service was pretty much the same the whole evening when asked for spicy sauce, sweet n' lows, refills, etc.  The food was pretty good.  The sashimi salmon was fine, but the spring rolls and the spicy salmon roll were perfection.  The miso soup was not like other miso soup I have tasted, but it was good, even though it had a ton of green onion. Overall, the food ranged from fine to wow, but I do not think we'd go back again due to poor service.

MMbLbvF-L2aPWi-1TijJdQ.text: Went here for mothers day a couple of years back and was so happy at the diversity of menu options. My mother loved her Italian meal, and I enjoyed my miso soup. The deserts are also very rich and sweet too.
